### /Metal ###################################################################

/Metal/
COMMENT: Metal's own comments are denoted by (TH). All of his comments are
         taken from Past'n'Present.

/Metal/2_Jingles.sid
COMMENT: "Made with Newplayer v11.
         Then first jingle in this tune is a conversion of a little tiny tune,
         that I heard in a commercial for a radio-show (something about books I
         think). Well, the other jingle was just something I did." (TH)

/Metal/3_Monkeys.sid
COMMENT: "Made with JCH Newplayer v20.
         My latest and probably last tune. It's the result of my efforts to
         create a tune that was to compete at the open-competitions at
         Demobit'96, but as we all know that party was cancelled, so I had a
         tune without a destiny... Well, guess not as Jazzcat wanted it for
         Domination. It was used in the DOMINATION #8 outfit." (TH)

/Metal/Abnormal_Intro.sid
COMMENT: "Made with JCH Newplayer v9.
         This tune was made for an Abnormal intro, but I think it was used by
         Walt in one of his many parts for Bonzai." (TH)

/Metal/Ashtira.sid
COMMENT: "Made with JCH Newplayer v20.
         This tune is partly influenced by the tune 'Pigebluse' by Laxity -
         however, the tune is way different than the original and it has an OK
         ending with some nice bass-lines and chords. The tune was first used
         in a Unifier-part for Flash Inc. Don't ask me about the name - I'm
         lousy at remembering titles..." (TH)

/Metal/Axel_Fjols.sid
  TITLE: Axel F [from the movie Beverly Hills Cop]
 ARTIST: Harold Faltermeyer
COMMENT: "My first try in the Music Assembler. I think this tune was made about
         the same time when Drax made a version of Axel F. in the NP-V14. "
         (TH)

/Metal/BZ_eren.sid
COMMENT: "Made with Newplayer v14.
         This tune was supposted to be featured in Lethal Display 4, but the
         tune didn't fit the part at all and instead Walt used an old
         JCH-track. To my knowledge it has never been used." (TH)

/Metal/Basmania.sid
COMMENT: "Made with Newplayer v13.
         This tune was made back in 1990, when I was in Contex and was featured
         in my Music-Collection #1, which was mysteriously lost in the mail
         when I sent it to Flex. Also it disappeared from my own disks... I
         guess it just wasn't meant to be. Anyway, Trap found this tune useful
         for a screen in Lethal Display 3." (TH)

/Metal/Beachfunk.sid
COMMENT: "Made with JCH Newplayer v9.
         This is the second tune I ever made in the NP-players, and it was made
         on the very same day that I received the pack from JCH with the
         player. This tune has never been used listen and you'll know why.
         Composed on a shiny day in the early autumn of 1989." (TH)

/Metal/Bezerk.sid
COMMENT: "Made with JCH Newplayer v20.
         This is one of my better house-tunes, I think. It has some annoying
         parts, which I would have excluded today, but that was then and I did
         it this way..." (TH)

/Metal/Bladan.sid
COMMENT: "Made with JCH Newplayer v17.
         A short little tune. I don't think it's ever been used." (TH)

/Metal/Boneyard.sid
COMMENT: "Made with JCH Newplayer v20.
         A try to make something laid back acid-like jazz, without really
         succeeding. The end is probably the most interesting thing about this
         tune. Quite unexpected." (TH)

/Metal/Bonziied.sid
COMMENT: There may be more covers in this file.
         "Made with Newplayer v15.
         The main tune of the Bonzai demo Bonziied. I made this tune at a
         Bonzai meeting at THA's place in 1990. I got inspiration from Fox,
         Trap, Walt and Dize for the themes in the tune. However, there are a
         few sequences which were converted from the tune in Rebels legendary
         Amiga-demo from which we got the inspiration. I think Static/Rebels
         did the original tune..." (TH)
  TITLE: Itsy Bitsy Spider (0:34)
 ARTIST: Traditional
COMMENT: Folk song.
  TITLE: Wedding March [from A Midsummer Night's Dream] (0:46)
 ARTIST: Felix Mendelssohn Bartholdy
COMMENT: The song played at weddings.
  TITLE: Smoke on the Water [from Machine Head] (1:07)
 ARTIST: Deep Purple
  TITLE: Lambada (2:06-2:34)
 ARTIST: Kaoma
  TITLE: Popcorn [from Music To Moog By] (2:49)
 ARTIST: Gershon Kingsley

/Metal/Bordella.sid
COMMENT: "Made with JCH Newplayer v20.
         At some point in time you get to compose a tune that you feel is your
         best. Well, this tune is one of those tunes I've done which I like the
         best. I guess I was a bit inspired by Jeroen Tel, but then again,
         ain't we all... :) It was used in... a Flash Inc. demo, I think... Or
         was it never used?? Err... whatever." (TH)

/Metal/Burner.sid
  TITLE: Happy Birthday (0:00-0:12)
 ARTIST: Mildred J. Hill
COMMENT: "Made with JCH Newplayer v9.
         Burn some rubber, baby!! Another one of those really old tunes..."
         (TH)

/Metal/Camel_Funk.sid
COMMENT: "Made with JCH Newplayer v20.
         Sitting at my keys I played these chords. Anyway, I converted this
         tune to the PC and put it together with 2 other themes making the
         Trilogy on the PC. Trilogy made it to the 2nd place in the
         multichannel competition at X96 and I got alot of feedback on it. Go
         get it - it's on the Vibrant's Homepage." (TH)

/Metal/Cock-Cut.sid
COMMENT: "Made with JCH Newplayer v20.
         Naughty naughty naughty title... Rather unpleasant really. :) Anyway,
         this tune is a partly inspired by a real tune, which most Danes know
         for sure... Yep, it's 'Take no crap' by Cut'n'Move. The rest is
         basically something heard a zillion times before..." (TH)

/Metal/Contex.sid
COMMENT: "Made with JCH Newplayer v9.
         Ah, this one was an attempt to do something like the ANM-Intro tune,
         but I failed... And, of course, Contex never used it - they didn't use
         one single tune of mine." (TH)

/Metal/Crack.sid
COMMENT: "Made with JCH Newplayer v20.
         As far as I recall, this tune was meant for Deff/Avantgarde to use in
         a crack-intro. To my knowledge it was never used though." (TH)

/Metal/Cream.sid
  TITLE: Digital Mugician Demosong 1 [from the DIM Amiga music module] (00:00-00:43)
 ARTIST: Ramon Braumüller (Ramon)
COMMENT: "Made with JCH Newplayer v17.
         Oh yes, the wonderful cream. This tune was used in a part in Lethal
         Display 4, coded by Ricky." (TH)

/Metal/Creative.sid
COMMENT: "Made with Newplayer v12.
         Another tune converted from the fab Walkman. It was used in a few
         Hotshot issues + some other productions including Lethal Display 3."
         (TH)

/Metal/Deaf_Deff.sid
COMMENT: "Made with JCH Newplayer v20.
         Ahh, this is the awful tune Deff forced me to do for him. As I
         mentioned in the text for the tune 'Sidekick', this tune is kind of
         sequel to that one. I only think that this tune stinks alot if
         compared to 'Sidekick'." (TH)

/Metal/Diane.sid
COMMENT: "Made with JCH Newplayer v17.
         A lot of people seemed to like this one. Strangely enough it has never
         been used. Hmm... Well, I did an Amiga version of this tune as well,
         but it disappeared when I got rid of that lousy piece of junk."
         (TH)

/Metal/Dixie_Jazz.sid
COMMENT: "Made with JCH Newplayer v17.
         I made this tune at the Dexion party in Odense, Denmark at Xmas in
         1990. I made it on an old computer and I used earphones - when I got
         home it sounded like crap... Typical... Since then I've never composed
         anything at a party. BTW, I composed it for the intro of Lethal
         Display 3, but the demo was completely re-done after the party, and
         the intro-part was kicked along with my tune. Can't say I disagree."
         (TH)

/Metal/Dovne_Ged.sid
COMMENT: "Made with Newplayer v11.
         Wasn't meant to be packed, but when I went through my work-disks I
         found it, and as it was practially finished, I simply packed the damn
         thing... It was never meant for any particular production." (TH)

/Metal/Drughouse.sid
COMMENT: "Made with Newplayer v15.
         Inspired by the Ghostbusters theme I came up with this house-version
         of the tune - well more or less... I liked it back then, but today
         it's way too flat." (TH)

/Metal/Einstein.sid
  TITLE: Einsteinium [from the Amiga MOD module]
 ARTIST: Einstein of Upfront
COMMENT: "Made with JCH Newplayer v18.
         Another tune which I converted from the Amiga. This time the tune was
         composed by Einstein - musician, who I regarded as one of the best
         during my years on the Amiga." (TH)

/Metal/Emotions.sid
COMMENT: "Made with JCH Newplayer v20.
         Again an old tune I located on my work disks. I made the tune in 1992
         and added a few modifications in 1996." (TH)

/Metal/Eurobarbie.sid
COMMENT: "Made with JCH Newplayer v20.
         Kind of a sequel to 'Jump Around', as it features a lot of the same
         stuff. It has a tiny bit of PVCF to it (ARFGHHH!!)....... Excuse me, I
         have to Vommit! It must have been a mistake. Did I do that... Hand me
         some valium... NOW!... Someone PLEASE erase this tune... Turn it
         off... Delete... DO SOMETHING!" (TH)

/Metal/Flaciied.sid
COMMENT: "Made with Newplayer v13.
         This tune is kind of a cover of a Reyn Ouwehand tune he had done in
         Music Assembler - well, the chords are the same..." (TH)

/Metal/Flopper_2.sid
COMMENT: "Made with JCH Newplayer v20.
         A tune, which I did just before my old C64 burned out. The tune got
         lost when I moved to Aalborg, but fortunately Syndrom had the tune."
         (TH)

/Metal/Funcommie.sid
COMMENT: "Made with JCH Newplayer v20.
         A tune building on the chords used in the last part of my PC-tune
         called Trilogy. The tune however is totally different." (TH)

/Metal/Fusion.sid
COMMENT: "Made with JCH Newplayer v20.
         This tune was completed just before the Sams0 party in Denmark during
         the summer of 1992. I got Steve/ex-Xfactor to deliver this tune to the
         music competetion - however, I've never heard nor seen any results
         from that party, so I really haven't got a clue as to how it did...
         The tune itself is a combination of early C64-techno and some strange
         stuff - hence the name 'Fusion'!" (TH)

/Metal/Garrison.sid
COMMENT: "Made with JCH Newplayer v9.
         Another one of those early tunes in the NP-players, which really don't
         need any comments..." (TH)

/Metal/Gedefims.sid
COMMENT: "Made with Newplayer v14.
         This is probably one of my most used tunes. Back in 1990, when it was
         made, I think it got used in 3 or 4 demos. The tune was composed
         immediately after listening to a Charles Deenen tune for some
         race-game (forgot the name). I made a conversion of it on the Amiga,
         which never got released." (TH)

/Metal/Geologic.sid
COMMENT: "Made with JCH Newplayer v20.
         Ahh... Mot many liked this tune I guess. I didn't get much response to
         it, when it was in Skyhigh #19 - perhaps it was caused by an error in
         the coding of the outfit which caused the tune to sound like crap... I
         guess you could say this tune was heavily inspired by Jamiroquai."
         (TH)

/Metal/Gravoel.sid
COMMENT: "Made with JCH Newplayer v20.
         The title for this one is also Danish and means funeral-beer... It was
         actually an attempt to do something in a similar style as JCH.
         However, I think this tune without any doubt is 100% Metal. The tune
         has never been used - not to my knowledge anyway..." (TH)

/Metal/Groovin_High.sid

/Metal/Hotshot.sid
COMMENT: "Made with Newplayer v15.
         I did this tune exclusively for my pal Morpheus/Flash Inc. for his mag
         Hotshot. I think it was used in 2 or 3 issues in the intro. This tune
         is not the one used in Hotshot though, as I changed the filters a bit.
         Hot V2.0 is the 'real' tune. Anyway, I thought this should be included
         as well as I bothered to spread it." (TH)

/Metal/Introjam.sid

         Another tune from 1989 which was meant as an intro-tune for Contex,
         but it never made it, and I think to this date it's never been used."
         (TH)

/Metal/Jensemand.sid
COMMENT: "Made with JCH Newplayer v17.
         I kinda named this tune after JCH, not that the tune itself has
         anything to do with him... It's just like with most of my work - fuck
         the name, it's the tune that counts." (TH)

/Metal/JozzMatazz.sid
COMMENT: "Made with JCH Newplayer v20.
         A tune, which Johannes Bjerregaard has been composing in the
         MIDI-format. It's fairly different from what Johannes usually did on
         C64." (TH)

/Metal/Jump_round.sid
COMMENT: "Made with JCH Newplayer v20.
         Sitting at my synth I came up with these chords, and thinking
         immediately that they would suit a house-tune just perfectly I did
         this tune. It's fairly simply, but then again so is all house-music.
         It has a catchy theme though I think. Lion/Chromance used this for the
         intro for Domination #8. The tune was supposed to be exclusive, but
         then suddenly out of the blue an old AVT-project called 'Icarus'
         surfaced, and as my tune was first intended for that production I was
         quite annoyed by this. Who thought an AVT-production would turn up as
         a Padua*Hitmen production. Oh well, fuck that." (TH)

/Metal/Kedsomehed.sid
COMMENT: "Made with JCH Newplayer v9.
         A tune inspired a bit by rock'n'roll. Anyway as far as I know it was
         used in an Abnormal crack-intro by Stone, I think - however they
         screwed up the credits as it was credited to Torben Larsen instead of
         the correct Torben Hansen or simply Metal... But who cares about that
         now..." (TH)

/Metal/Koeleskab.sid
COMMENT: "Made with JCH Newplayer v20.
         I made this tune in December 1991 especially for the upcoming Lethal
         Display 4, but I ended up delivering if to Steve/X-factor, as he had
         just started his software label called Imagination Developments. So,
         at The Party 1 in 1991 he got the finished tune and plugged it into
         the demo, which was then released... Syndrom liked this tune so much
         that he did a 90% copy of it. He explained to me later on, that he did
         it to gain experience, which is OK my me, but unfortunately it got
         used in game for which Syndrom got some money... Anyway, we've
         straightened that out long ago. BTW, the title means Fridge." (TH)

/Metal/Legoklods.sid
COMMENT: "Made with JCH Newplayer v20.
         Haha, well, this tune is basically built totally on one of my other
         tunes, namely 'Geologic' - the chords are the same, but the rest
         differs. Exclusive for DOMINATION #9 Magazine outfit." (TH)

/Metal/Lethalic.sid
COMMENT: "Made with Newplayer v14.
         Made this especially for the intro-sequence of Lethal Display 3,
         however, I think my work was a total waste considering the final
         result of it. Anyway the 3rd tune is ok." (TH)

/Metal/Mon_iacs.sid

         Inspired by Jeroen Tel's tune for Tintin on the Moon, I sat down and
         put this together in a relative short time. I got a lot of good

         was used in Lethal Display 3... or at least it's been used in some
         other demos." (TH)

/Metal/Note-It_2.sid

         This tune - as you may be able to hear - has a few sequences similar
         to the ones in Note-it 1. That's simply because I built this tune from
         Note-it 1 - adding some other chord-theme and yet another note-tune
         was done... I should probably never have released these 2 tunes as I
         really think they stink..." (TH)

         achieving 3rd place in the Tour de France in 1995... Who should've
         known he would win the darn race the year after... Oh well, this tune
         was used in one of The Pulse, when it returned in 1995." (TH)

 ARTIST: Deniece Williams
COMMENT: "Made with JCH Newplayer v9.
         I converted this tune from a Walkman tune on the Amiga. Walkman was
         definitely one of the best composers on the Amiga during my time on
         the Amiga. JCH liked this conversion even though I found it a bit dull
         compared to the original." (TH)

/Metal/Orbital.sid
COMMENT: "Made with JCH Newplayer v20.

         same chord structure. And well, here's the result. I think
         Deff/ex-Avantgarde wanted to use it in a graphics-collection, but that
         didn't go well at all." (TH)

         end-screen in one of the 1st (if not the last) Flash Inc. demo.
         Hmm..." (TH)

COMMENT: "Made with Newplayer v11.
         After finishing this tune, I felt that it was too slow and boring, but
         Walt told me that he thought it was great and he used it in the
         Raytrace-part of Crackle'n'Cocio for the Daniaz party in 1990."
         (TH)

/Metal/Plastic_T.sid
COMMENT: "Made with JCH Newplayer v20.
         After finishing this tune I was pretty sure that no-one had done
         anything remotely like this on the C64. Ofcoz I was wrong, but still I
         think it's one of the first techno-tunes in the scene. I think it was
         used in a crack-intro for Regina." (TH)

 ARTIST: Future Freak

         I came across a music-disk on the Amiga from Future Freak/Dexion, and
         on that disk there was a fabulous tune called 'Please me', and I
         thought it was such a great, that I simply had to do a conversion of
         it - ofcoz the original sounds alot better, but still... Unfortunately
         it's never been used." (TH)

         think, but Kring decided after Revealed #3 to make the following issue
         a cyber-like issue, and so I had to compose some deep techno."

         old thing. I don't think it was used in any Bonzai productions, but
         then again, I might be wrong." (TH)

         think this tune is one of my longest, as I think it goes for some 5-6

/Metal/Telefax.sid
COMMENT: "Made with Newplayer v14.
         Inspired by a simple thing as the telephone signal, I wrote this tune
         (my own phone, actually). The rest of the tune came out quite well,
         and it was one of my fave tunes for a long time. MSK told me that it
         was the best tune he had ever heard... Hmm.. Anyway, it was used in
         the 1st part in Crackle'n'Cocio." (TH)

/Metal/Trip_2_Mars.sid
COMMENT: "Made with JCH Newplayer v20.
         Oh yes! This is one of my faves as well. I made this and the other 2
         'Trip 2 x' tunes during the one single weekend, as Kring/Camelot
         wanted some strange cyber stuff for his Revealed magazine (issue 4 -
         the last!). Somehow he ended up only using 2 of the 'Trip 2 x'-tunes,
         where this tune unfortunately was the rejected one. Hmf... Not that
         this tune bears no resemblence to my PC tune carrying the same name
         (it's even better). Playing it on a new SID gives the best result!!"
         (TH)

/Metal/Virginize.sid
COMMENT: "Made with JCH Newplayer v9.
         A nice little tune, which I originally composed for mine and Drax's
         music group called Unitech Designs, but I never got around to code
         another one of those music demos. The 3 Unitech demos that we did
         release all included Drax's tunes." (TH)

/Metal/Vommit.sid
COMMENT: "Made with JCH Newplayer v17.
         Oh dear... Another strange tune... Never used. Quiz time! Guess why
         the tune is called Vommit.. yes, correct answer - I was boozing the
         night before and felt soo bad the day after that I actually commited
         during composing this tune... hehe... Also did that during a composing
         session with Drax on the game-project 'Lollypop'... Talk about a
         strange source of inspiration!" (TH)

/Metal/Weird.sid
COMMENT: "Made with JCH Newplayer v15.
         Made this tune especially for the demo Crackle'n'Cocio, it was used in
         the x-y-z logo zoomer part. The tune caused a massive positive
         feedback - I guess they liked it." (TH)

/Metal/What_Now.sid
COMMENT: "Made with JCH Newplayer v18.
         Together with Hiscore, Einstein, Ray-ban and Cream, this tune was
         supposed to be sold to a Polish group called Axis - however, the deal
         was never really on as they didn't have any money. Tough luck. ;) I
         think this tune is inspired by a Laxity track (guess which one for
         yourself!)." (TH)

/Metal/Wild_Talk.sid
COMMENT: "Made with JCH Newplayer v9.
         We don't need to talk too much about this one - just another of those
         early tunes made in 1989." (TH)

/Metal/Xmas_Beat.sid
COMMENT: "Made with Newplayer v11.
         I remember having made this just before Xmas in 1989 and I brought it
         along to the Dominators-Trilogy-Upfront party in Randers, where the
         Contex gang heard it - and guess what - they actually liked it... I
         used it in my Music-Collection (the one that never got released...
         Gmm...)" (TH)

COMMENT: An Arab tune that was brought to Europe during the crusades and
         became popular during the french revolution, ever sinced spawned
         many songs, including "For He's a Jolly Good Fellow".
  TITLE: Happy Birthday (0:50)
 ARTIST: Mildred J. Hill

/MozIcArt/Tjelta_Geir/Blue_Mazda_323.sid
COMMENT: "This tune is an ode to Geir's car, I remember he came to pick me up
         with it when we worked on the SDI editor in the military. It had no
         air conditioning and the only music in the car was old tapes of Iron
         Maiden (which wasn't bad at all)." (Comment by Glenn Gallefoss)

### /MozIcArt\ ###############################################################

### /Mueller_Markus ##########################################################

/Mueller_Markus/
COMMENT: Markus Müller composed all the tunes for the group Sidbusters.
         Sidbusters consisted of Markus along with Andras Molnár, nicknamed
         Andrew Miller (an English translation of his Hungarian name).  Andras'
         actual handle was Burton, and he made the music editor AMP which
         Markus used.

/Mueller_Markus/A_View_to_a_Kill.sid
  TITLE: A View to a Kill [from the movie]
 ARTIST: Duran Duran & John Barry

/Mueller_Markus/Delta_v2.sid
  TITLE: Koyaanisqatsi [from the movie] (0:00)
 ARTIST: Philip Glass
COMMENT: Covers Rob Hubbard's C64 version in /Hubbard_Rob/Delta.sid, Tune #12.
  TITLE: Delta, Tune #12 (0:52)
 ARTIST: Rob Hubbard
COMMENT: Covers Rob Hubbard's original part of the tune, which plays from 0:52
         onwards in the original.

 ARTIST: Depeche Mode

 ARTIST: Depeche Mode

  TITLE: People Are People [from Some Great Reward] (1:59)
 ARTIST: Depeche Mode
  TITLE: Personal Jesus [from Violator] (2:20)

  TITLE: Blasphemous Rumours [from Some Great Reward] (2:43)

### /Ouwehand_Reyn ###########################################################

/Ouwehand_Reyn/
COMMENT: Comments by Reyn himself are denoted by (RO).

/Ouwehand_Reyn/A_Game_Over_tune.sid
COMMENT: "I didn't compose it for anyone, I just wanted to know how it was like
         to make a GameOver-tune..." (RO)

/Ouwehand_Reyn/Armada.sid
(#6)
COMMENT: "[...]listening 2 the title of this song I don't think this piece of
         music was ever finished because it only lasts 32 bars and then it
         repeats itself again. I don't think it was my will to publish this
         tune at all....." (RO)

/Ouwehand_Reyn/Audio_Art.sid
COMMENT: "I believe I made this tune for a mag called Magna Magazine. A lot of
         things happen in this song. When a song is made for a mag it has to be
         long and not boring. Hmmmm.....the beginning sounds like a Galway
         rip-off tune 2 me....." (RO)

/Ouwehand_Reyn/Batmania_II_2.sid
COMMENT: "All these tunes were especially made for the demo called 'Batmania'
         from the group 'ATG' (Actual Trading Generation). At the time the
         first 'Batman'-movie was in cinema." (RO)

/Ouwehand_Reyn/Blackmail_Tune_1.sid
COMMENT: "I think this tune was one of the first tunes I made in the
         MON-editor. I got that from Dave Hogendorf from Scoop, who knew
         Charles Deenen from MON. I like the delay-effect in the tune and the
         sudden stop." (RO)

/Ouwehand_Reyn/Christmas_Remix.sid
  TITLE: Jingle Bells
 ARTIST: James Pierpont
COMMENT: "I wrote it for Dave Hogendorf from Scoop Designs, when they wanted to
         make some sort of Christmas-card/demo...." (RO)

/Ouwehand_Reyn/CosMail-08.sid
COMMENT: "CosMail-08 sounds like a Flimbo-song. Except for the crappy middle
         part which has nothing 2 do with it and sounds 2 much like the title
         from Rubicon made by JT. JT's title was amazing, though." (RO)

/Ouwehand_Reyn/Deadlock.sid
COMMENT: Deadlock was a game that System 3 never finished or released. It was
         to be programmed by the same programming team that also created
         Armalyte for Thalamus. Also used in the cartridge versio of Myth, in
         addition to the original Myth music.
         "System 3 asked me to make music for Deadlock, but the game was never
         finished - maybe they never even started. I never got any money for
         this. And I didn't know it was used in the cartridge version of
         Myth...." (RO)

/Ouwehand_Reyn/Dervish_D.sid
  TITLE: Dervish D [from Spiral]
 ARTIST: Vangelis

/Ouwehand_Reyn/Domination.sid
COMMENT: "I made this tune just after I bought my JUNO-106. I composed this
         song on the JUNO. There is even an 'analogue' version of this song."
         (RO)

/Ouwehand_Reyn/Dutch_Breeze_FLI_Scroll.sid
COMMENT: "It's not like the title is sung in the chorus, so I really don't have
         a clue what my working-title was!! ... It's a tune from me. Falco Paul
         (20CC), who lived in the neighbourhood that time fixed all the sounds.
         At the end of my C-64 career I used his editor and he helped me with
         the sounds. I'm a bad programmer myself, you see."(RO)

/Ouwehand_Reyn/Dutch_Breeze_Soft_and_Wet.sid
COMMENT: "It was specially made for a girl I fell in love with called Pascale.
         There is also a real version with lyrics, which was made before the
         C64 version." (RO)

/Ouwehand_Reyn/Dutch_Breeze_The_Cow.sid
  TITLE: Some Skunk Funk
 ARTIST: The Brecker Brothers

/Ouwehand_Reyn/Dutch_Breeze_The_End.sid
COMMENT: Same as /Ouwehand_Reyn/Deadlock.sid #2

/Ouwehand_Reyn/Effe_Snel.sid
COMMENT: Title translates as "A Quick One".

/Ouwehand_Reyn/Falcon_Dump.sid
COMMENT: "I made this for an intro from a cracking group. Called 'Falcon'? I
         know the contact person was called KRS#1." (RO)

/Ouwehand_Reyn/Firepit.sid
(#2)
COMMENT: Later used in the game "Twintris" as an intro tune.

/Ouwehand_Reyn/Flimbos_Quest.sid
(#1)
 AUTHOR: Reyn Ouwehand
(#2)
 AUTHOR: Johannes Bjerregaard
COMMENT: According to Reyn, the loading tune was initially done by Johannes
         Bjerregaard. "[...] It's much better than mine. But Laurens van der
         Donk (the author of Flimbo's Quest) didn't like it." (RO) So they used
         Reyn's instead. "I believe it's still 'hidden' in the soundtrack."
         (RO) In fact, it is and it's this tune.
(#3)
 AUTHOR: Reyn Ouwehand
(#4)

 ARTIST: Gazebo

         long until it repeats....." (RO)

/Ouwehand_Reyn/Infinity.sid
  TITLE: Infinity
 ARTIST: Guru Josh

/Ouwehand_Reyn/Knights.sid
COMMENT: "I did this just for fun. I made a sound which sounded like a horse
         whining. Then I invented some sort of story, a knight riding his
         horse. Stops before the castle. The gate opens. Coming into the
         castle, there is a Middle Age song playing. The Knight gets into a
         fight and dies. And this repeats and repeats." (RO)

/Ouwehand_Reyn/Last_Ninja_3.sid
(#3)
COMMENT: The tune falls out of synch at around 4:50, which is when the tune
         should loop. However, this is due to the music data in the game
         behaving exactly the same way. You would never get to hear this part
         of the tune in the game, as the intro would finish and load the first
         level before the music got to that point.
         "I guess I had some time pressure... I knew it would fade away
         anyhow... never thought about that fact that people in 2000 would
         listen to it with SIDPlay.... :)" (RO)
         The data has been restored in this SID, to make it loop properly,
         and is confirmed by Reyn to be correct.

 AUTHOR: Anthony Lees

         liked it and I made a cover of it. Just for fun...." (RO)

/Ouwehand_Reyn/Midnight_Express.sid
  TITLE: Chase (Theme from Midnight Express) [from the movie]
 ARTIST: Giorgio Moroder
COMMENT: "I believe this was the first tune where I experimented with the
         MON-editor before I was a member of MON. I got it illegally from a
         member of Scoop, who was a friend of Charles Deenen. This tune has
         never ever been used, I think/hope." (RO)

         before I joined MON. This song was a sort of application-song..." (RO)

 ARTIST: Glen A. Larson & Stu Phillips

         fast to get an overall look of the program."
         "Fun how the music changes into a lot of different tunes like
         S-Express..." (RO)

/Page_Jason/Rainbow_Islands.sid
COMMENT: Tunes #1-#9 are covers of the arcade version by Hisayoshi Ogura
         (OGR/Zuntata).
(#1)
  TITLE: Over The Rainbow [from the movie The Wizard of Oz]
 ARTIST: Harold Arlen (music), E. Y. Harburg (lyrics)

         released it." (SP)

/Rock/Contest_Demo_part_3.sid
  TITLE: Hot Girl [from Boys] (0:00-0:30)
 ARTIST: Sabrina Salerno
COMMENT: "ok, some thing about this music. as you see, it was done by me (fcs)
         and rock..  well, how is that . let me explain !!. for quite long ago,
         rock started one piece with we-music editor. but he didn't finish it..
         A  few weeks ago i found it on rock's work disk, and i decided to
         finish it. so, all the bass melodies were done by rock, and the
         melodies by me, fcs." (FCS)

/Rock/FIG_Again.sid

         Background (bass and drums) by ROCK

### /Rockin_Limited\ #########################################################

### /Rodger_Andrew ###########################################################

/Rodger_Andrew/
COMMENT: All Andrew's own comments indicated by (AR).

/Rodger_Andrew/Alien_3.sid
COMMENT: "Alien 3 was the most difficult project I worked on - but I loved
         doing it. Probe sent me an audio cassette of the Sega Genesis version
         to convert to the C64. Naturally, I was only allowed the bare minimum
         of free memory, so I had to chuck out all the effects modules in my
         music player to make room for the data (even vibrato had to go). The
         result was some rather flat sounding tunes!" (AR)

/Rodger_Andrew/Arnie_2.sid
(#1)
  TITLE: Terra Cresta, Tune #1
 ARTIST: Martin Galway
COMMENT: The bassline progression and the general mood of the tune are
         as in Galway's tune.
(#3)
  TITLE: Commando, Tune #3
 ARTIST: Rob Hubbard
COMMENT: The jingle ends in a different way than Hubbard's.

/Rodger_Andrew/Carnage.sid
(#3)
  TITLE: Led Storm, Tune #7
 ARTIST: Tim Follin

/Rodger_Andrew/Sky_Runner.sid
COMMENT: "It's called 'Sky Runner' because at the time I loved the magazine
         advertisment artwork for the C64 game of the same name." (AR)

/Rodger_Andrew/Sleepwalker.sid
COMMENT: "Sleepwalker was my first commercial project, and I was nervous as
         hell - I was sure they would reject it!" (AR)

/Rodger_Andrew/Titanic_Blinky.sid
(#18)
  TITLE: Peter Gunn [from the TV series]
 ARTIST: Henry Mancini

  TITLE: Malbrouk s'en va-t-en guerre
 ARTIST: Traditional
COMMENT: An Arab tune that was brought to Europe during the crusades and
         became popular during the French revolution, ever sinced spawned
         many songs, including "For He's a Jolly Good Fellow".

### /Schneider_Markus ########################################################

/Schneider_Markus/
COMMENT: Markus Schneider composed under the alias "Diflex" in his early years
         and then later under his own name.  In addition, he also composed
         under the name "Lords of Sonics", which was a music team consisting of
         Schneider and Jens Blidon.

/Schneider_Markus/Apoxoly.sid
COMMENT: "This whole game music was done for a spacy game. So I would compose
         spacy music, but the programmer wants music like "CYBERNOID". I did
         what the customer wanted me to do. (he was really satisfied [on] the
         whole.)" (MS)

/Schneider_Markus/Crime_Time.sid
(#1)
  TITLE: Pink Panther Theme
 ARTIST: Henry Mancini
(#2)
COMMENT: Later probably reworked to become /Schneider_Markus/Second_World.sid,
         subtune #1.

/Schneider_Markus/Crown.sid
COMMENT: Tunes #1-#6 were converted from the Amiga version. Tune #7 is an
         original tune by Markus Schneider.
(#1)
  TITLE: Greensleeves
 ARTIST: Unknown
(#2)
  TITLE: Jaws [from the movie]
 ARTIST: John Williams
COMMENT: The beginning is from the movie "Jaws".
(#5)
  TITLE: Stepnaja Kavalerijskaja (The March of the Red Cavalry) (0:00)
 ARTIST: Traditional
COMMENT: A Russian folksong.
  TITLE: Katjusha (0:47)
 ARTIST: Matvei Blanter & M. Isakovski

/Schneider_Markus/Crystal_Fever.sid
COMMENT: "The drums, inspired from a jazz lp, used my new sound player [for
         the] first time." (MS)

/Schneider_Markus/Declem.sid
COMMENT: "I had only 5 hours time to [complete] this music- so it sounds !"
         (MS)

/Schneider_Markus/Dichno.sid
COMMENT: "Just a demo tune for all those disco freaks. Buah ." (MS)

/Schneider_Markus/Dick_Tracy.sid
COMMENT: "Original conversion from amiga. First time I got a music sketch for
         conversion. So i need more than one week to convert. But I learned
         some things about music and other things I could [use] in other
         pieces." (MS)
(#3)
  TITLE: You Are The One [from Stay On These Roads]
 ARTIST: A-Ha

/Schneider_Markus/Django.sid
COMMENT: "These tunes are junk, but those people at CP Verlag loved them." (MS)
(#1)
  TITLE: The Good, The Bad, and The Ugly [from the movie]
 ARTIST: Ennio Morricone
COMMENT: Just bits and pieces, not the whole music.
(#2)
  TITLE: The Good, The Bad, and The Ugly [from the movie]
 ARTIST: Ennio Morricone
COMMENT: Just bits and pieces, not the whole music.

/Schneider_Markus/Domination.sid
COMMENT: "Just another demo tune for disco freaks. As i was not interested in
         producing disco tunes for games, I [composed] this music for free. It
         was used by Magic Bytes in Domination." (MS)

/Schneider_Markus/Double_Density_Commercial.sid
COMMENT: "A demo for the company Double Density for ECTS in London. Many people
         liked this music and it was used in many demos. I really prefer other
         [music]." (MS)

/Schneider_Markus/Elite_Squad.sid
(#1)
  TITLE: Parallax, Tune #1
 ARTIST: Martin Galway
COMMENT: Heavily influenced by it.
(#2)
  TITLE: Crockett's Theme [from the TV series Miami Vice]
 ARTIST: Jan Hammer
COMMENT: "The programmer [<deleted word>] of the game wanted me to do that.
         Bleeh, always the same." (MS)

/Schneider_Markus/Enola_Gay.sid
  TITLE: Enola Gay [from Organisation]
 ARTIST: Orchestral Manoeuvres in the Dark (OMD)
COMMENT: Not a one-to-one cover.

/Schneider_Markus/Game_On_intro.sid
COMMENT: This tune was used as the introtune of the Game On diskmag between
         issues 09/89 and 06/91.

/Schneider_Markus/Gilded_Age.sid
COMMENT: "The game was programmed by myself. It's a pity that I [didn't have]
         the time make better music for it." (MS)

COMMENT: "Simple disco demo tune testing some FX. Sounds like MON 1988, uhmm
         ?!?" (MS)

/Schneider_Markus/Intruder-the_Space_Quest.sid
COMMENT: "Because the normal mail system had not worked to Denmark (or was it
         Sweden?) we transferred the music by a 2400 baud modem :):)" (MS)

/Schneider_Markus/Lethal_Zone.sid
(#8)
  TITLE: Main Title [from all the Star Wars movies]
 ARTIST: John Williams

/Schneider_Markus/Mad_Springs.sid
COMMENT: "A friend of mine programmed the game and he wanted a disco title
         tune. But the game's main actor had been jumping springs. Have you
         ever seen a jumping spring at a disco ? So I composed a tune where
         everybody could imagine something about springs by listening to the
         music with closed eyes. [Two] days before release date of his game I
         gave him the tunes and he was really angry. But there was no other
         [option so he had to accept] my music, he he he !! I think he's still
         angry about that." (MS)

/Schneider_Markus/Magic_Disk_64_Issue_12_90.sid
COMMENT: Also used in Game On Issue 12/90.

/Schneider_Markus/Magic_Mouse_in_Goblin_Land.sid
COMMENT: "The last music and game I did on C64.  Ingame tune inspired by Tim
         Follin's Ghouls'n'Ghosts." (MS)

         version had been really really cool." (MS)

### /SoedeSoft/ ##############################################################

/SoedeSoft/
COMMENT: SoedeSoft was Jeroen Soede and Michiel Soede. Comments by Michiel
         Soede are marked (MS).

/SoedeSoft/Battlestar_Galactica.sid
  TITLE: Battlestar Galactica [from the TV series]
 ARTIST: Stu Phillips & Glen A. Larson
COMMENT: "Another TV-series we liked. There was a game with the same tune, but
         it sounded so bad, that we made another version." (MS)

/SoedeSoft/Ghostbusters_Tune.sid
  TITLE: Ghostbusters [from the movie]
 ARTIST: Ray Parker, Jr.
COMMENT: "Just a cover from the movie tune. One of the first tunes we made with
         our editor. I think it was used in some demo or so." (MS)

  TITLE: Theme From S-Express [from Original Soundtrack]
 ARTIST: Mark Moore
COMMENT: "An exact copy of a JT intro tune (just to show that our music routine
         could imitate every other routine...)." (MS)
         See /Tel_Jeroen/S-Express.sid for more comments.

### /Sonic_Graffiti/Hayes_Ben ################################################

/Sonic_Graffiti/Hayes_Ben/
COMMENT: All comments by Ben Hayes are marked with (BH).

/Sonic_Graffiti/Hayes_Ben/3_Track_E_P.sid
(#1)
  TITLE: Magical Sound Shower [from the arcade game Out Run]
 ARTIST: Hiroshi Miyauchi (Hiro/SEGA Sound Team)
(#2)
  TITLE: Airwolf Theme [from the TV series]
 ARTIST: Sylvester Levay
(#3)
   NAME: On The Way

/Sonic_Graffiti/Hayes_Ben/Acid_Stomach.sid
COMMENT: "Called 'Acid Stomach' because the sound at the every fourth bar
         sounds a bit like someone vomiting... well, that's what I thought,
         anyway. Again, not exactly what you'd call 'a nice tune' but I was
         just seeing what you could do with a few basic sequences by mixing and
         transposing them. At the time I didn't really like 'acid' music, I was
         more likely to listen to John Cage or Pierre Henry, so I wasn't really
         sure how to write it. SoedeSoft editor again. Horrible drums again,
         the snare being a bit like the one in Thalamusic." (BH)

/Sonic_Graffiti/Hayes_Ben/Aggro_Mix.sid
  TITLE: Never Let Me Down Again [Aggro Mix]
 ARTIST: Depeche Mode

/Sonic_Graffiti/Hayes_Ben/Bass_Drummed_Out_and_Filte.sid
   NAME: Bass Drummed Out and Filter Frantic
COMMENT: "Just another meaningless bit of computer composition - trying out
         different drum and bass line effects, reall, but it's got a bit of
         kick to it. System 6581 editor." (BH)

/Sonic_Graffiti/Hayes_Ben/Behind_the_Wheel.sid
  TITLE: Behind the Wheel [from Music for the Masses]
 ARTIST: Depeche Mode

/Sonic_Graffiti/Hayes_Ben/Bogey_Boogie.sid
COMMENT: "Written at the same time as the Acid... tunes, but used in something
         else. (Quantum Designs' "Music Bars" demo) Again, just an experiment
         in sound, rather than a tune as such. SoedeSoft editor." (BH)

/Sonic_Graffiti/Hayes_Ben/Feedback_Experiment.sid
COMMENT: "This tune does exactly what it says on the box, basically trying to
         get a ring-mod effect that sounded like an electric guitar being left
         leaning on a Marshall amplifier turned up to 11. I was fairly pleased
         with the result, it sounds quite uncomfortable on headphones. The tune
         was written on a SoedeSoft editor, which explains the rather fuzzy
         triggering and messy drum sounds, but gliding and filter control was
         much more versatile than anything else around at the time, I felt, and
         you could sustain notes for about 5 hours. The tune was not written
         especially for the "Acid At The PC Show" demo, having being composed
         around 8 weeks earlier, but Shane (coder) wanted to use them." (BH)

/Sonic_Graffiti/Hayes_Ben/Fly_By_Night.sid
  TITLE: Fly By Night
 ARTIST: Paul Hardcastle
COMMENT: "Oh dear! Let's face it, Neil Baldwin did the best C64 version of this
         ever, and it was foolish to try and emulate it... This was done on
         SoedeSoft (I think) at 5am on the Sunday morning of the 1989 PC Show
         in London (hence the demo title). Has a long ending after a drum solo
         that John Bonham would probably laugh at. I also did a version of this
         tune in Ubiks Music in 1988, which was even worse. I hope that's never
         found!" (BH)

/Sonic_Graffiti/Hayes_Ben/Fly_By_Night_Ubiks_Musik.sid
  TITLE: Fly By Night
 ARTIST: Paul Hardcastle

/Sonic_Graffiti/Hayes_Ben/Galway_Remix.sid
  TITLE: Ocean Loader 1
 ARTIST: Martin Galway
COMMENT: "Just done to test out the System 6581 editor, which I'd just got -
         and this is one of my very favourite C64 tunes ever. It was never
         meant to be released but we ended up sticking in on an SG demo disk
         anyway. Note that one of the arpeggios is a bit wonky, and I couldn't
         be bothered to do the start of the piece, but I felt that it was a
         pretty good sound-a-like." (BH)

/Sonic_Graffiti/Hayes_Ben/Greed_Monster.sid
COMMENT: "Another day, another pointless budget game. Yogi Bear deserved
         better! I can't remember if I composed the tune or if it was a
         conversion of some Atari ST music, written by some bloke who's name I
         can't remember. We used to do a few conversions back then. These were
         great fun to do. The software company would sent Gerard Gourley a copy
         of the original music, usually recorded on a cassette recorder sitting
         by the TV. He'd then play the tune down the telephone to me, and I'd
         record it on another cassette from the telephone's earpiece. The
         resulting hi-fidelity master recording would then be my basis. I
         usually had to guess at the basslines, as they'd become totally
         inaudible on the tape. Then I'd U-U the result back to Gerard within 2
         hours, and if I was lucky I'd get £100 about 6 months later after the
         'middle man' had taken his bit. Or half that if the tune was for
         Ocean." (BH)

/Sonic_Graffiti/Hayes_Ben/I_Beg_Your_Pardon.sid
  TITLE: I Beg Your Pardon
 ARTIST: Kon Kan

/Sonic_Graffiti/Hayes_Ben/Its_All_About_part_3.sid
  TITLE: Tune 18
 ARTIST: Jouni Ikonen (Mixer)
COMMENT: Covers /VARIOUS/M-R/Mixer/Tune_18.sid

/Sonic_Graffiti/Hayes_Ben/Mothers_Theme.sid
COMMENT: "Used on SG demo disk and for a Mothers of Invention intro, hence the
         title. 6581 editor. Not a bad tune, I was more pleased with this than
         most of my others. The chords should have been a bit quieter, really."
         (BH)

/Sonic_Graffiti/Hayes_Ben/Nah_Matt_Gray_Doesnt_Work.sid
   NAME: Nah, Matt Gray Doesn't Work For Us
COMMENT: "Spot the obvious influences here!! 6581 editor, probably took an hour
         (if that)." (BH)

/Sonic_Graffiti/Hayes_Ben/Platoon_Tune.sid
  TITLE: Platoon, Tune #1
 ARTIST: Jonathan Dunn

/Sonic_Graffiti/Hayes_Ben/Prison_Riot.sid
COMMENT: "Composed for another dodgy budget game, in the old SG editor I think,
         which was written by Andy Lumley. I probably had about 12 hours notice
         to write this... Zzap reviewed it and called it siren 'music', so they
         can't have listened to more than about 10 seconds of it. I quite liked
         it at the time, but more for the effects than the rather scrappy lead
         lines. Tune 4 was totally different in style, for the hiscore table.
         The main tune seems to be bugged near the end - this must have
         happened when the file was inserted into the game, it was OK when it
         left me. To be honest, music for this sort of game was an afterthought
         - and for the money I was getting, I wasn't about to try and write an
         epic!" (BH)
(#1)
COMMENT: This tune falls out of synch at around 4:28. However, the game does
         this also due to a bug in the programmers' code as Ben mentions.

/Sonic_Graffiti/Hayes_Ben/Ruff_and_Reddy.sid
COMMENT: "Er, see the entry for The Greed Monster, it all applies in this case
         as well! Horribly cutesy tune." (BH)

/Sonic_Graffiti/Hayes_Ben/Shake_the_Disease.sid
  TITLE: Shake the Disease [from The Singles 81->85]
 ARTIST: Depeche Mode

/Sonic_Graffiti/Hayes_Ben/Step_On.sid
  TITLE: He's Gonna Step On You Again
 ARTIST: John Kongos
COMMENT: Samples from Happy Mondays' 1990 cover of this song.
         "Step On by Happy Mondays, sampled with a SFX sampler. Quite a long
         mix, this, the looping being fairly accurate. The song was a big hit
         in 1990 at the height of the Madchester/Baggy craze. I got sick of
         it pretty soon, though, after hearing it at every indie disco I went
         to at the time." (BH)

/Sonic_Graffiti/Hayes_Ben/Step_On_PSID.sid
  TITLE: He's Gonna Step On You Again
 ARTIST: John Kongos
COMMENT: Samples from Happy Mondays' 1990 cover of this song.
         "Step On by Happy Mondays, sampled with a SFX sampler. Quite a long
         mix, this, the looping being fairly accurate. The song was a big hit
         in 1990 at the height of the Madchester/Baggy craze. I got sick of
         it pretty soon, though, after hearing it at every indie disco I went
         to at the time." (BH)

/Sonic_Graffiti/Hayes_Ben/SuperTed-Search_For_Spot.sid
(#1)
COMMENT: "The theme tune to the Super Ted cartoon series, which is Welsh, just
         like me! The tune lasted 20 seconds in original form, so I looped it a
         bit. Some rather primitive sound effects too. Blimey, I've got a
         really impressive body of work, eh? No wonder I never made it as a pop
         star. I mean, Super Ted, for f**k's sake... System 6581 editor, I
         think." (BH)

/Sonic_Graffiti/Hayes_Ben/Test_Thingy.sid
  TITLE: Crosswords
 ARTIST: Thomas E. Petersen (Laxity)
COMMENT: Ben just added digis to Laxity's song, using his own digiroutine for
         the first time.

/Sonic_Graffiti/Hayes_Ben/Told_You_So.sid
  TITLE: Told You So [from Construction Time Again]
 ARTIST: Depeche Mode

/Sonic_Graffiti/Hayes_Ben/Up_To_Date.sid
  TITLE: Up To Date [from the TV series Man About The House]
 ARTIST: John Hawksworth

/Sonic_Graffiti/Hayes_Ben/Wizkid_Music.sid
  TITLE: wiz8 [from the Amiga game Wizkid]
 ARTIST: Richard Joseph

/Sonic_Graffiti/Hayes_Ben/Wombles.sid
  TITLE: Wombling Free [from the TV series The Wombles]
 ARTIST: Mike Batt
COMMENT: "Woo, top tune! The first thing I did for SG. I'm a bit of a Wombles
         fan, so I could do the tune from memory - although the ending is
         wrong, but I didn't have a copy of the original song to check. I still
         like this one, actually! Written in the old SG editor." (BH)

### /Tait_Mark ###############################################################

/Tait_Mark/
COMMENT: Comments by Mark Tait himself are denoted by (MT).

/Tait_Mark/1943.sid
COMMENT: "1943 was the first commercial game I wrote the music for, and was
         responsible for me being offered the job at Tiertex. The people who
         wrote 1943 were John Prince and Donald ?????? (sorry can't remember
         his last name). They partnered up and started Tiertex in 1987/8, and
         offered me the job as musician. There were only 5 of us in the company
         at that time, and we were writing only for Capcom/US Gold, working
         mainly on arcade conversions." (MT)
(#1)
  TITLE: Hiscore [from the arcade game 1943 - The Battle of Midway]
 ARTIST: Jungle Kumi
(#3)
  TITLE: Main Theme [from the arcade game 1943 - The Battle of Midway]
 ARTIST: Jungle Kumi

/Tait_Mark/Better_Dead_Than_Alien.sid
(#1)
  TITLE: Na Na Hey Hey Kiss Him Goodbye (remix)
 ARTIST: Stem
COMMENT: It is not a straight remix, but it's based on it.
(#5)
  TITLE: Battlestar Galactica [from the TV series]
 ARTIST: Glen A. Larson & Stu Phillips

/Tait_Mark/Black_Tiger.sid
(#1)
  TITLE: Shop [from the arcade game Black Tiger]
 ARTIST: Tamayo Kawamoto
(#2)
  TITLE: Black Tiger [from the arcade game]
 ARTIST: Tamayo Kawamoto
(#3)
  TITLE: Main Theme [from the arcade game Black Tiger]
 ARTIST: Tamayo Kawamoto

/Tait_Mark/Call_Me_Psycho.sid
COMMENT: Also used in the demo "Billy Bubbles II".

/Tait_Mark/Dynasty_Wars.sid
COMMENT: Does not cover the arcade version.

/Tait_Mark/Galaxia_7.sid
COMMENT: "I cannot remember giving my permission for it to be used in a
         computer game. It was a Compunet demo I uploaded in about 1986/7 which
         I can only assume was ripped [...] but I did not receive any payment
         from any sales of it." (MT)

/Tait_Mark/Human_Killing_Machine.sid
(#1)
  TITLE: Comic Bakery, Tune #1
 ARTIST: Martin Galway
COMMENT: The whole music shows a big resemblance to this tune, especially the
         bassline and the arpeggios.
         "I will freely admit to Rob Hubbard and Martin Galway being my biggest
         influences of the time (as far as computer games were concerned), and
         I will not deny at all that their music had a certain influence on me.
         I truly wish however, that no-one thinks that I was ever copying them.
         If any of their sounds or productions in general rubbed off on me, I
         can only hope that they thought of me as a fan, and not as a
         plagarist." (MT)

/Tait_Mark/Last_Crusade.sid
COMMENT: "... for the Last Crusade we got the original John Williams
         handwritten score of the main theme from the film. That's what I
         worked from to produce the music for the games (C64 and pc, Amiga, ST
         etc etc etc). [...] I was quite proud of that, if no one else was."
         (MT)
(#1)
  TITLE: The Raiders March [from all the Indiana Jones movies]
 ARTIST: John Williams
(#2)
  TITLE: The Raiders March [from all the Indiana Jones movies]
 ARTIST: John Williams
COMMENT: Short jingle based on the original theme.
(#3)
  TITLE: The Raiders March [from all the Indiana Jones movies]
 ARTIST: John Williams
COMMENT: Short jingle based on the original theme.

/Tait_Mark/Mix-e-concert.sid
COMMENT: The original demo has a selector where you can change drums,
         bass, and lead voices. Each has four variations, making
         4*4*4=64 possible combinations.

/Tait_Mark/Protector.sid
  TITLE: 1943, Tune #4
 ARTIST: Mark Tait
COMMENT: "I do remember the music, just not the permission to use it in a
         game." (MT)

/Tait_Mark/Spacebike.sid
COMMENT: "I do remember the music, just not the permission to use it in a
         game." (MT)
  TITLE: Trumpet
 ARTIST: Mark Tait

/Tait_Mark/Strider.sid
COMMENT: The same music was used in the sequel, Strider II. Based on the
         arcade version by Junko Tamitani.
         "I left before Strider II was even ever mentioned (I'm sure howere it
         was given the 'inhouse name of ' TOR, although I honestly cannot
         remember what TOR stood for (although I do remeber proucing a killer
         of a soundtrack which was recorded on an Akai X7000,and was, even by
         my standards, probably the best soundtrack thet was ever produced from
         Tiertex TOR is machine)." (MT)

/Tait_Mark/Superman.sid
  TITLE: Superman Title Theme [from the movie]
 ARTIST: John Williams

/Tait_Mark/Thunder_Blade.sid
COMMENT: "Thunder Blades music was produced over night. It was decided that a
         demo of a level would be appearing on the cover of Zzap! 64. The
         actual C64 game was not written by Tiertex (although the other
         versions were), it was a guy called Chris someone. As I remember, he
         credited everyone but me!" (MT) (Chris someone = Chris Butler)

/Tel_Jeroen/Bad_Blood_intro_tunes.sid
(#2)
  TITLE: Vallåt
 ARTIST: <?>
COMMENT: The tune might be inspired by this piece.
         Q: Is this a cover?
         JT: NO! Worldshocking huh? I could actually compose music in the
         classical traditional sence :) It's all COMPOSED by me. More people
         seemed to be wondering if I *really composed Bad Blood*. The answer is
         yes with a capital Y.
         Charles Deenen said it was the "best music I made on c64" when I
         finished it. (I do NOT agree ofcourse, although I must say it's the
         best "filmscore" soundtrack I've done for a game on the c64. I
         actually got some kind of filmscript for it, that's why I could be
         very specific when composing themes for characters and events in the
         game.

 ARTIST: Traditional

/Tel_Jeroen/JT_42.sid
  TITLE: Running In The Family
 ARTIST: Level 42
COMMENT: Not a plain cover, it's a remix. "The lead sounds a lot like
         Bjerregaard's 'Shape'." (Comment by DRAX.)

/Tel_Jeroen/KOUD_HE.sid
COMMENT: This tune was the original prototype for the title theme from Savage.
         Jeroen did this first, sampling the Dutch comedian Harry Vermeegen.
         'Koud he' was his catchphrase and translated it means 'Cold eh?'.
         His most notorious use of this was a Dutch TV programme called 'Pisa'
         (filmed from the leaning tower) with Harry saying his 'Koud He?'
         catchphrase to everyone that went by. Probe Software then heard the
         tune and asked Jeroen if he'd change the samples, and lo and behold it
         became the Savage theme.
         "Some background info. The 'KOUD HE' sample is from a Dutch comedian
         called 'Harry Vermeegen'. It was like a hype saying. I found it a nice
         sample to play around with. A spontanious tune I did just 4 fun." (JT)

/Tel_Jeroen/KOUD_HE_PSID.sid
COMMENT: This tune was the original prototype for the title theme from Savage.
         Jeroen did this first, sampling the Dutch comedian Harry Vermeegen.
         'Koud he' was his catchphrase and translated it means 'Cold eh?'.
         His most notorious use of this was a Dutch TV programme called 'Pisa'
         (filmed from the leaning tower) with Harry saying his 'Koud He?'
         catchphrase to everyone that went by. Probe Software then heard the
         tune and asked Jeroen if he'd change the samples, and lo and behold it
         became the Savage theme.
         "Some background info. The 'KOUD HE' sample is from a Dutch comedian
         called 'Harry Vermeegen'. It was like a hype saying. I found it a nice
         sample to play around with. A spontanious tune I did just 4 fun." (JT)

/Tel_Jeroen/Kinetix.sid
COMMENT: This game was released under the name of 'Dynamix' in the UK, but
         Kinetix was the original working title.

/Tel_Jeroen/Nighthunter.sid
(#1)
COMMENT: " 'Nighthunter' voice is me. The 'laughing' and the 'Allright!' is ME
         and my BROTHER, just before we're about to hit town. That explain the
         silly 'BURP!' and 'AJIIRK' too. My brother was pushing me to go with
         him, so I asked him to sample some voices real fast. (in this case,
         rather silly ones.) This is probably the most 'rushed' music I've ever
         made. (which shows somehow). I like many of the ideas in it, but I
         just had to meet the deadline. No time for quality checks... just...
         PRODUCE and DELIVER. Too bad somehow. It give us a funny compilation
         of brainactivity though :O
         BTW: If you want to know my brother's name: It's 'Kees Tel' (he's an
         awesome composer and musician. He composes almost any imaginable style
         of music and plays a LOT of instruments.)" (All comments by JT.)

/Tel_Jeroen/Nighthunter_PSID.sid
(#1)
COMMENT: " 'Nighthunter' voice is me. The 'laughing' and the 'Allright!' is ME
         and my BROTHER, just before we're about to hit town. That explain the
         silly 'BURP!' and 'AJIIRK' too. My brother was pushing me to go with
         him, so I asked him to sample some voices real fast. (in this case,
         rather silly ones.) This is probably the most 'rushed' music I've ever
         made. (which shows somehow). I like many of the ideas in it, but I
         just had to meet the deadline. No time for quality checks... just...
         PRODUCE and DELIVER. Too bad somehow. It give us a funny compilation
         of brainactivity though :O
         BTW: If you want to know my brother's name: It's 'Kees Tel' (he's an
         awesome composer and musician. He composes almost any imaginable style
         of music and plays a LOT of instruments.)" (All comments by JT.)

/Tel_Jeroen/North_and_South.sid
COMMENT: Some of the jingles are covers. #24 is for instance also in Children
         Songs and Frogger.
         Music #1 is clearly a medley of famous confed songs, but it was
         written by Charles Callet for the Amiga version of the game and then
         converted by Jeroen Tel.
         "The tunes were converted by me from the Amiga version. That's all I
         can say." (JT)
(#1)
  TITLE: Dixie Land (1:24-1:55)
 ARTIST: Daniel Emmett
(#8)
  TITLE: Dixie Land
 ARTIST: Daniel Emmett
(#9)
  TITLE: Dixie Land
 ARTIST: Daniel Emmett
(#10)
  TITLE: Yankee Doodle
 ARTIST: Traditional, Dr. Richard Schuckburgh (lyrics)
(#11)
  TITLE: Yankee Doodle
 ARTIST: Traditional, Dr. Richard Schuckburgh (lyrics)
(#20)
  TITLE: U.S. Cavalry Charge signal
 ARTIST: <?>
(#34)
  TITLE: Yankee Doodle
 ARTIST: Traditional, Dr. Richard Schuckburgh (lyrics)

/Tel_Jeroen/Outrun_Europa.sid
COMMENT: "To make a complex story short: BEFORE I had to make the 'TURBO
         OUTRUN' music, I was asked to do the OUTRUN EUROPE music. OUTRUN
         EUROPE was never finished (at least not the first version). I don't
         know why/when/where/how.
         Then Turbo Outrun was made. (you know the music, etc.) One of the two
         title-tunes (not the 1.2.3. hit-it! one) was actually composed for
         Outrun Europe.
         OUTRUN EUROPA in 1990 is a totally different game from the old
         unfinished, never released game in 1988/1989." (All comments from JT)
(#3)
COMMENT: The original game had a bug which meant the tune fell out of sync.
         That has been fixed in this rip.
(#5)
COMMENT: The original game had a bug which meant the tune fell out of sync.
         That has been fixed in this rip.
(#7)
COMMENT: The original game had a bug which meant the tune fell out of sync.
         That has been fixed in this rip.

/Tel_Jeroen/Outrun_Europa_PSID.sid
COMMENT: "To make a complex story short: BEFORE I had to make the 'TURBO
         OUTRUN' music, I was asked to do the OUTRUN EUROPE music. OUTRUN
         EUROPE was never finished (at least not the first version). I don't
         know why/when/where/how.
         Then Turbo Outrun was made. (you know the music, etc.) One of the two
         title-tunes (not the 1.2.3. hit-it! one) was actually composed for
         Outrun Europe.
         OUTRUN EUROPA in 1990 is a totally different game from the old
         unfinished, never released game in 1988/1989." (All comments from JT)
(#3)
COMMENT: The original game had a bug which meant the tune fell out of sync.
         That has been fixed in this rip.
(#5)
COMMENT: The original game had a bug which meant the tune fell out of sync.
         That has been fixed in this rip.
(#7)
COMMENT: The original game had a bug which meant the tune fell out of sync.
         That has been fixed in this rip.

/Tel_Jeroen/Outrun_Europe_levels.sid
COMMENT: These three tunes were prototypes for a US Gold/Probe game 'Outrun
         Europe'. However, the game was never completed and the programming
         team involved went on to do Turbo Outrun instead. This was also a
         different game from Outrun Europa, released in 1991. The first two
         tunes cover the arcade version.
(#1)
  TITLE: Passing Breeze [from the arcade game Out Run]
 ARTIST: Hiroshi Miyauchi (Hiro/SEGA Sound Team)
(#2)
  TITLE: Splash Wave [from the arcade game Out Run]
 ARTIST: Hiroshi Miyauchi (Hiro/SEGA Sound Team)

/Tel_Jeroen/Poseidon_Planet_Eleven.sid
COMMENT: Also used in the games Interchange and Insector Hecti, (C) 1991 by
         Hi-Tec Software.

/Tel_Jeroen/Remark_Intro.sid
COMMENT: Also used in the selection screen of the cartridge Fun Play from 1990,
         a compilation of three Codemasters games.

/Tel_Jeroen/Robocop_3.sid
COMMENT: "A FUN note about song #4 & #5: they're both 1 channel only!" (JT)

         in 1988.

/Tel_Jeroen/Turbo_Outrun.sid
COMMENT: Most of the tunes are heavily inspired by the music in the arcade
         game.
         "Turbo Outrun took about a month all together. It was a lot of fun,
         but I recomposed every tune about three times to get it perfect. I
         still think it is one of the best audio tracks I ever did on the C64."
         "One nice, very nice note: 'Turbo Outrun' (the music) has won the:
         'Best music on 8bit computer 1989' award (at the PCW show (now ECTS)
         in London. :D Too bad I had to find out later. US Gold received the
         actual award. Bastards! I wasn't even at the scene when it was
         presented. :( " (JT)
(#1)
   NAME: Intro
  TITLE: Magical Sound Shower [from the arcade game Out Run]
 ARTIST: Hiroshi Miyauchi (Hiro/SEGA Sound Team)
COMMENT: Featuring the sampled voice of Jeroen Tel himself.
         "I'm actually saying: 'one two TREE', 'cause sampling THREE would make
         it sound like 'one two FREE' and that's not what I wanted. ;P" (JT)
(#2)
   NAME: Title
(#3)
   NAME: Opening
  TITLE: Vivacious [from the arcade game Turbo OutRun]
 ARTIST: Yasuhiro Takagi (YAS/SEGA Sound Team)

### /Thierolf_Peter ##########################################################

/Thierolf_Peter/Antics_Mini_Boulder.sid
  TITLE: Das Mädchen aus der Treppe
 ARTIST: Tangerine Dream

/Thierolf_Peter/No_Rain_Song.sid
COMMENT: With this song the author had taken part in the same music competition
         of the German paper magazine 64'er that Chris Hülsbeck won with his
         "Shades". Maybe also interesting, later on the Amiga Peter Thierolf
         programmed the editor for Chris Hülsbeck's music player TFMX (The
         Final Music system eXtended).

### /VARIOUS/A-F/Ace64 #######################################################

/VARIOUS/A-F/Ace64/
COMMENT: this Italian c64 user had composed tons of SID tunes during the
         "gold days", but he'd never released any; Luca/FIRE had taken
         from him all the tunes that lasted against time.

/VARIOUS/A-F/Ace64/Capitan_Harlock.sid
  TITLE: Capitan Harlock
 ARTIST: L. Albertelli - V. Tempera, performed by La Banda dei Bucanieri
COMMENT: This song is the Italian title song for the Japanese cartoon series
         "Uchu Kaizoku Captain Harlock" (translated from Japanese: "Space
         Pirate Captain Harlock").

/VARIOUS/A-F/Ace64/Daitarn_III.sid
  TITLE: Daitarn III
 ARTIST: L. Albertelli - V. Tempera, performed by I Micronauti
COMMENT: This song is the Italian title song for the Japanese cartoon series
         "Muteki Kojin Daiturn 3" (translated from Japanese: "Daiturn 3 the
         Invincible Steel Man").

/VARIOUS/A-F/Ace64/Dragons_Lair_II_Level_1.sid
  TITLE: Dragon's Lair II, tune #2
 ARTIST: Rob Hubbard

/VARIOUS/A-F/Ace64/Fhey_Area.sid
 ARTIST: Motoi Sakuraba
COMMENT: from the Sega MegaCD RPG game "Seireishin Seiki Fhey Area".

/VARIOUS/A-F/Ace64/Fur_Elise.sid
  TITLE: Für Elise
 ARTIST: Ludwig van Beethoven

/VARIOUS/A-F/Ace64/Goldrake.sid
  TITLE: Goldrake
 ARTIST: L. Albertelli - V. Tempera - M. Luca, performed by Michel Tadini
COMMENT: This song is the Italian title song for the Japanese cartoon series
         "Ufo Robot Grendizer", known in Italy as "Atlas UFO robot Goldrake".

/VARIOUS/A-F/Ace64/Harlock_BGM.sid
  TITLE: Ouverture - A Boundless Expance of Space-Water
 ARTIST: Seiji Yokoyama
COMMENT: this song is a BGM from the Japanese cartoon series
         "Uchu Kaizoku Captain Harlock" (translated from Japanese: "Space
         Pirate Captain Harlock").

/VARIOUS/A-F/Ace64/Material_Girl.sid
  TITLE: Material Girl [from Like a Virgin]
 ARTIST: Madonna

  TITLE: Mompracem
 ARTIST: Oliver Onions
COMMENT: from the Italian TV serial "Sandokan".

### /VARIOUS/A-F/Agemixer ####################################################

/VARIOUS/A-F/Agemixer/
COMMENT: Comments from Ari Yliaho (Agemixer) are denoted by (AY).

/VARIOUS/A-F/Agemixer/2_Hours_Of_Work.sid
COMMENT: "I got only 2 hours to work with this compotune, make it executable
         and put it to the music competition." (AY)
  TITLE: Hotta [from Sky 2]
 ARTIST: Sky
COMMENT: Only the beginning of the melody.

/VARIOUS/A-F/Agemixer/Audio_Man_in-game_tune_2.sid
COMMENT: This is the original version of the tune. The version from "Royal
         Arte" demo has a specific playroutine and sounds a little different.

/VARIOUS/A-F/Agemixer/Azmagutah_6581.sid
COMMENT: Agemixer made two versions of this tune, so that the tune would sound
         exactly the same if the right SID chip was used.
         This is the 6581 SID chip version.

/VARIOUS/A-F/Agemixer/Azmagutah_8580.sid
COMMENT: Agemixer made two versions of this tune, so that the tune would sound
         exactly the same if the right SID chip was used.
         This is the 8580 SID chip version.

/VARIOUS/A-F/Agemixer/Breath_of_Fire.sid
COMMENT: The demo "Album of the Year", in which this tune was first released,
         mistitled the tune "Birth of Fire" by accident.

/VARIOUS/A-F/Agemixer/Bronskizak.sid
  TITLE: Smalltown Boy [from The Age of Consent] (0:00-0:30)
 ARTIST: Bronski Beat
  TITLE: Smalltown Boy [from The Age of Consent] (1:01-1:16)
 ARTIST: Bronski Beat
  TITLE: Smalltown Boy [from The Age of Consent] (1:32-1:47)
 ARTIST: Bronski Beat
  TITLE: Smalltown Boy [from The Age of Consent] (2:03)
 ARTIST: Bronski Beat
COMMENT: "Listen to the old disco album 'Flashdance' and you will find those
         actual songs for it." (AY)

/VARIOUS/A-F/Agemixer/Chase.sid
  TITLE: Chase (Theme from Midnight Express) [from the movie]
 ARTIST: Giorgio Moroder

/VARIOUS/A-F/Agemixer/Commando_Remix.sid
  TITLE: Commando, Tune #1
 ARTIST: Rob Hubbard

/VARIOUS/A-F/Agemixer/Da_Shit_Eastwood_Jacks_Red.sid
   NAME: Da Shit (Eastwood Jack's Red Cocks & Green Hens)
COMMENT: That crazy style came up after listening Rednex' hits like "Cotton
         Eyed Joe" and "Old Pop in an Oak" and Hubbard's "Final Synth Sample 1"
         tunes in the background of the idea. :) (AY)

/VARIOUS/A-F/Agemixer/Gameboy_Tune.sid
COMMENT: "Made 21st May 1996, and was eventually released in the Gameboy Intro
         part to Padua's "Splish Splash Demo", at Mekka and Symposium 1998."
         (AY)

/VARIOUS/A-F/Agemixer/Iltasade.sid
COMMENT: "Inspired by Levoton Tuhkimo by Dingo, a Finnish rock legend." (AY)

/VARIOUS/A-F/Agemixer/JCH_Uvsmain.sid
COMMENT: "Another ugly test tune. Someone told me he likes a JCH style and
         JCH does great tunes, so why shouldn't i try the JCH style? The only
         purpose of this tune is to show the capabilities of the Megasound
         music editor." (AY)

/VARIOUS/A-F/Agemixer/Kummatti_City.sid
  TITLE: Kummatti City [from the PC XM module]
 ARTIST: Ari Yliaho (Agemixer)
COMMENT: "'Kummatti' was actually a dark, tedious and little part of the town
         where i lived during my studytime. The name 'Kummatti City' is just
         sarcasm..." (AY)

/VARIOUS/A-F/Agemixer/Let_Me_Hear_You_Say_Yeah.sid
  TITLE: Let Me Hear You Say Yeah
 ARTIST: FPI Project

/VARIOUS/A-F/Agemixer/Lion_King.sid
  TITLE: The Circle of Life
 ARTIST: Elton John

/VARIOUS/A-F/Agemixer/Little_Lies.sid
  TITLE: Little Lies [from Tango in the Night]
 ARTIST: Fleetwood Mac

/VARIOUS/A-F/Agemixer/Myblock.sid
COMMENT: This was the shared winner of the Tiny SID Compo 2005 (256 bytes
         category).

/VARIOUS/A-F/Agemixer/National_Park_jonga_mix.sid
COMMENT: "This is one theme of our jonga live music show at Kaustinen Folk
         music festival.  The persons playing were:
         Petri Ala-Louesniemi: Hungarian Moon harp with Jonga reverb
         Anton Bruhin: Moon harps, jews harp
         Ari Yliaho: telescope digeridoo
         Unknown band visitor: talking drum". (AY)

/VARIOUS/A-F/Agemixer/Nightshift.sid
COMMENT: This sid has won the Core 2001 music competition.

/VARIOUS/A-F/Agemixer/Oldskoolcrayfish.sid
  TITLE: 2 Hours Of Work
 ARTIST: Ari Yliaho (Agemixer)
COMMENT: "This is the finished version. It took a total of 4 hours." (AY)
         See /VARIOUS/A-F/Agemixer/2_Hours_Of_Work.sid for more information.

/VARIOUS/A-F/Agemixer/Patakakkonen.sid
  TITLE: Finnish Whistler <?>
 ARTIST: Finnish Folk Song
COMMENT: "A Finnish cooking show on TV, originally an old Finnish folk song
         whistled by many a chef. The original tune is a legend itself... The
         tune was made just for fun while I was talking with Janne Suni
         (Tempest/Damage) on the phone. We laughed on the floor for this
         comical melody while composing it... Sorry, no recipes here! (Later on
         the tune was released with Snacks #1 infofile.)" (AY)

/VARIOUS/A-F/Agemixer/Rainbow.sid
COMMENT: "This tune was intended to become real music some day." (AY)

/VARIOUS/A-F/Agemixer/Robocop_3_remake.sid
  TITLE: Robocop 3, Tune #1
 ARTIST: Jeroen Tel

         Listen very carefully to Licence_and_Turn_The_Disk.sid #2 and

         different key to each other. This was intentionally done by Alien.

### /VARIOUS/A-F/Almered_Per #################################################

/VARIOUS/A-F/Almered_Per/
COMMENT: Comments by Per Almered are deonted (PA)

/VARIOUS/A-F/Almered_Per/DDND_Short.sid
COMMENT: Based on one of Per's XM modules, "Death does not discriminate".

/VARIOUS/A-F/Almered_Per/Fatale.sid
  TITLE: Fatale [from the Atari module]
 ARTIST: Per Almered
COMMENT: Conversion of his own tune: "I couldn't resist the challenge of
         converting an 8-channel mod to a 3-channel C64 song. Can you blame me?
         (Oh, you can? Well, but, I... [ouch!])" (PA)

/VARIOUS/A-F/Almered_Per/Hemingway.sid
COMMENT: "Finally getting to grips with JCH's editor and the way it handles
         arpeggios, I put together this little tune. As Tomas Danko JR (one of
         the many deservedly legendary C64 musicians I've had the pleasure of
         talking to) pointed out: ``It's 'Rock me Amadeus!'´´. 8-)" (PA)

/VARIOUS/A-F/Almered_Per/Nothing_Compares_2_U.sid
  TITLE: Nothing Compares 2 U
 ARTIST: Sinead O'Connor
COMMENT: "Not much to say about this one, really, except it's supposed to sound
         this way, really. Used as some sort of joke in the "note-file" for
         Talk." (PA)

/VARIOUS/A-F/Almered_Per/Sub.sid
COMMENT: "Just for fun, I put together 3 or 4 small songs for a computer game,
         but they were never used in the final release. I liked one of the
         songs so much I thought it deserved a C64 rendition. The filtered bass
         and hihats came as a nice surprise when I finally got around to
         listening to it outside of the C64-emulator. 8-)" (PA)

/VARIOUS/A-F/Almered_Per/Telephone_Call.sid
  TITLE: The Telephone Call [from Electric Cafe]
 ARTIST: Kraftwerk
COMMENT: "After weeks of searching, I finally found a C64 music editor that I
         liked. This Kraftwerk cover is the first song I finished in it. I had
         lots of fun [NOT!] doing those silly phone-beeps." (PA)

/VARIOUS/A-F/Almered_Per/Under_Norrskenet.sid
  TITLE: Under Norrskenet [from Nordman]
 ARTIST: Nordman
COMMENT: "Here's another cover, this time of Swedish group Nordman's song
         'Under norrskenet'. I competed with it at Hype '97, and it placed
         third, which is ok, considering all the other entries were xm's or
         mod's." (PA)

/VARIOUS/A-F/Almered_Per/Van_Gogh.sid
COMMENT: "This is the song used in Talk, my first (and probably, but not
         hopefully) last C64-demo. It's written to fit into the demo, although
         some of the synchronized effects originally intended never fit into
         the memory of the C64... 8-(" (PA)

         Marek Bilinski was some kind of a Polish J.M.Jarre, and had a string
         of instrumental hits back in the 80's.

         of instrumental hits back in the 80's.

/VARIOUS/A-F/Ames_John/Chrono_Trigger-Battle.sid
  TITLE: Battle 1 [from the SNES game Chrono Trigger]
 ARTIST: Yasunori Mitsuda
COMMENT: "Chrono Trigger, in my opinion, ties with GoldenSun for Best
          RPG of all time. One of the largest reasons is the music. This
          is my version of the battle theme from Chrono Trigger.
          Unfortunately, I had to cut out the drum track from part of
          the song to make room for the marimba part. (It wouldn't have
          worked to mix them, the drum track is too intense.) Oh well,
          the rest of the song turned out nice." (JA)

/VARIOUS/A-F/Ames_John/Chrono_Trigger-Battle_2.sid
  TITLE: Battle 2 [from the SNES game Chrono Trigger]
 ARTIST: Yasunori Mitsuda
COMMENT: "This is a battle theme from the Chrono Trigger Demo that never made
         it into the final game. Pity, too." (JA)

/VARIOUS/A-F/Ames_John/Jill_of_the_Jungle.sid
COMMENT: "This is the (almost) complete soundtrack from Epic Megagames' great
         puzzle/action game 'Jill of the Jungle.' It has some of my favorite
         OPL3 music in it, so naturally I did a SID mix. The one song missing
         is "It," the ending theme. This is because the timing was so totally
         screwed up that I couldn't make head or tail of it. Oh well. BTW, the
         song names here are the filenames minus the .ddt extension. P.S. If
         anyone wants to attempt a C=64 port of Jill (not outside the realm of
         possibility, in my opinion,) feel free to use this. The sample channel
         could be used for playing the game sounds." (JA)
(#1)
  TITLE: Funky [from the PC game Jill of the Jungle]
 ARTIST: Dan Froelich
(#2)
  TITLE: Dan [from the PC game Jill of the Jungle]
 ARTIST: Dan Froelich
(#3)
  TITLE: Spiders [from the PC game Jill of the Jungle]
 ARTIST: Dan Froelich
(#4)
  TITLE: Stealth [from the PC game Jill of the Jungle]
 ARTIST: Dan Froelich
(#5)
  TITLE: Zeppelin [from the PC game Jill of the Jungle]
 ARTIST: Dan Froelich
(#6)
  TITLE: Ominous [from the PC game Jill of the Jungle]
 ARTIST: Dan Froelich
(#7)
  TITLE: Jupiter [from the PC game Jill of the Jungle]
 ARTIST: Dan Froelich
(#8)
  TITLE: Seven [from the PC game Jill of the Jungle]
 ARTIST: Dan Froelich

 ARTIST: Koji Kondo
COMMENT: "The dungeon theme from Nintendo's 'Legend of Zelda.'" (JA)

/VARIOUS/A-F/Ames_John/Lithium.sid
  TITLE: Lithium [from Nevermind]
 ARTIST: Nirvana
COMMENT: "Another Nirvana song, at least sort of. It's a SID conversion of an
         Amiga MOD that I found of "Lithium." However, the MOD is pretty lame
         compared to the actual song. But anyway, here it is." (JA)

/VARIOUS/A-F/Ames_John/MM2-Flashman_Stage.sid
  TITLE: Flashman stage [from the NES game Mega Man II]
 ARTIST: C. Manami, Yuukichan's Papa, Ogeretsu, and Ietel
COMMENT: "All the versions I've heard have been crystalline bells and synths,
         and I would think to myself, "AAAGGHH!!! This is SUPPOSED to be a
         tenor sax and electric guitar, idiots!" So that's what I attempted
         here." (JA)

/VARIOUS/A-F/Ames_John/MM2-Heatman_Stage.sid
  TITLE: Heatman stage [from the NES game Mega Man II]
 ARTIST: C. Manami, Yuukichan's Papa, Ogeretsu, and Ietel

 ARTIST: Capcom Sound Team

/VARIOUS/A-F/Ames_John/MMX-Storm_Eagle.sid
  TITLE: Storm Eagle's stage [from the SNES game Mega Man X]
 ARTIST: Capcom Sound Team
COMMENT: "I LOVE this song. Sorry about the crummy approximation of a
         guitar, this was my first SID, and anyway, I like it like this." (JA)

/VARIOUS/A-F/Ames_John/Maniac_Mansion.sid
  TITLE: Maniac Mansion, Tune #1
 ARTIST: Chris Grigg & David Lawrence
COMMENT: Based on the Nintendo NES' version of the theme.
         "Okay, this one is more than just another remix of the Maniac Mansion
         theme song; it's the song from the Nintendo version, which had WAY
         better music. The Nintendo theme song actually had a melody (imagine
         that!), so I did this one instead." (JA)

/VARIOUS/A-F/Ames_John/Megaman_X-Select.sid
COMMENT: "The two "stage select screen" songs from Capcom's Megaman X. The
         first is the normal Stage Select, the second is the one played after
         you defeat all 8 Mavericks." (JA)
(#1)

 ARTIST: Capcom Sound Team

 ARTIST: Toshihiko Horiyama

  TITLE: Stage Select (Sigma's Fortress)
 ARTIST: Akemi Kimura
COMMENT: "This is the "Sigma's Fortress" stage select music from Capcom's
         Megaman X5." (JA)

/VARIOUS/A-F/Ames_John/MicroMan_gameplay.sid
  TITLE: Microman
 ARTIST: Brian L. Goble
COMMENT: "This is the in-game song from the Windows game 'Microman.' I did a
         SID remix of this, since it is one of my favorite MIDI songs. It
         worked out well, except that in a couple places I had to remove some
         extra tracks due to lack of channels." (JA)

/VARIOUS/A-F/Ames_John/Moon_Patrol.sid
  TITLE: Moon Patrol [from the arcade game]
 ARTIST: <?>
COMMENT: "This is the ingame music from Moon Patrol, which happens to be my
          favorite arcade game. It's a great song, but the Bad Bros. Inc.
          version was BAD, and the only other SID author who took a stab at
          it was Jesper Olsen. (Some guy did the Atari version, but that
          sucked compared to the arcade/64 version.) So I made my own remix.
          I added some other parts to it, basically with a nicer drum track
          and another voice added onto the bassline. Actually, this started
          out as a Protracker MOD, but I just HAD to do a SID version of
          this." (JA)

/VARIOUS/A-F/Ames_John/Myst-The_Myst_Book.sid
  TITLE: <?>
 ARTIST: Robyn Miller
COMMENT: "This is from Cyan Software's game 'Myst.' It is the music that plays
         as you watch the fly-in on the Myst book's linking panel." (JA)

/VARIOUS/A-F/Ames_John/Pokemon-Elite_Four.sid
  TITLE: Pokemon Gym [from the GB games Pokemon Red/Blue/Yellow/Green]
 ARTIST: Junichi Masuda
COMMENT: "The Elite Four/Gym theme from Pokemon (all versions.) I'm not
          really into Pokemon (I kinda like it,) but it has really nice
          music. This is one of the best themes in the game." (JA)

/VARIOUS/A-F/Ames_John/SMB-Water_song.sid
  TITLE: Water Theme [from the NES game Super Mario Bros]
 ARTIST: Koji Kondo
COMMENT: "I always imagined this one with a bouncy bass and an accordion, so
         here it is." (JA)

/VARIOUS/A-F/Ames_John/Smells_Like_Teen_Spirit.sid
  TITLE: Smells Like Teen Spirit [from Nevermind]
 ARTIST: Nirvana
COMMENT: "I really like Nirvana's musical style, but I was very unimpressed
         with the SID mixes of their songs that I found. So I SID-mixed 'Smells
         Like Teen Spirit.' (JA)
