          Super Mario Bros., but as of yet the only complete songs are the
          main game theme and the underground theme. I plan to do another
          version where I will remix them in full SID glory instead of
          having them sound like Nintendo music!" (JA)

### /VARIOUS/A-F/Artlace #####################################################

/VARIOUS/A-F/Artlace/Bended.sid
COMMENT: "This tune was composed to test one of my players only.
          Actually, it's nothing more than having fun in the editor." (AB)

/VARIOUS/A-F/Artlace/Cyberdox.sid
COMMENT: "This is one of those so-called long-and-boring tunes, inspired
          by such classics as Thomas Detert and Markus Schneider. They
          gave the style, I added the boredom." (AB)

/VARIOUS/A-F/Artlace/Tron_Mix.sid
COMMENT: "This tune was made after hearing a music of a tron-like game on
          Amiga. Its name wasn't 'Tron' but the idea was similar." (AB)

  TITLE: True Faith [from Substance 1987]
 ARTIST: New Order

  TITLE: Visitors [from Masterpieces]
 ARTIST: Koto

/VARIOUS/A-F/Blues_Muz/Gallefoss_Glenn/Ode_to_Bugg.sid
  TITLE: <?> [from the Amiga MOD module]
 ARTIST: Bug
COMMENT: "[A cover of] Mystified by Jogeir Lijehdal.  [However], when I showed
         Geir Tjelta this tune, I had another name for it..  And then he came
         with this story about Bug or Bogg having done the original tune and
         that he had committed suicide.. So I changed the name of the tune to
         'Ode to Bugg' .." (GRG).
         Stein Erik Giske (Bug of Subway, Razor 1911) was killed in 1992 as a
         result of a car accident, and not suicide (Info from Jan Harries)

### /VARIOUS/A-F/Blues_Muz/Nordboe_Kjell #####################################

/VARIOUS/A-F/Blues_Muz/Nordboe_Kjell/
COMMENT: Sadly, Kjell Nordbø passed away in June 2005. All comments by him
         are denoted (KJ).

/VARIOUS/A-F/Blues_Muz/Nordboe_Kjell/1001_Ride.sid
  TITLE: Herning'93
 ARTIST: Blues Muz'

/VARIOUS/A-F/Blues_Muz/Nordboe_Kjell/A_New_Life.sid
(#1)
   NAME: In Another Time & Space
(#2)
   NAME: I Can See
(#3)
   NAME: Siv My Illusion
(#4)
   NAME: Not Far Away
(#5)
   NAME: Very Close Indeed
(#6)
   NAME: Skycity
(#7)
   NAME: Kvile På Sofaen
(#8)
   NAME: Meaning
COMMENT: "Meaning" sounds like it restarts after a while, it doesn't! (KN)
(#9)
   NAME: Advantage
(#10)
   NAME: Full Time Blues
(#11)
   NAME: I Havets Vold
COMMENT: "'I Havets Vold' is a story about a sailboat and a duckling, two
         worlds but both are on the sea, the sailboat enjoys a trip at sea in
         the great weather while the duckling is drifting on the waves without
         any idea about a sailboat, which are coming closer and closer all the
         time, with no idea about a duckling, and the result is fatal. The
         sailboat runs over the duckling and leaving it behind, dead,
         continuing its travel." (KN)
(#12)
   NAME: True Lust
(#13)
   NAME: As Long As...
(#14)
   NAME: Cold
(#15)
   NAME: Hymn to the Living Dead
(#16)
   NAME: Freedom
COMMENT: "'Freedom' sounds like it restarts after a while, it doesn't!" (KN)
(#17)
   NAME: Trying the Carousel
(#18)
   NAME: Spacebeing Dollin
(#19)
   NAME: All On Board

         while the tune was playing.

/VARIOUS/A-F/Blues_Muz/Nordboe_Kjell/Good_Night.sid
COMMENT: "Dedicated to Kristian." (KN)

/VARIOUS/A-F/Blues_Muz/Nordboe_Kjell/Heidi.sid
COMMENT: "Dedicated to Heidi." (KN)

/VARIOUS/A-F/Blues_Muz/Nordboe_Kjell/Honey_Soup.sid
COMMENT: "Dedicated to David." (KN)

/VARIOUS/A-F/Blues_Muz/Nordboe_Kjell/Jallas_Quest.sid
COMMENT: "I did stop it right there, maybe anyone of you want to make a
         continue of the adventure?" (KN)

/VARIOUS/A-F/Blues_Muz/Nordboe_Kjell/Joy_in_Repetition.sid
COMMENT: "If we were together. But we are not" (KN)

/VARIOUS/A-F/Blues_Muz/Nordboe_Kjell/Ladies_King.sid
COMMENT: "A song about THE MAN OF THE WORLD, in charge, the party attraction."
         (KN)

/VARIOUS/A-F/Blues_Muz/Nordboe_Kjell/Last_Flight.sid
COMMENT: "'Last Flight' is the song about a person which is taking drugs. It
         is a sad story for both the family to the user, and the user itself,
         which later in the song dies, it's the user's last flight. The family
         which stands back with their dead son or daughter is so unhappy and
         sad that they don't know anything anymore. They're feeling a huge
         emptyness inside, they only wish their child back again, staying
         alive. But that will never happen... The last few minutes when the
         child was alive, it dreamed about a sky of marvelous and wonderful
         things flying all around. The longer it lasted the longer away this
         person was to all real things we know here on earth. This child, so
         young, has left the world. Not alive anymore. Doesn't exist, only the
         body left for the family to bury and their memories to keep. Why do
         some want to legalize it?" (KN)

         He makes music on the Amiga." (KN)

/VARIOUS/A-F/Blues_Muz/Nordboe_Kjell/Surrounded.sid
COMMENT: "'Surrounded' is a song about a hunted man which realize that his
         last minutes has come and he will now die very soon, the enemy are
         circle in and you watch their faces, they haven't discovered you yet
         but they will every second now and afterwards you watch your own
         funeral, from another place." (KN)

/VARIOUS/A-F/Blues_Muz/Nordboe_Kjell/Sweet_Like_Sugar.sid
COMMENT: "Dedicated to Geir." (KN)

/VARIOUS/A-F/Blues_Muz/Nordboe_Kjell/That_Sign.sid
  TITLE: Classical
 ARTIST: Kjell Nordbø

/VARIOUS/A-F/Blues_Muz/Nordboe_Kjell/Two_Truths.sid
COMMENT: "The God gives, The Evil takes." (KN)

/VARIOUS/A-F/Blues_Muz/Nordboe_Kjell/Use_My_Fire.sid
COMMENT: "'Use My Fire' is a song which is about a human which ain't included
         in anything to the community, like;  have no job, doesn't have any
         relationship with other people, and this human got so much willing,
         but nobody cares. Use My Fire! is all what this person is begging
         for, to get a chance to show that he or she doesn't want to die, but
         live, like all others, which got money and a place, family and
         friends. It's a song about losers which want to make the steps out of
         nowhere and into the better... Does anybody care for them?" (KN)

/VARIOUS/A-F/Blues_Muz/Nordboe_Kjell/X-Factor.sid
COMMENT: One of four tunes pasted together to form Blues Muz's Herning 93,
         their music competition entry for The Party 1993.

### /VARIOUS/A-F/Blues_Muz/Roestoeen_Kristian/ ###############################

/VARIOUS/A-F/Blues_Muz/Roestoeen_Kristian/
COMMENT: Comments by Kristian himself are denoted by (KR).

/VARIOUS/A-F/Blues_Muz/Roestoeen_Kristian/Babaland.sid
COMMENT: "The bassline is based on a song made by some local band where I
         live." (KR)

/VARIOUS/A-F/Blues_Muz/Roestoeen_Kristian/Backseat.sid
  TITLE: Smurfsången (1:00)
 ARTIST: P. Kartner, Linlee, B. Carlgren
COMMENT: "Kinda happy happy joy joy song... there's a sequence in the middle
         which is a cover of some children's TV-theme but I can't quite
         remember which." (KR)
         Smurfsången translates to "The Smurf song".

/VARIOUS/A-F/Blues_Muz/Roestoeen_Kristian/Bearskin.sid

         Heavies." (KR)

         putting a player on it - an echo voice in the last section
         disappeared! ;) This calls for a remix hehe..." (KR)

/VARIOUS/A-F/Blues_Muz/Sommersten_Eivind/Worktunes/Birthday.sid
  TITLE: Malbrouk s'en va-t-en guerre
 ARTIST: Traditional
COMMENT: An Arab tune that was brought to Europe during the crusades and
         became popular during the french revolution, ever sinced spawned
         many songs, including "For He's a Jolly Good Fellow".

### /VARIOUS/A-F/Blues_Muz\ ##################################################

### /VARIOUS/A-F/Boogaloo ####################################################

/VARIOUS/A-F/Boogaloo/Bumblebee.sid
  TITLE: The Flight of the Bumble-bee
 ARTIST: Nikolai Rimsky-Korsakov

/VARIOUS/A-F/Boogaloo/Melody_in_making.sid
  TITLE: Test Drive II: The Duel (remix)
 ARTIST: Kris Hatlelid

/VARIOUS/A-F/Boogaloo/Snake_Fighter.sid
COMMENT: All those weird references to snakes (eg the HZ demo "Snake or Die")
         comes from strange Horizon rituals. At the HZ party in Vårby 1989 the
         HZ members were not only dressed in training suits with HZ logotypes,
         they also brought rubber snakes bought from the closest toy store,
         which they used to whip visitors and each other with. (Spank! Spank!)

### /VARIOUS/A-F/Chotaire ####################################################

/VARIOUS/A-F/Chotaire/Always_Looking.sid

 ARTIST: Eric Idle (music & text)

         until 1994.

/VARIOUS/A-F/Chotaire/Blue_Mountains.sid
  TITLE: When the Chariot Comes
 ARTIST: Traditional Negro Spiritual

/VARIOUS/A-F/Chotaire/Hit_the_Shit.sid
  TITLE: <?> (Unknownr.sid)
 ARTIST: Reyn Ouwehand

/VARIOUS/A-F/Chotaire/Legoland_3_Theme.sid
COMMENT: Remix of /VARIOUS/M-R/Red_Devil/Legoland_3_tune_1.sid.

/VARIOUS/A-F/Chotaire/Positive.sid
COMMENT: "[...] But now let me tell something about this music. It was composed
         and tracked within  hours on january, 23rd. This is a kind of jazz
         tune, it's not my style ya know, but I felt like doing a tune like
         this because lots a people like it. Therefore I added sum of my music
         style to the tune, that's why it sounds a bit techno like.. Try to
         enjoy this tune with a stereo, you'll like it I guess.. By the way
         remember that all C128 computers have a different filter set on their
         sid chips,so the music sounds a bit different than on normal c64
         computers, you'll hear the difference on the bass, the filters doesn't
         open theirselves so much on C128! But who the fuck cares, this music
         runs on all computers, that's what counts! [...]"
         (Taken from a note added to the tune "Positive" by Chotaire himself)

/VARIOUS/A-F/Chotaire/Rhythm_is_a_Dancer.sid
  TITLE: Rhythm is a Dancer
 ARTIST: Snap

/VARIOUS/A-F/Chotaire/Technology_2.sid
  TITLE: Our Darkness
 ARTIST: Anne Clark

/VARIOUS/A-F/Chotaire/What_Is_Love.sid
  TITLE: What is Love
 ARTIST: Haddaway

(#6)
COMMENT: This plays when the time is running out.
(#7)
COMMENT: This plays when the time has run out.

### /VARIOUS/A-F/CreaMD ######################################################

/VARIOUS/A-F/CreaMD/
COMMENT: CreaMD is short for "Creative Music Design".

/VARIOUS/A-F/CreaMD/Black_Sistah.sid
COMMENT: Inspired by /Derrett_Jay/Counterforce.sid, subtune #1.
         "I actually ripped (*cough* ;) first 10 second motive from the tune
         and the rest is developed differently (in a quite crazy way ;-)"
         (CreaMD)

  TITLE: ZIVOT to je nude

         version of Kung-Fu Master.

/VARIOUS/A-F/CreaMD/Gonna_Make_You_Sweep.sid
COMMENT: Won first place at the Scenest+Rage 1998 music competition.

/VARIOUS/A-F/CreaMD/Good_Vibes.sid
COMMENT: Won first place at Forever 2001 music competition.

/VARIOUS/A-F/CreaMD/Happy_Birthday_Maccie.sid
  TITLE: Happy Birthday (1:21-1:30)
 ARTIST: Mildred J. Hill

/VARIOUS/A-F/CreaMD/Hurry_up.sid
  TITLE: The Flintstones [from the TV series] (1:17-1:39)
 ARTIST: Hoyt Curtin (music), William Hanna & Joseph Barbera (lyrics)

/VARIOUS/A-F/CreaMD/I_Am_In_Love.sid
COMMENT: "I composed it when I was in love with a girl called Galina. She had
         short dark brown hair, blue eyes and a beautiful face. At least I
         thought so. She was self-confident, charismatic, not this tell me what
         I should do and I will do it master type. I loved her but still didn't
         know what she really thought. She left the university and didn't reply
         on my letters. Maybe when I'm older I'll write some memoirs and I will
         write the full story then." (Comment by CreaMD)

/VARIOUS/A-F/CreaMD/Missing_You.sid
  TITLE: Every Breath You Take [from Synchronicity]
 ARTIST: The Police
COMMENT: Based on Puff Daddy's remake "Missing You".

/VARIOUS/A-F/CreaMD/Mouth_In_The_Foot.sid
COMMENT: This tune won the music competition at the Forever Quattro
         party in 2003.

/VARIOUS/A-F/CreaMD/Pressure_Cooker_remix.sid
(#1)
  TITLE: Pressure Cooker [from the Atari 2600 game]
 ARTIST: <?>
COMMENT: Covers Warren Pilkington's C64 cover, which is
         /VARIOUS/S-Z/Waz/Tribute_To_The_Atari_2600.sid, Tune #3.
(#2)
  TITLE: Pressure Cooker [from the Atari 2600 game]

### /VARIOUS/A-F/Daf\ ########################################################

### /VARIOUS/A-F/Dalezy ######################################################

/VARIOUS/A-F/Dalezy/
COMMENT: Dalezy's own comments are denoted (RE).

/VARIOUS/A-F/Dalezy/Kingstons_Sick.sid
COMMENT: "I sadly never managed to get this tune packed without flaws, so
         until I found a solution you have to listen to this more or less
         hollow sounding version of the tune. It took part in sidcompo03 and
         ended up beeing voted for the 9th place in the jury-voting and 10th
         in the public voting. Trivial fun: the title is actually an anagram
         (like more of my other songtitles)." (RE)

/VARIOUS/A-F/Dalezy/Sit_In_My_Underwear.sid
   NAME: Sit In My Underwear, Drinking Pepsi

/VARIOUS/A-F/Dalezy/boese_hexe.sid
COMMENT: "This tune competed at tum 2002 and ended up being 2nd." (RE)

/VARIOUS/A-F/Dalezy/crimson_gate.sid
COMMENT: "crimson gate is part of creators' halloween03-musickcollection. The
         tune that was originally in the collection suffered from a small bug
         that caused it to literary crack around 00:43, however this is the
         real version." (RE)

/VARIOUS/A-F/Dalezy/fjordgubbe.sid
COMMENT: "fjordgubbe is part of a series of tunes that I made in about a week
         for my live-set. Cheers to all swedes that love the title." (RE)

/VARIOUS/A-F/Dalezy/iced_aliens.sid
COMMENT: "my entry for breakpoint 2003. it became 2nd and resulted in me being
         quite proud, because it was basically the first time that i made it
         to the top3 at a bigger party." (RE)

/VARIOUS/A-F/Dalezy/jegoroff.sid
COMMENT: "6th place at the x2004-musickcompo. I did this one the night before
         we headed off to the party, so the result isn't too shabby at all."
         (RE)

/VARIOUS/A-F/Dalezy/plofs.sid
COMMENT: "This one is a remake of a pc-tune going by the same name, which is
         originally done by malmen. It got used in vandalism news #42." (RE)

/VARIOUS/A-F/Dalezy/silkweed.sid
COMMENT: "One of my personal favourites, yet it suffers from the same
         problem like most of my tunes: it's way too short. Came 2nd at
         breakpoint 2004." (RE)

/VARIOUS/A-F/Dalezy/solskogen_2004_invitation.sid
COMMENT: "A real quickly done tune done for the invitation intro for Solskogen
         in Norway. I got told it gets boring after 4 hours of constant
         listening." (RE)

/VARIOUS/A-F/Dalezy/tetzlaff.sid
  TITLE: Ein Herz und Eine Seele (from the TV comedy series)
 ARTIST: <?>
COMMENT: "It's made for fun purposes mainly. Based on the theme of a
          german comedy series from the 60s. The main-actor was called
          Tetzlaff." (comment by Dalezy)

/VARIOUS/A-F/Dalezy/towerflop.sid
COMMENT: "Another favourite of mine, reached the 1st place at tUM 2003." (RE)

### /VARIOUS/A-F/ELA #########################################################

/VARIOUS/A-F/ELA/
COMMENT: Comments by ELA himself are denoted by (ELA).

/VARIOUS/A-F/ELA/Amnesia.sid
COMMENT: "found this on a disk somewhere, it sounds like my typical tunes but I
         cannot remember making it. Editor=FutureComposer" (ELA)

/VARIOUS/A-F/ELA/Babar_Elefanten.sid
COMMENT: "Toying with filters and harmonies. Editor=SoundMonitor" (ELA)

/VARIOUS/A-F/ELA/Bjelleklang.sid
COMMENT: "Dont know why I called it Bjelleklang.. it's not an X-mas song :-)
         Almost sure I used Rockmonitor2 here." (ELA)

/VARIOUS/A-F/ELA/Carl_I_Hagen.sid
COMMENT: "A short tune made with FutureComposer II from Beastie Boys. It has a
         strange break in the middle thats quite fun. The name of the tune is
         given because it was first thing I thought of when I saved it. I'm not
         a supporter of the politician Carl I. Hagen. Editor=FC" (ELA)

/VARIOUS/A-F/ELA/Choir_inspired_stuff.sid
COMMENT: "I had made this tune first on a editor from Panoramic that didnt make
         executable code (the only bugged version). Thats why it was then
         copied into an editor that Megastyle gave me instead. Its a somewhat
         choir-like tune (I play piano for a local choir)" (ELA)

/VARIOUS/A-F/ELA/Cirkus_Death.sid
COMMENT: "It's a rotten tune, with lots of bass/filter and no melody. Someone
         actually used this tune in a demo (to my amazement). Editor=FC" (ELA)

/VARIOUS/A-F/ELA/Competition_Tune.sid
COMMENT: "A quite long tune from me for once. Swedish & Norwegian magazine
         "Dator" had a C64-music-compo. This was my contribution. I like it but
         it lacks melodies. There are several different sounding sections in it
         because I stuffed in 4 other unfinished tunes into it. Editor=FC"
         (ELA)

/VARIOUS/A-F/ELA/Complete_solo.sid
COMMENT: "Made with the Finnish Gold FC. The start has something but the ending
         is... bah!" (ELA)

/VARIOUS/A-F/ELA/Concluded_Errors.sid
COMMENT: "The Errors had told Zaphod/Antimon that they wanted some music from
         me to use in demos but never used the ones I gave them. Again a lack
         of melody makes the tune a bit uninteresting. The bass&drums use is so
         typical me (master of repeatcodes) Editor=FC" (ELA)

/VARIOUS/A-F/ELA/Crap.sid
COMMENT: "a not so great tune.... Editor=Soundmonitor" (ELA)

/VARIOUS/A-F/ELA/Da_Di_Da.sid
COMMENT: "Psycho opening, then over to the more typical fast basslines
         Editor=Soundmonitor" (ELA)

/VARIOUS/A-F/ELA/Desperate.sid
COMMENT: "Made with Megastyle's editor. I had Quit Cosine, and then got word
         from Megastyle that they wanted me as a member making tons of
         intro/demo-tunes. I got their editor but they never used ANY of my
         music. Their player was based on JB/MON's Stormlord tunes. I decided
         to join my local friends in the Norway/Finland/Germany-based group
         Antimon instead. Most of my music had been used by them anyway. This
         is like most of my tunes in in C-minor and rather sad sounding. I put
         a lot of work into this one (and not quitting early like usually do).
         I used this tune in a demopart with an atom-plotter (Antimon is an
         atom ya know). Editor=Megastyle-editor" (ELA)

/VARIOUS/A-F/ELA/ELAs_First.sid
COMMENT: "I had just got hold of Rockmonitor2 in 1987 and slowly tried out what
         it had. This tune still contains lots of music from the default-tune
         and probably all the default sounds as it took months before I learned
         how to make my own sounds. It has no drumsamples here either because
         that took a while to learn too. I converted it to Soundmonitor to save
         space (it didnt need the sample data anyway)" (ELA)

/VARIOUS/A-F/ELA/En_annen_gang.sid
COMMENT: "Made in SoundMonitor when in a local group MG-2 (very unknown) I had
         no idea how to make good sounds then and you can hear it on this one.
         Before I got Soundmonitor I'd only made tunes in RockmonitorII." (ELA)

/VARIOUS/A-F/ELA/Filter_bass.sid
COMMENT: "Very nice bass. I was toying much with filters at the time. Made in
         SoundMonitor as a member of Suppliers. The Suppliers wanted tunes that
         took less raster but it took a long time before I got hold of
         FutureComposer." (ELA)

/VARIOUS/A-F/ELA/Finnish_tune.sid
COMMENT: "Sx of Antimon sent me the notesheet to this tune convert to C64.
         Originally its by a band from Finland. I've never heard the original
         tune. Editor=FC" (ELA)

/VARIOUS/A-F/ELA/Flesk.sid
COMMENT: "This sounds weird, but drives on & on. It's a mix of two tunes I'd
         made. This tune were never used in demos but to my amazement it got
         airtime on the 6581 SID radioshow. I met the show-host Hardhat on IRC
         one day not knowing who he was. He told me knew my music and
         especially liked "Flesk". Later I understood that he'd played it on
         radio (a radioshow in Sacramento that only played sid-tunes).
         Editor=Megastyle-editor" (ELA)

/VARIOUS/A-F/ELA/Frantic_2.sid
COMMENT: "Considered my best by several others. There never was a Frantic1. The
         tune was used a few times by Antimon. I wanted to make it much longer
         but gave up :-) Editor=FC" (ELA)

/VARIOUS/A-F/ELA/Frantic_3.sid
COMMENT: "A nice intro tune. I used it in my "Goodbye Suppliers"-demo.
         Editor=FC" (ELA)

/VARIOUS/A-F/ELA/Gal_Maate.sid
COMMENT: "Filter mayhem, quite nice sounding with lots of atmosphere.
         Editor=Soundmonitor" (ELA)

/VARIOUS/A-F/ELA/Gledelig_Oh_Joy.sid
COMMENT: "Based on an old tune I had in a band. Its darn cheerful and feels
         better with the band.... Editor=RM2" (ELA)

/VARIOUS/A-F/ELA/Go_Gadget_Go.sid
COMMENT: "The worlds most intense sid-tune. Editor=FutureComposer" (ELA)

/VARIOUS/A-F/ELA/Haba_2.sid
COMMENT: "Tune 2 of 3 for a game. Editor=Soundmonitor" (ELA)

/VARIOUS/A-F/ELA/Haba_3.sid
COMMENT: "Tune 3 og 3 for a game. Editor=Soundmonitor" (ELA)

/VARIOUS/A-F/ELA/Hans_Inge_Tune.sid
  TITLE: Han som formådde
 ARTIST: Hans Inge Fagervik
COMMENT: "A choirsong-transfer. An early hit and used a lot. This is the tune
         most people remember me for. I learned this song at a christian school
         where I sang in the shool choir and copied the notesheet. The song is
         so short that I had to transpose it several times along to make it
         last. Editor=FC" (ELA)

/VARIOUS/A-F/ELA/Intro_Bug.sid
COMMENT: "My first Soundmonitor-tune. I made a few bars of music and then just
         shuffled and transposed them around to make a long tune." (ELA)

/VARIOUS/A-F/ELA/Introtune.sid
COMMENT: "a very early FC-tune that I actually used in an intro.
         Editor=FutureComposer" (ELA)

/VARIOUS/A-F/ELA/JCH-like_tune.sid

         Editor=Soundmonitor" (ELA)

         Editor=Soundmonitor" (ELA)

/VARIOUS/A-F/ELA/Rec.sid

         Thats what I never managed to make in Futurecomposer and later
         editors. Editor=RM2 or 3.. not sure" (ELA)

/VARIOUS/A-F/ELA/Redivivo.sid
COMMENT: Me and a friend just tried to make a tune in rockmon2 but it sounds
         like we're both drunk or worse. Editor=RM2" (ELA)

/VARIOUS/A-F/ELA/Running_in_the_woods.sid
COMMENT: "Short test-tune! It works quite well. The name comes from a comment
         by Henning Rokling's brother. When he heard Henning's "Game_example"/
         tune#1 he said: "It's as if you are running in the woods!". When I
         made it Zaphod/Antimon was sitting in a corner of the room reading
         magazines and mumbling "that sounds good", "don't do that", "that's
         better". Co-credits to Zap :-) Editor=FC" (ELA)

/VARIOUS/A-F/ELA/Rythmic_5_er.sid
COMMENT: "This has a weird count, kind of 5 bars instead of 4. It's not 5/4,
         but... something else... A nice slap bass in the last sequence. I like
         it because it sounds different but it builds up too slowly. Editor=FC"
         (ELA)

/VARIOUS/A-F/ELA/Sang.sid
COMMENT: "Editor=RM2" (ELA)

/VARIOUS/A-F/ELA/Sec_Gallup.sid
COMMENT: "Lots of bass riffs and little melody. A double-voice bass near the
         end sounds quite cool (IMHO). Antimon used this in an example for a
         musicrip-frontend. Editor=FC" (ELA)

/VARIOUS/A-F/ELA/SingAlongSong.sid
COMMENT: "Quite nice (considering I made it). Future composer was the tool as
         usual." (ELA)

/VARIOUS/A-F/ELA/SkrotLeif.sid
COMMENT: "A strange tune. Works somehow. Often the compact bass'n'drums saves
         my tunes. Editor=FC" (ELA)

/VARIOUS/A-F/ELA/Smattfrids_Hevn.sid
COMMENT: "Editor=RM2" (ELA)

/VARIOUS/A-F/ELA/Stoff_Deboot.sid
COMMENT: "One of the reasons I got to join The Suppliers (who were quite big
         back then) was this tune. It was first made with Rockmonitor II (which
         was what they liked), but it took way too much raster to be useable in
         a demo so I made this one in FutureComposer. It was never used
         (something I got used to later). I still think the original sounds
         better. The title has nothing to do with drugs btw. It's just some
         words that fell into my head when I typed the savename." (ELA)

/VARIOUS/A-F/ELA/Summer_88.sid
COMMENT: "This is a remake of an old tune I made on a borrowed synth a few
         years later. It starts off with the chords and then the rythm and
         intensity comes later. Then it transposes to get even more intensity.
         One of my personal favorites. Used in the end-part of my "Goodbye
         Suppliers"-demo. Editor=FC" (ELA)

/VARIOUS/A-F/ELA/Tune_4.sid
COMMENT: "A simple intro tune. Used in a part in the "Goodbye Suppliers"-demo.
         Editor=FC" (ELA)

/VARIOUS/A-F/ELA/Very_Ode_Yeah.sid
COMMENT: "A weird setup with 2-voice arpeggios. Freak out! The last one I ever
         made with FutureComposer." (ELA)

/VARIOUS/A-F/ELA/Wooom.sid
COMMENT: "more filter and arpeggio toying, but no melody. Editor=Soundmonitor"
         (ELA)

/VARIOUS/A-F/ELA/noname.sid
COMMENT: "This was 1 of 3 tunes made for some local friends that wanted to make
         a game. They chose this one but only because it was longest :-)" (ELA)

         ones) and they all spreaded over Poland.

         <fanta64 (sid) gmx.de> are denoted by (AR). "I've also done some co-op
         tunes with The Syndrom, and you'll find those in his directory in
         HVSC." (AR)

COMMENT: "And again a 4K 1st place at Mekka Symposium 2001." (AR)

/VARIOUS/A-F/Fanta/Aquanori.sid
COMMENT: "Got 4th place at X 2001." (AR)

/VARIOUS/A-F/Fanta/Bemme_Mit_Brot.sid
COMMENT: "The demo (One-Der) got 2nd place at The Party 1997. Drax asked me
         once what "Bemme" means and believe me, it wasn´t easy to explain the
         sense of this title, because it´s saxon (Hi Happymaker, diese Elite
         Kunden wissn ooch nüscht, nur?). The correct translation is bread
         slice with bread. :-)" (AR)

/VARIOUS/A-F/Fanta/Brummkreisel.sid
  TITLE: Pop Goes the Weasel (1:24-1:32)
 ARTIST: Traditional
COMMENT: "Originally made for Respect/Fuse. The Syndrom thought it was too
         funny for such a serious demo, haha! So I gave it to Acidchild for his
         notes. Every scener had a Brummkreisel but Acidchild two! :-))" (AR)

/VARIOUS/A-F/Fanta/Bundy_Theme_Tune.sid
  TITLE: Love and Marriage [from Songs for Swingin']
 ARTIST: Frank Sinatra
COMMENT: Based on the cover used in the TV series "Married with Children".

/VARIOUS/A-F/Fanta/Challenger.sid
COMMENT: "The demo (One-Der) got 2nd place at The Party 1997." (AR)

/VARIOUS/A-F/Fanta/Demodisk.sid
COMMENT: "I sent this to AEG for the Turrican 3 endpart - 1 week before it got
         released. ;) So finally it ended up in a slightly different version
         in Demode/Chorus." (AR)

/VARIOUS/A-F/Fanta/Demodump.sid
COMMENT: "Clarence wanted a 15 sec. tune which he could siddump. I did a very
         silly one, so he could switch the voices on/off to make it longer.
         The demoversion takes only 2-3 rasterlines and so it sounds. My first
         tune without balls. It *hurts* Clarence! :D" (AR)

/VARIOUS/A-F/Fanta/Drop_The_Girl.sid
COMMENT: "D-Tract left the scene for his girlfriend and so he had some
         worktunes left. I liked this one and finished it by assembling the
         subtunes and adding some small things like instruments or a melody
         part in the end. The main job was done by him." (AR)

/VARIOUS/A-F/Fanta/Emergency_Brake.sid
COMMENT: "Cool story about The Tribute 1994. The Oxyron guys (who I joined
         later) came into the room asking "How much time have we left till the
         deadline? 30 hours? Ok, we make a demo!" and started. They asked for
         msx and gfx and this was the tune I had left at that time. Well..."
         (AR)

/VARIOUS/A-F/Fanta/Ferrero.sid
COMMENT: "Got 7th place at Mekka Symposium 1999. Partyvoting sometimes sucks
         but good old Reyn Ouwehand made me a proud man giving it a high rating
         in a music review. 8))" (AR)

/VARIOUS/A-F/Fanta/Finetuning.sid
COMMENT: "Got 10th place at Mekka Symposium 2000." (AR)

/VARIOUS/A-F/Fanta/Pop_Inside.sid
COMMENT: "I made this originally for Clarence' Demode where it is used in the
         intro. As I ran out of time for a compomusic at the great X 2004 I
         used it also there. This was a good decision in the end (2nd place),
         seeing Jeroen Tel and Reyn Ouwehand swinging to it. :) And not to
         forget Deekay, CBA (jump!) and others making me proud by dancing to
         it. These are memories i won<B4>t forget... I got many very good
         reactions from Rambones, Booker, Teroen Jel (you know who you are ;)
         and others. Let's see if I can top this one day..." (AR)

### /VARIOUS/G-L/Greatrix ####################################################

/VARIOUS/G-L/Greatrix/Aufidazin_Monty_Cover.sid
  TITLE: Auf Wiedersehen Monty, Tune #1
 ARTIST: Rob Hubbard & Ben Daglish

/VARIOUS/G-L/Greatrix/VHD.sid
COMMENT: Due to many complaints about the voting system done at competition
         parties (mainly PC users voting for the C64 competition), Greatrix
         decided to enter the competition with a deliberate pathetic tune. His
         goal was to see if his dismal creation could score higher than some of
         the real competitors proving the system was a complete farce. For this
         particular competition, SymMek98, Greatrix's tune rightfully finished
         last.

### /VARIOUS/G-L/Hannula_Antti ###############################################

/VARIOUS/G-L/Hannula_Antti/
COMMENT: All comments by Antti Hannula (AH)
         "I practiced a lot making sids in the late 1980s but released my
         first tunes in 1990.  After Antti Kangas (Scorpion) finished
         his first music routine for Artline Designs (ALD) we started to
         release "quality-sounds".  Before ALD I was the founder member of
         Contex.  All tunes were composed with an assembler.  Reach me via
         <anttihan (sid) hotmail.com>" (AH)

/VARIOUS/G-L/Hannula_Antti/ATA.sid
COMMENT: "Released in 1992, made with ALD-player v3.0 which was developed late
         1990. The routine turned out to be the one I used most, though v3.7
         was even ready at the time.
         The tune itself was the first one I was asked to do for a game. ATA
         was a Tetris-clone done by German Lower Level and I don't recall if I
         got paid for the track, but anyway it was liked by the authors and
         apparently many others.
         This must have been the best track I've done if I don't take count on
         my new tunes. I wasn't anymore much into composing that time, I just
         composed as a time-killer. Also a high score track was included." (AH)

/VARIOUS/G-L/Hannula_Antti/Artlight_Zone.sid
  TITLE: The Twilight Zone [from the TV series]
 ARTIST: Lalo Schifrin
COMMENT: "My first 'good' song with ALD-player v2.1 and one of the few covers I
         ever did. V2.1 didn't have any pulse data for $41 sounds so therefore
         I just used $11 or $21 to have acceptable melody-sounds.
         I was just playing around with the routine and somehow the Zone-theme
         appeared into my mind, but it's only influenced by the theme and the
         rest of the tune was just an effort of imagination.
         Done in January/February 1990." (AH)

/VARIOUS/G-L/Hannula_Antti/B-Ball.sid
COMMENT: "The B-Ball sounds were ordered in the Autumn 92 just after I had
         released my second music-collection which apparently didn't get spread
         much as I sent it to my old pals, which I even didn't know if they
         were in the scene anymore or not. The B-Ball track however, never got
         released as the game wasn't sold (I guess). I liked this track a lot
         myself and in fact it was the first time I had to do jingles. The
         player I used was v3.6. B-Ball was the last (finished) track I did
         until now in 1999." (AH)
(#1)
   NAME: Main Tune
(#2)
   NAME: Get Ready
(#3)
   NAME: Game Over
(#4)
   NAME: In-game Tune

/VARIOUS/G-L/Hannula_Antti/Beyond_Grave.sid
COMMENT: "Done in April 1999, yes! The first C64 tune after 1992. This tune
         participated in Proxy 99 party in Finland, even though I wasn't
         present it won the C64 music competition. Some people were really
         amazed to see a track from me for a long long time. I made the basis
         for it with Fasttracker and this is the way I compose the tunes these
         days. It's not a hard job to 'convert' the into assembler if you just
         make the tunes in a 64-style." (AH)

/VARIOUS/G-L/Hannula_Antti/Compact.sid
COMMENT: "Yet another one done in April 1999. I fixed this one just after
         Beyond Grave, but this one I did with the old style - just playing
         around with the routine. Later on I discovered that the arpeggios
         turned out to be much like in Hawkeye by Jeroen Tel. I intended to do
         a slow tune and this is what came out of my head." (AH)

/VARIOUS/G-L/Hannula_Antti/Conflex.sid
COMMENT: "Done in 1990 with v3.0 and was released in my Music Pack #1.
         Nothing special there though I remember I liked it very much back in
         1990. Somehow the "wind-effect" turned out to be in many of my tunes,
         including this one as well. The name comes from Con(tex) and Flex."
         (AH)

/VARIOUS/G-L/Hannula_Antti/Discoland.sid
COMMENT: "I composed this one with Fasttracker II and of course with c64
         sounds. This time transforming the .xm into our c64 music-routine
         turned out to be quite tricky (maybe I just wasn`t in the mood)...
         Anyway, I like the melody and I say that`s the most important element
         in a sid tune." (AH)

/VARIOUS/G-L/Hannula_Antti/Drivers_Dog.sid
COMMENT: "The name comes from Shell`s hot dog which I often eat when coming
         home from my DJ gigs. Quite funky tune and I`m quite pleased with the
         "2nd part" of the song. Uses player v3.7 which was the last ALD-player
         and is the only one which offers you the chance to put bassdrum into
         bass-sound." (AH)

/VARIOUS/G-L/Hannula_Antti/FanFarewell.sid
COMMENT: "V2.8 production which was a huge step in sounds compared to v2.1 or
         v2.4. I made several tunes with this player back in 1990. The tune
         itself is just a fanfare as you can hear, you could say that this was
         my first high-score track!" (AH)

/VARIOUS/G-L/Hannula_Antti/Feelin_Blue.sid
COMMENT: "Was actually my first released tune and used in the last Contex demo
         called "Handjob Lotion" released May 1990. Used player v2.1 and you
         can hear it from the $21 melody sound. I remember Zardax/Origo played
         this melody in the air pretending there was a keyboard under his
         fingers and asked me what is the song he's playing.. of course I knew
         it!" (AH)

/VARIOUS/G-L/Hannula_Antti/Frazze.sid
COMMENT: "Also in "Handjob Lotion" and done with v2.1 as well. This time I used
         $11 melody-sound. Afterwards I've been told this one was at least used
         in a Talent-intro and in Royal Writer. Someone's been liking it." (AH)

/VARIOUS/G-L/Hannula_Antti/Frequency_69.sid
COMMENT: "Done somewhere around late 1991 and released 1992. This was my effort
         to do a techno-track. Uses $15 or $17 ring modulation, $11 bass-drum
         and $11 bass which is played low. I just loved using low frequency
         bass (LFO/LFO) and the tune was inspired by a band called Rhythmatic.
         Scrap/Genesis Project (ex-Contex) reviewed this tune and commented 'Is
         my compu broken?'" (AH)

/VARIOUS/G-L/Hannula_Antti/Ghettoblaster.sid
COMMENT: "Player v2.8. This tune appeared to sound like a general Finnish
         melancholic tune. Nothing special in it." (AH)

/VARIOUS/G-L/Hannula_Antti/Jammin.sid
COMMENT: "This one was meant to be a jamming intro-tune, nothing else. I
         created a "going" bassline and simple chorus into it and later on I
         added a short melody. I like it!" (AH)

/VARIOUS/G-L/Hannula_Antti/Mello-D_Pop.sid
COMMENT: "I can recall quite clearly that I designed the arpeggios with my
         synthesizer and that was all I needed. I also used to create the
         melodies by playing the bass and chorus from C64 and the melody from
         the synth, it was quite easy. However, I should have done longer
         melodies, too often the melody lasted for 16 beats and then I just
         repeated it." (AH)

/VARIOUS/G-L/Hannula_Antti/Mindblowing.sid
COMMENT: "The intro music for "The Return of A" - my music collection #2.
         The first time I used $11 in arpeggios. I think this tune got its
         right atmosphere right from the beginning. The pulse bassdrum was
         meant to be as a heartbeat, oooh I loved the bass-sound. So simple so
         cool!" (AH)

/VARIOUS/G-L/Hannula_Antti/My_First_Introtune.sid
COMMENT: "OK, who could have avoided Future Composer? I practiced a lot with it
         and this one was actually made back in 1988, but I never got the
         courage to release it.. I wonder why, after eleven years it actually
         sounds quite nice (done by me when I was 14)." (AH)

/VARIOUS/G-L/Hannula_Antti/Needle.sid
COMMENT: "I don't know what there is, but I like this one though many others
         did not. Perhaps the minimal sounds... It's just so simple!!" (AH)

/VARIOUS/G-L/Hannula_Antti/Peggy.sid
  TITLE: Peggy
 ARTIST: Jarmo Nikku, performed by Samuli Edelmann
COMMENT: "My first actual cover, done in 1991. This song was chosen the "Song
         of Autumn" in Finnish TV, by the viewers. This was one of my
         favourites on my music-collection #2. Anyway, now I prefer the remix."
         (AH)

/VARIOUS/G-L/Hannula_Antti/Peggy_remix.sid
  TITLE: Peggy
 ARTIST: Jarmo Nikku, performed by Samuli Edelmann
COMMENT: "This version got it going... Well, ain`t that what a remix is
         supposed to do." (AH)

/VARIOUS/G-L/Hannula_Antti/Quite_Acid.sid
COMMENT: "The bassline I'm using in this one was very typical for the early
         acid/house tracks back in 1990, you see I was really into it. Just for
         intros!" (AH)

/VARIOUS/G-L/Hannula_Antti/Reflection.sid
COMMENT: "Done in 1992. This song must have started from the bassline!" (AH)

/VARIOUS/G-L/Hannula_Antti/Russian.sid
  TITLE: Stepnaja Kavalerijskaja (The March of the Red Cavalry)
 ARTIST: Traditional, Russian folk song
COMMENT: "I was searching for notebooks and then I found this one. There was no
         need to take a closer look, I went to the computer and in a while it
         was ready." (AH)

/VARIOUS/G-L/Hannula_Antti/Superstitious.sid
COMMENT: "The bass and chorus must sound familiar, eh? I think this one is
         boring, well it was my first tune which lasted more than 4 minutes.
         Done in 1990 (v2.8)" (AH)

/VARIOUS/G-L/Hannula_Antti/Swing_it.sid
COMMENT: "This must have been a fast-made track, got the feeling., I don't
         remember how it got spread, but I was surprised to see it in the HVSC.
         Probably done in 1991 for Giants (?)" (AH)

/VARIOUS/G-L/Hannula_Antti/Swing_it_2.sid
COMMENT: "Well, this is the one that actually swings! Done in April 1992 and
         released separately at the same time as music collection #2. This one
         is an exception to my usual formula which was "there must be a
         bassline and drums with melody". (AH)

/VARIOUS/G-L/Hannula_Antti/Tekno_A-Sid.sid
COMMENT: "You could say this one is the sequel to Frequency 69, more low bass
         and a nice rhythm. Done in February 1992 and released separately on
         the same disk as music collection #2. Grooovy!!" (AH)

/VARIOUS/G-L/Hannula_Antti/Theme.sid
COMMENT: "Yet another one of my new tunes done in 1999. This piece participated
         in the Assembly`99 music-compo and gained the 5th place. Done with our
         old player v3.1 done back in 1990 or something. One of my own the
         favourites." (AH)

/VARIOUS/G-L/Hannula_Antti/Weekend.sid
COMMENT: "My first longer tune done back in 1990 with v2.8. Well, you could say
         that this is a prototype of what my music was back in 1990. Sounded
         too much the same.." (AH)

/VARIOUS/G-L/Hannula_Antti/Wicked_Thing.sid
COMMENT: "Done in 1992. One of the tunes I dislike :-(" (AH)

/VARIOUS/G-L/Hannula_Antti/Wonderland.sid
  TITLE: Satumaa
 ARTIST: Unto Mononen, performed by Eino Grön
COMMENT: "This is a cover of the most popular Finnish tango ever. I translated
         the arpeggios directly from a notebook (but where is the tango-beat?).
         Still the most played song in Finnish radio and an all time Finnish
         people's favourite!" (AH)

### /VARIOUS/G-L/Jammer ######################################################

/VARIOUS/G-L/Jammer/Club_Style.sid
COMMENT: This SID won the Forever 5 music competition held in 2004.

/VARIOUS/G-L/Jammer/Everything_Went_Wrong.sid
COMMENT: "A co-op tune between all MSL members. Jammer made the instruments
          set, we (Sidder & me) did the first minute, and then Jammer came
          from nowhere and slapped his part at the end of it. Unfortunately,
          we forgot to test the tune on a real machine - and it was crucial,
          because strange filter settings make this one sound COMPLETELY
          BROKEN on C64. The title appears to fit perfectly in this case, I
          think. No wonder it was voted that low: 17th out of 19 at North
          Party 8 in 2003. So, use SIDPlay2/w." (comment by Smalltown Boy)

/VARIOUS/G-L/Jammer/Floatee.sid
COMMENT: This tune won the jury voting in the SID Compo III in 2003.

### /VARIOUS/G-L/Julian_Jaymz ################################################

/VARIOUS/G-L/Julian_Jaymz/
COMMENT: "Many people change their scene name once or twice in their life.  I
         decided to be different, and change my real name instead. "(JJ)

/VARIOUS/G-L/Julian_Jaymz/63_speed_music_1.sid
COMMENT: "Ray kept saying "Make more mutispeed music", so I did.  Actully, it
         only runs channel #1 at 63x, the other two channels run at 9x, but oh
         well :).  And it's too short... I very quickly got annoyed with the
         unresponsiveness of the editor when trying to play sounds at this
         rate.  But I *do* like working with the sounds at these sort of update
         rates, so I'm working on a player which takes a smaller amount of
         raster time than TFX to use for such music.  (That said, one of PCH's
         TFX songs (supposedly) runs a channel at 72x, but that's just too
         insane to dicuss :)." (JJ)

/VARIOUS/G-L/Julian_Jaymz/Archnial.sid
COMMENT: "The title of this song comes from my friend Jenn's AIM screenname,
         whom I love dearly (in a completly plutonic way, for the record).
         She doesn't understand the 'c64 thing'. I always wanted to be able to
         write funk tunes like Drax, and later Mitch&Dane, do, and despite it
         coming almost dead last in the c64.sk sid competition, I think I
         succeeded somewhat.  I actually like a lot of the harmonic work in
         this song, as did my sister, who yelled at me after she first heard it
         for being able to pull it off! Of course, most people disagreed with
         her accusation of me pulling it off." (JJ)

/VARIOUS/G-L/Julian_Jaymz/Archnial_Triangle.sid
COMMENT: "Someone on c64.sk made the statement that to do well, you need to
         make songs which only use the triangle wave.  So I did, and I think it
         sounds a lot like something you'd hear on a NES.  I actually prefer
         this version myself." (JJ)

/VARIOUS/G-L/Julian_Jaymz/Blood_Starlight_Rain.sid
   NAME: Blood, Starlight, Rain Like Tears.
COMMENT: "Sitting in a backpackers hostel in sydney, get a call from my
         parents, I can't come home, they've rented out my room. I've been here
         for 5 weeks now, but only finally got a laptop this day. I was feeling
         incredibly dark, having spent the last week in bed ill, I really
         wanted to go home, or failing that, I wanted someone to take a few
         minutes out of their day to see if I was still alive (okay, so I was
         feeling kind of melodramatic, lol),  This girl promised to hang out
         with me, and then cancelled or forgot every time for weeks straight,
         and I was stupid (read: thinking with my heart instead of my head)
         and didn't want to acknowlage that she was ignoring me...  I was
         losing my mind, and this music represents that.
         The full verse is "Blood, Starlight, Rain like tears, Drink from
         this, and let go the years".  I don't know who penned those words, but
         I dropped the latter half from the title because I promised said girl
         that I would.
         This music was made on an emulator (vice 1.8, and of course I had
         resid turned on :-p).  It was also one of my bigger expermients with
         filters synced from different channels to the one they're targetting.
         If it works at all on a real c64, I'd consider myself very lucky, lol,
         because I didn't have access to one at the time." (JJ)

/VARIOUS/G-L/Julian_Jaymz/Colors.sid
COMMENT: "I sat down to create an ending music for the WOW demo 'Evolution',
         with this text that I'd just written in my mind, and eight hours
         later, I had most of this.  It isn't (deliberatly) covering anything,
         the resemblence to some other music is just a coincidence :).
         Ironically, this is one of my happiest musics, and yet at the time I
         made it, I was depressed and suicidal.  Life is full of contrasts, I
         guess that's what makes it special.
         Well, that and Ray finally fixing the restart bug in TFX :-p." (JJ)

/VARIOUS/G-L/Julian_Jaymz/Drymouth.sid
  TITLE: <?> [from the Gameboy Color game Drymouth]
 ARTIST: Jake Kauffman (Virt)
COMMENT: "A freeware game for the GBC, the game itself sucks, but the music
         from it is great.  This is a fairly loose cover, done about a year
         after I last heard the music in question, and the last third is
         completly made up because I couldn't remember at all what came next,
         but oh well. Lots of people seemed to like this music, and that's
         probably because someone else, who has talent, wrote it ^_^." (JJ)

/VARIOUS/G-L/Julian_Jaymz/Drymouth_alternate.sid
  TITLE: <?> [from the Gameboy Color game Drymouth]
 ARTIST: Jake Kauffman (Virt)
COMMENT: "See the entry for Drymouth.  I couldn't decided between these two
         versions, so I released them both." (JJ)

/VARIOUS/G-L/Julian_Jaymz/Eternal_Reprise.sid
COMMENT: "This is a remake of Eternal Skies, but with better instruments and
         the stupid part at the start removed." (JJ)

/VARIOUS/G-L/Julian_Jaymz/Eternal_Skies.sid
COMMENT: "This was inspired by a song named "Eternal" by Evanescence.  It was
         originally going to be a cover of said song, however that went awry
         within the first 10 seconds or so :).  The second half is mostly an
         experiment in what happens when you mix diffrent types of Ringmod and
         Sync effects, which I like the sound of.  Sidplay1 hates it. It was
         originally intended to sound quite different from this, because the
         original sketch for it required a dyanmic wave table, but I got fed up
         waiting for that, and finished it as is." (JJ)

/VARIOUS/G-L/Julian_Jaymz/Evolution.sid
COMMENT: "I try, I fly, I lie, I cry, I die.  My mis-understood epic.  Everyone
         except for Ray hated this :).  It started out as soundmon clone music
         (intended for the WOW demo of the same name), an evolution in music,
         you know, the idea being that i've also got future composer type music
         (see TFX == future composer), and the other guys were going to do
         modern music blah blah watever, i forget the details.  Anyhow, around
         2 minutes after I sat down at the editor, it instead became something
         else (I hate it when that happens :-p), which basically amounts to an
         attempt to place what was goes through my mind at the time into sid
         form... the evolution of my soul.  I achieved that, I think, which is
         probably why almost no-one else understands it.  I personally like
         this music better than any other which I have ever made, however my
         emotional attachment to it makes me biased." (JJ)

/VARIOUS/G-L/Julian_Jaymz/Exuding_Titleness.sid
  TITLE: Exuding Titleness [from the Scream Tracker 3 module]
 ARTIST: Andrew Sega (Necros)
COMMENT: "PG Gave me a copy of this on a CD when I was in the Czech Republic
         during 2000, and I instantly fell in love with it, and as soon as I
         arrived home to my c64, this cover of it was the first thing I did.
         It was done in kind of a hurry, as I had other things on my mind, and
         so it could be significantly better than it is, but it's still not
         terrible, overall." (JJ)

/VARIOUS/G-L/Julian_Jaymz/Fields_of_Innocence.sid
  TITLE: Fields of Innocence [from Origin]
 ARTIST: Evanescence
COMMENT: "Only a partial cover... initially I set out to do a full cover of
         this, however in the end I only covered the the lead and background
         melodies (a few bars each), and then did my own music around that.
         Kind of a waste, really, because the original is much better than I
         could ever hope to achieve, but it's not bad compared to all of my
         others, even if it is completly pale and lame compared to the
         original. Jazzcat mislabled this "Fields of Hades" when it was used in
         an issue of Vandalism News, but we still love him anyhow :-p." (JJ)

/VARIOUS/G-L/Julian_Jaymz/Fishmagic_6581.sid
COMMENT: "In another world, I am known as Fish.  Felt like doing a cutesy
         little tune one day.  This is it.  It's not terribly good, in
         retrospect. The later sections continue my love affair with ring
         modulation.  It's too short, it's too lame, it's too cheesy, and I was
         too tired to care. It relies kind of heavily on the semantics of a
         6581 filter in places... on an 8580, some things just don't sound
         quite right :(.
         Anthony Bisset, from Digiradi/DSP Audio remixed this and layed vocals
         over it." (JJ)

/VARIOUS/G-L/Julian_Jaymz/Fishmagic_8580.sid
COMMENT: "In another world, I am known as Fish.  Felt like doing a cutesy
         little tune one day.  This is it.  It's not terribly good, in
         retrospect. The later sections continue my love affair with ring
         modulation.  It's too short, it's too lame, it's too cheesy, and I was
         too tired to care. It relies kind of heavily on the semantics of a
         6581 filter in places... on an 8580, some things just don't sound
         quite right :(.
         Anthony Bisset, from Digiradi/DSP Audio remixed this and layed vocals
         over it." (JJ)

/VARIOUS/G-L/Julian_Jaymz/Follower_v1.sid
  TITLE: The Follower [from the Impulse Tracker module]
 ARTIST: Jaymz Julian (A Life in Hell)
COMMENT: "This was the first thing I did in Sid Duzz It, and the only one
         which I actully released (I also did a cover of Elwood's "Fall From
         Sky" in it, after hearing The Alien's version, which was missing my
         favorite part of the module, but it was lost to a bad disk :(, and a
         cover of a PC music I did called 'Midi Drums', which a few people had,
         but I don't, and I'm betting that it's dissapered from everyone else's
         disks too.  But that's another story...).  This version has no pulse
         width modulation on the bass notes, which makes the drums sound
         harder. Anyhow, I stopped using that editor/player, because I found
         it far too limiting." (JJ)

/VARIOUS/G-L/Julian_Jaymz/Follower_v2.sid
  TITLE: The Follower [from the Impulse Tracker module]
 ARTIST: Jaymz Julian (A Life in Hell)
COMMENT: "See the comment for v1.  This version has pulse width modulation on
         the bass notes, which makes the drums sound softer/fuzzier, but the
         bass sounds nicer.  I couldn't/can't decide which I prefer :). I think
         I might re-do this song in TFX one day." (JJ)

/VARIOUS/G-L/Julian_Jaymz/Forever.sid
COMMENT: "This was inspired by the music from the PC demo 'Forever' by Acme.  I
         don't recall who did that music, but this doesn't actully sound much
         at all like it... but you should listen to that music if you can find
         it, because it's really good.  There is another story that goes with
         this music, which explains the in binary message, which starts, as
         all good stories does, 'Well, there was this girl...' :).  Her name
         was Sonja, and she didn't.
         But she was leaning over my shoulder when I was packing this tune, and
         is the only girlfriend I've had who has even tollerated, let alone
         understood, my c64 obsession.  As a birthday surprise for me, she made
         a c64 music.  It was surprisingly good for a first ever sid piece!
         One day, it may see the light of day, but today is not that day." (JJ)

/VARIOUS/G-L/Julian_Jaymz/Game_Over_view_1.sid
COMMENT: "This was the music from the first ever Game Over(view), and was
         written for it the day before it was released (at the start of 2004).
         It was an attempt to do a song in the same style as Detert's Game On
         11/93, and although it didn't quite turn out that way, I like how it
         ended up." (JJ)

/VARIOUS/G-L/Julian_Jaymz/Green_Hill.sid
  TITLE: You Can Do Anything (Toot Toot Sonic Warr.) [from the GG game Sonic 2]
 ARTIST: Masafumi Ogata
COMMENT: "I beat this game in a couple of hours when it first came out, but
         always loved the music, and this tune in particular.  Fast forward to
         mid 2000, and I'm sitting in a backpackers hostel in Prague with my
         gamegear, and I have no alarm clock and a 9am flight to catch, with my
         girlfriend (who I hadn't seen for 5 months) is waiting on the other
         end of it.  So hence I can't really go to sleep (I'd die if I missed
         said flight :-p), but hey, I have a gamegear with this game, and so I
         play until Green Hill zone, and then listen to this music for 7 hours
         straight, at which point I finally ran out of spare lives and
         continues.
         Fast forward to June/July 2001, and I've got some weird illness where
         I can't stand up or hold down food (never did work out what the was,
         heh), and my girlfriend runs away to america because the idea that
         for once in her life she has to be an adult is to damned hard to deal
         with (Hey, Gundam Wing Hentai is much more fun), and I havn't slept
         for 2 weeks or eaten in 4 weeks (not an exaggeration), which has had
         the predictable effects on my mind.  Crawl over to my c64, load TFX,
         bury myself of memories of that night in Prague and happy fun music!
         Only digital love is eternal." (JJ)

/VARIOUS/G-L/Julian_Jaymz/Green_Hill_Reprise.sid
  TITLE: Green Hill Zone [from the SMS game Sonic the Hedgehog 2]
 ARTIST: <?>

/VARIOUS/G-L/Julian_Jaymz/Happy_Happy_Joy_Joy.sid
COMMENT: "Despite my first c64 music being made in 1988, this is probably the
         first one I did which wasn't complete and utter crap (Well, maybe this
         and "Not so JCH based", but it was done on a bad emulator and breaks
         on a real c64, it turns out ^_^.  Maybe one day I'll remake it and
         release it, because the ideas in it were good, just bad implentation
         as is the usual thing with me :).  It wasn't until later that year
         the the message penetrated my brain that, if you want to make an
         okay music, you need to spend more than an hour on it ;).  If I was
         running WOW, I would have kicked me out for being completly lame ;).
         But hey, I learned my lesson (sort of....)" (JJ)

/VARIOUS/G-L/Julian_Jaymz/Internal_29_Intro.sid
  TITLE: The Smurfs [from the NES game]
 ARTIST: Alberto Gonzalez
COMMENT: "This is loosely based on something that I heard once on a NES.  What,
         however, I knew not, at the time." (JJ)

/VARIOUS/G-L/Julian_Jaymz/Internalise.sid
COMMENT: "This was inspired by what I remembered of Ash Hogg's Spellcast title
         music, however it turns out that even the part I thought I'd stolen
         (the background lead that plays at the start) bears not much
         resemblence to it.  Go figure.  This is another music, like evolution,
         which is really a reflection of my psyche at the time, however this
         one didn't get the negative reaction which evolution did :).  People
         did tell me that it's too short, however, and they're right.  But cest
         la vie.
         A shame that I couldn't make a really big and fearsome snare,
         though..." (JJ)

/VARIOUS/G-L/Julian_Jaymz/Jazz_Crackers.sid
COMMENT: "The c64 and PC versions of this music were developed simeltanously
         during 1997.  The c64 was finished first, however.  The lead
         instruments in this rely heavily on an 8580 style filter (or some
         later 6581 filters, iirc, but I forget now).  Despite finishing dead
         last in the compo I entered it in (Assembly '98), I still like this.
         (As a side note, I'm really very good at finishing dead last in compos
         :-p)" (JJ)

/VARIOUS/G-L/Julian_Jaymz/Lifes_a_Show.sid
  TITLE: Life's a show [from Buffy the Vampire Slayer: Once More with Feeling]
 ARTIST: <?>
COMMENT: "Beware of bunnies!  This is only a partial cover, as I got bored
         with it." (JJ)

/VARIOUS/G-L/Julian_Jaymz/Lost_Vikings.sid
  TITLE: <?> [from the game "The Lost Vikings"]
 ARTIST: Charles Deenen
COMMENT: "This is a partial cover of the introduction/candyland music from
         the lost vikings, but I got a bit bored with it, so I added a bunch
         of harmonies to the lead to make it more interesting.  I still love
         the original music from that game, and so when I got the GBA version,
         I just had to do this." (JJ)

/VARIOUS/G-L/Julian_Jaymz/Midi_Drums.sid
  TITLE: Midi Drums [from the midi module]
 ARTIST: Jaymz Julian
COMMENT: "This is the second attempt I made to do this song on the c64, and was
         in fact the song that TFX table variables were created for.  I
         originally tried to do this in sid duzz it in early 1999, but the
         number of arpeggio commands required for the places where there is
         two leads in one channel, and the blips in the drum/bass channel,
         overwelmed that editor.  So I tried in JCH v20g4, where I had managed
         to succed with Sunset Spirals, due to the ability it has to change the
         wavetable from within a song, but this too was not to be, due to the
         limitations of the editor.  So, I started writing a new editor, which
         was specifically designed to handle this situation, by splitting each
         channel into six virtual channels, and using special rules to modulate
         them together.  But this took up a lot of ram and raster time, indeed
         it too so much ram in the editor that I could only store five patterns
         at a time, so this was not to be either.  So Ray introduced me to TFX,
         and I asked him about changing the wave table from within the song,
         but he wouldn't have this, because it would confuse people, but he
         suggested a viable alternative, which is to support variables in the
         wave table, and promised to add this feature asap.  That was January
         2001, but he was too busy to implement them for the next two and a
         half years.  So I started bugging him to just give me the source and
         the bits to build it, and in November 2003,  he did.  So, I put my
         money where my mouth was, and added that feature (and a bunch of
         others which I had been wanting for a long time), and I was _finally_
         able to do a version of this that I happy with.  To anyone else but
         me, this is just another mediocre game tune, but for me it was an
         achievement." (JJ)

/VARIOUS/G-L/Julian_Jaymz/Pacmania.sid
  TITLE: <?> [from the arcade game Pac-Mania]
 ARTIST: Yuriko Keino (Yuri)
COMMENT: "Anyone who played the arcade game much knows that Ben's cover of it
         was a bit crap (I'd blame a lack of channels on the c64 for harmonies,
         but his amiga version is just as crap), and everyone else's C64 covers
         seem to cover his crap version, not the arcade version.  So, my
         version is crap too, but I think it has the nice harmonies in the
         second half, at least, and I think is a little less crap than his :)."
         (JJ)

/VARIOUS/G-L/Julian_Jaymz/Purple_Sky.sid
  TITLE: Purple Sky [from the Scream Tracker 3 module]
 ARTIST: Jonne Valtonen (Purple Motion)
COMMENT: "After Sunset Sprirals, I was once again fed up with JCH's editor, and
         wanted something better.  Ray had suggested to me using TFX several
         times before, and I finally got some documentation for it, and so now
         was the time to use it.  I had the S3M of this kicking around, and so
         I covered it to learn the editor.  The instruments suck... I never was
         good at making percussion, and unfortunantly there isn't any good ones
         around made in TFX to rip.  I also had basically zero understanding of
         how the wave tables worked when I did this, and as a result there are
         some very stupid things in there which sound terrible ;).  This
         probably should never have been released, but people liked it for
         reasons that I don't understand.
         As it turned out, the instruments sounded so crap partially because
         Ray's player was horrifically bugged, at the time.  I recompiled it
         against a later player, and it sounds a LOT better." (JJ)

/VARIOUS/G-L/Julian_Jaymz/Rasterman.sid
  TITLE: <?> [from the Atari XL/XE music]
 ARTIST: Sterba Radek (Raster)
COMMENT: "So, TFX 2.9 still wasn't here, but I wanted to cover this 4 channel
         music from the atari, so what I did, is set the player to 1 frame per
         row, and then enter all of the arpeggios by hand.  I'm surprised it
         didn't make the file much larger than it is.  It was a pain in the
         ass, but I'm quite pleased with the result." (JJ)

/VARIOUS/G-L/Julian_Jaymz/Rekonstruct.sid
COMMENT: "This song is made up entirely of patterns from Fishmagic, but played
         a different tempo's and in a differnet order.  It was originally
         intended to be used in a demo with fishmagic, so I was going for that
         similar but different effect, and I think it worked very well.  But,
         ironically, I was never happy enough with the original fishmagic, or
         how the demo was turning out, so I gave this to Jazzcat for an issue
         of Vandalism News, for which it was much more suitable anyhow. I love
         this sort of song, why don't people do more of them?" (JJ)

/VARIOUS/G-L/Julian_Jaymz/Sonic_Dreams.sid
COMMENT: "This was my entry for the 2004 SidWine competition, and it did
         fantasitcally badly, despite being what I consider to be probably the
         best demoscene style song that I've done on the c64.  I actually spent
         a lot of time on this song, and I was quite proud of how it turned out
         when it was finished.  It makes extensive use of the TFX wave table
         variables to try and squeeze two melody lines into a single channel,
         and the NoPulse command to control pulse width modulation reset more
         finely.
         The song is dedicated to a group I used to be a part of, Sonic Dreams,
         which is another story." (JJ)

/VARIOUS/G-L/Julian_Jaymz/Sunset_Spirals.sid
  TITLE: Sunset Spirals [from the Impulse Tracker module]
 ARTIST: Jaymz Julian (A Life in Hell)
COMMENT: "This is, musically, probably the best thing that I have ever done on
         the c64.  Ironically, all of my c64 friends complained that it was off
         key, etc, and all of my PC friends love this version.  Yet I had
         exactly the opposite reaction to the original version (c64 guys tended
         to like it, pc guys tended to complain that it was off key.).  For the
         record, except for one or two notes, because I ran out of arpeggios (I
         do that a lot... there are two or three other musics which got
         scrapped half way through because I ran out of arpeggios.  Thankfully,
         we've come up with a solution to this in the new version of TFX :)),
         the notes are NOT off key, and I don't care what you all think :-p.
         Said PC guys decided to take ownership of this song, and wanted me to
         create more like it, but I havn't had the motivation to actully
         finish any of them. (There are many, many, many stories that I could
         tell about the digiradi guys, but that's for another day, but the
         credit of the music to "Coder" is a part of that insanity.  They were
         great times)." (JJ)

/VARIOUS/G-L/Julian_Jaymz/TFX_Equals_Future_Composer.sid
COMMENT: "Who could forget the 50 trillion intro tunes made in FC during the
         late 80's and early 90's?  You know you love them... of course, I
         completly fucked it up by not using the traditional filterbass that
         everyone used/uses so that I could have a filterlead, but eh,
         do you really care that it's not genuine FC style?" (JJ)

/VARIOUS/G-L/Julian_Jaymz/This_is_Coder.sid
COMMENT: "This is the second thing that I did for Digiradi, after sunset. It
         obviously didn't work as well as sunset did, but I think it has a
         certain charm to it, myself." (JJ)

/VARIOUS/G-L/Julian_Jaymz/This_is_Jaymz.sid
  TITLE: This is Coder
 ARTIST: Jaymz Julian (Coder)
COMMENT: "The same notes as This is Coder, but with a different sound.  I did
         another remix of this, with drums and related things, but I love the
         "pure" sound that this one has." (JJ)

/VARIOUS/G-L/Julian_Jaymz/This_is_Jaymz_2_0.sid
  TITLE: This is Coder
 ARTIST: Jaymz Julian (Coder)
COMMENT: "This is a remix version that I did to take advantage of the new table
         variables, and I think large parts of it work well." (JJ)

/VARIOUS/G-L/Julian_Jaymz/Tim_Got_High.sid
COMMENT: "The Tim in question is Tim Bray, who does an act "Casionova", where
         he shows off 80's home keyboards, and other chip instruments,
         including a commodore 64 with a guitar strap attached.  Loscha and I
         were at one of his gigs, and he was tanking really badly (indeed, we
         could remember more of the words to his songs than he could!).  This
         was mostly because, we think, he was completly off the planet.  So, we
         came back to my place, after the gig, and I was showing off the new
         version of TFX, and we wrote the bass/chord/drum line (which is all
         one channel) to demonstrate some of the new features.  The file needed
         a name, and so we just typed in "Tim got high", and the name stuck.
         This song also has a lot of ring modulation (Joxstrap/WOW said too
         much :-p), which I love as always." (JJ)

/VARIOUS/G-L/Julian_Jaymz/Winters_Dream.sid
  TITLE: Winter's Dream [from the Impulse Tracker module]
 ARTIST: Andrew Sega (Necros)
COMMENT: "Back when I was writing music on the PC for 16 hours a day, every
         day, this was the demo song included with one of the many "this is the
         last release really!" releases of impulse tracker.  I'd actually
         wanted to make a c64 version of this for a long time, but it took me
         until now to really work out how to do it to my liking.
         Throwing that piece of junk away to concentrate on c64 music was the
         best descision I ever made.  I never was very good at it, anyhow."
         (JJ)

/VARIOUS/G-L/Julian_Jaymz/Yawlag_Xard_Hcj.sid
COMMENT: "This is the only released music made in the modified version of JCH's
         player that I was hacking up during 1999 (I had all of my stuff
         stolen, including the only copy of the player sources etc).  I
         originally wanted to create Galway style tune, but changed my mind
         half way and thought I'd make a Drax style music instead, and then put
         a JCH style lead on it.  Read the title backwards, and it will all
         make sense. This was also the first music of mine that I know of to be
         used in someone else's production (of course *I* use my own music, but
         well, it's crap, so no-one else does), which was a graphic collection
         by someone in Sonic Dreams (Rat I think).  Those guys were great fun,
         and some of them actully liked my music, which was a nice change, but
         goddamn the organisation of that group turned into a clusterfuck :-p,
         But it was all fun at the end of the day." (JJ)

/VARIOUS/G-L/KB/First_25Hz_tune_half-speed.sid
COMMENT: "As one of our members had coded a demo part which sucked such an
         amount of time that it was impossible to have a music routine running
         every frame, I was forced to compose a zak which ran at a speed of
         25Hz instead of 50. Pity-ful, this part was never released but it was
         a nice experiment how to cope with all these drum fx when you can't
         really use waveform tables." (KB)

### /VARIOUS/G-L/Kiss_Konrad #################################################

/VARIOUS/G-L/Kiss_Konrad/Babysitter.sid
COMMENT: As indicated by its title, this tune covers children songs that were
         popular in Hungary in the late '80s.
  TITLE: Theme of Mouse on Mars [from the cartoon series] (0:13-0:39)
 ARTIST: <?>
  TITLE: Puff, The Magic Dragon (0:41-1:06)
 ARTIST: Peter, Paul & Mary
COMMENT: This song was covered by a Hungarian folk band called "100 Folk
         Celsius" with Hungarian lyrics and became a popular tune amongst
         children there.
  TITLE: Theme to "A Mézga család kalandjai" (1:07-1:36)
 ARTIST: Tamás Deák
COMMENT: Title theme of the Hungarian cartoon series "Adventures of the Mézga
         family", which became a popular cartoon series all over Eastern
         Europe in its time.
  TITLE: Micimackó (1:40-2:36)
 ARTIST: Zsuzsa Koncz & Illés
COMMENT: A Hungarian song about how Winnie, the Pooh (Micimackó in Hungarian)
         feels cold in the winter snowfall.

### /VARIOUS/G-L/Luca ########################################################

/VARIOUS/G-L/Luca/
COMMENT: Older tunes were composed on a Commodore Plus/4 using a specially
         converted version of Future Composer, and then ported back to a
         C64. As the Plus/4 has a limited sound chip, the instruments will
         sound a little flat. Luca's own comments are indicated by (LC).

/VARIOUS/G-L/Luca/Ah_my_Goddess.sid
  TITLE: My Heart Iidasenai, Your Heart Tashikametai
 ARTIST: Yasuda Takeshi
COMMENT: The tune is the opening theme from anime "Ah My Goddess!" and its
         rough English translation is "My Heart won't let me say, I want to be
         certain of Your Heart".

/VARIOUS/G-L/Luca/Ai_oboeteimasuka.sid
  TITLE: Ai oboeteimasuka
 ARTIST: Kazuhiko Katoo, performed by Lynn Minmay
COMMENT: "Translated from Japanese, the title means "Love, do you remember?".
         "This is the main song of the animation movie ``Superdimensional
         Fortress Macross - Love, do you remember?´´, sung by Lynn Minmay
         during the final battle." (LC)

/VARIOUS/G-L/Luca/Anywhere_is.sid
  TITLE: Anywhere Is [from The Memory of Trees]
 ARTIST: Enya

/VARIOUS/G-L/Luca/Attenti_al_lupo.sid
  TITLE: Attenti al lupo
 ARTIST: Lucio Dalla

/VARIOUS/G-L/Luca/Battery_remix.sid
  TITLE: Spellbound, Tune #1
 ARTIST: Rob Hubbard

/VARIOUS/G-L/Luca/Bloody_bullet.sid
  TITLE: Iron Horse, Tune #1
 ARTIST: David Whittaker

/VARIOUS/G-L/Luca/Book_of_days.sid
  TITLE: Book of Days [from Shepherd Moons]
 ARTIST: Enya
COMMENT: "Completely wrong volume levels here...sorry!" (LC)

/VARIOUS/G-L/Luca/Boy_Band.sid
  TITLE: Boy Band
 ARTIST: Velvet
COMMENT: "I don't really like this pop tune, but it was my torment during
         Summer 2001." (LC)

/VARIOUS/G-L/Luca/Central_Park_Loader_Y2K.sid
  TITLE: Last Ninja 2 - Central Park (loader)
 ARTIST: Matt Gray

/VARIOUS/G-L/Luca/Colla.sid
  TITLE: Colla [from Acido-Acida]
 ARTIST: Prozac+
COMMENT: The title translates from Italian as "Glue". "Although I think it
         refers to...strange kinds of glue..." (LC)

/VARIOUS/G-L/Luca/Dragonball_promo.sid
COMMENT: "This music is covered from the italian spot for the japanese cartoon
         series ``Dragon Ball´´." (LC)

/VARIOUS/G-L/Luca/Galaxy_Express_999.sid
  TITLE: Galaxy Express 999
 ARTIST: Oliver Onions
COMMENT: This song is the Italian title song for the Japanese cartoon series
         "Ginga Tetsudo 999" (translated from Japanese: "Galaxy Express 999")
         It has also been used in a movie with another title, "Fantasy".

/VARIOUS/G-L/Luca/Gradius_Retromusicians.sid
COMMENT: According to Luca himself, this tune was inspired by Konami
         Kukeiha Club music from the eighties.

/VARIOUS/G-L/Luca/Gradius_Supernova_86.sid
  TITLE: Sensation [from the arcade game Salamander 2] (0:14-1:25)
 ARTIST: Takashi Toyoshima

/VARIOUS/G-L/Luca/Hibernaculum.sid
  TITLE: Hibernaculum [from The Songs Of Distant Earth]
 ARTIST: Mike Oldfield
COMMENT: "on the +4, the ascending sound was descending...AARGH!" (Luca)

/VARIOUS/G-L/Luca/Home.sid
  TITLE: Home [from Ultra]
 ARTIST: Depeche Mode

  TITLE: Spring Air [from the Amiga module]

COMMENT: "A cover of the Amiga mod 'Spring Air' by Sire/Lego from their (first
         ?) 40k intro. This version is a bit too slow I think...I did some
         other versions which were not released." (Mermaid)

  TITLE: Colonel Bogey
 ARTIST: Kenneth J. Alford
COMMENT: "I mainly knew it from the film 'Bridge over the river Kwai'."
         (Mermaid)

 ARTIST: John Philip Sousa

 ARTIST: Blur

/VARIOUS/M-R/Merman/Three_Lions.sid
  TITLE: Three Lions
 ARTIST: Baddiel and Skinner and The Lightning Seeds
COMMENT: David Baddiel and Frank Skinner are two popular comedians in England
         who presented the BBC2 TV show 'Fantasy Football League'.  Together
         with The Lightning Seeds they did the official England song for Euro
         '96, which was played before every England game in the tournament.
         Interestingly, this song also charted in Germany, as their fans used
         the song once they beat England on penalties in the semi-final.

 ARTIST: The Beatles
