### /VARIOUS/M-R/Mitch_and_Dane/ #############################################

/VARIOUS/M-R/Mitch_and_Dane/
COMMENT: The swapped case is how the composers intended their names to appear
         in their tunes. Stellan Andersson's own comments are indicated by
         (SA).

/VARIOUS/M-R/Mitch_and_Dane/Acrobat.sid
COMMENT: "A classic M&D tune, where the aim was to get fresh percussion.
         I think that when people later on talked about that M&D-style, this
         was pretty much what they meant." (SA)

/VARIOUS/M-R/Mitch_and_Dane/Archangel.sid
COMMENT: "Composed by M&D after having seen 'Get Shorty', a film that sported
         an inspiring soundtrack. Later on used in the Triad demo 'Lucy'. Uses
         filters in some odd ways to get those organ-like sounds." (SA)

/VARIOUS/M-R/Mitch_and_Dane/Dazzler.sid
COMMENT: "After a call from Crest management, Dane did the Krestology introtune
         in 6 hours, working on the intro chords that Mitch had provided.
         Crossbow did a very fine job timing the intro to the tune." (SA)

/VARIOUS/M-R/Mitch_and_Dane/Dose_of_D.sid
COMMENT: "Mitch did the groundwork, and Dane added some lame parts to it. Not
         something we're awfully proud of, but it got released anyway in the
         M&D Manifesto." (SA)

/VARIOUS/M-R/Mitch_and_Dane/Drown_Me_In_Love.sid
COMMENT: "One of the first co-op tunes that M&D finished. Released to the
         public in Bondage." (SA)

/VARIOUS/M-R/Mitch_and_Dane/End.sid
COMMENT: "A M&D co-op, that didn't get released until summer 2002, when it
         found itself to the Digital Magic note. Has one of the more bombastic
         intro sequences you'll ever hear in a c64 tune, I think." (SA)

/VARIOUS/M-R/Mitch_and_Dane/Gloria.sid
  TITLE: Stranglehold [from the PC XM module] (0:00-0:32)
 ARTIST: Jeroen Tel
COMMENT: "Borrowing the intro from Jeroen Tel, this tune is an M&D co-op,
         that got much praise from non c64-sceners. Dane uses the main chords
         as his cellphone ringsignal." (SA)
         This SID won the music competition at The Party 6.

/VARIOUS/M-R/Mitch_and_Dane/Hip_Trip.sid
COMMENT: "Owes a lot to Drax's 'Dope Out', a tune that was on heavy rotation
         at the time of composing. An M&D co-op that was featured in
         Krestology." (SA)

/VARIOUS/M-R/Mitch_and_Dane/In_Velvet.sid
COMMENT: "A solid worktune from Mitch, that Dane polished til it shone. It
         was later used in Krestage." (SA)

/VARIOUS/M-R/Mitch_and_Dane/In_Your_Bed.sid
COMMENT: "An M&D coop, with much of the groundwork from Mitch. Used in
         Krestology, it influenced Vip's tune 'Raging inferno', one might
         guess. :)" (SA)

/VARIOUS/M-R/Mitch_and_Dane/Jigsaw.sid
COMMENT: "Inspired by many fine tunes from MSK, this tune takes a couple of
         turns after the extended intro. Released in Krestology. Done by M&D."
         (SA)

/VARIOUS/M-R/Mitch_and_Dane/Legoman.sid
COMMENT: "Originally titled 'Bombs over Dresden', a name we changed after some
         consideration. An M&D co-op." (SA)

/VARIOUS/M-R/Mitch_and_Dane/Liptonman.sid
COMMENT: "A very catchy tune, of which Mitch did most of the work. Final
         sequences and instruments were Dane's however." (SA)

/VARIOUS/M-R/Mitch_and_Dane/Listen_And_Learn.sid
COMMENT: "Up until 02:16, this is only Dane's tune. At that point, the slow
         segment of the song starts. It was composed at Mitch's place the night
         before TP5, the party that originally didn't have a music competition.
         What happened was that c64 sceners gathered round a TV-set with a
         blasting speaker and contributed songs were played. This tune, M&D's
         first release as a team, must have pleased the audience as it placed
         1st." (SA)
         Won first place at The Party 5 music competition.

/VARIOUS/M-R/Mitch_and_Dane/Magnetic_Moons.sid
COMMENT: "A generic M&D-tune with a messy cluster of instruments." (SA)

/VARIOUS/M-R/Mitch_and_Dane/Metro.sid
COMMENT: "A tune with that special M&D touch. Some bass, some chords, some
         percussion and a wild lead as icing on the cake. Way too short,
         though." (SA)

/VARIOUS/M-R/Mitch_and_Dane/Miranda.sid
COMMENT: "Although Dane added a couple of sequences before releasing it, this
         is in essence Mitch's romantic tune for a girl he never met." (SA)

/VARIOUS/M-R/Mitch_and_Dane/Most_Wanted.sid
COMMENT: "The first co-op tune ever from M&D, Mitch made most of it." (SA)

/VARIOUS/M-R/Mitch_and_Dane/Mountain_Breeze.sid
  TITLE: Mountain Breeze [from the PC XM module]
 ARTIST: Jeroen Tel
COMMENT: "Something that would suit any intro very well ;) ..a hint to all the
         coders out there. From Mountain Breeze.XM by JT" (M&D)

/VARIOUS/M-R/Mitch_and_Dane/No_Match.sid
COMMENT: "An old co-op tune, that was revived in time for the release of
         Digital Magic." (SA)

/VARIOUS/M-R/Mitch_and_Dane/Ode_To_Xayne.sid
COMMENT: "M&D tried out JCH-player v19 and made this tune for our favourite
         Giuseppe. :) The very first beats are straight off from Xayne's
         'Rastatime', actually." (SA)

/VARIOUS/M-R/Mitch_and_Dane/Peachy.sid
COMMENT: "Released in the massive M&D Manifesto, a one-filer Crossbow put
         together with a full disk of tunes we had sent him earlier, just to
         show it could be done." (SA)

/VARIOUS/M-R/Mitch_and_Dane/Pools_of_Poison.sid
  TITLE: Pools of Poison [from the PC XM module]
 ARTIST: Jeroen Tel
COMMENT: "Jeroen's catchiest tune ever? Originally Pools of Poison.XM which
         Dane converted cause his roommate loves it." (M&D)
         "Brilliant cover 8) It's amazing how they've achieved to get that many
         channels into 3 channels 8)" (comment by Jeroen Tel)

/VARIOUS/M-R/Mitch_and_Dane/Shelter.sid
COMMENT: "Something we thought we had lost when it finally surfaced in HVSC,
         to our surprise. It should have stayed lost. :)" (SA)

/VARIOUS/M-R/Mitch_and_Dane/Street_Wise.sid
  TITLE: Streetwise
 ARTIST: Thomas Mogensen (DRAX)
COMMENT: "M&D going crazy with a tune originally supplied by Drax." (SA)
         "A conversion of 'Streetwise', which DRAX composed on the PC in EdLib.
         Also, the chords have been 'raped' quite a bit, perhaps because of the
         hard hardrestart! :)" (Comment by DRAX.)

/VARIOUS/M-R/Mitch_and_Dane/Vertigo.sid
COMMENT: "Something in the traditional M&D-style, that was given to Jazzcat
         for Album of the Year." (SA)

/VARIOUS/M-R/Mitch_and_Dane/Winners.sid
COMMENT: "Growing up with Abba, it was only a matter of time before Dane would
         soil one of their tracks with his touch." (SA)
  TITLE: The Winner Takes It All [from Super Trouper]
 ARTIST: ABBA

/VARIOUS/M-R/Mitch_and_Dane/Winona.sid
COMMENT: "High on Toto, this was composed at Mitch's place on a hot summer's
         day. We just knew it had to have a girl's name and finally settled on
         Winona Ryder after having seen Bram Stoker's Dracula, falling in love
         with her gasps." (SA)

### /VARIOUS/M-R/Mitch_and_Dane/Dane #########################################

/VARIOUS/M-R/Mitch_and_Dane/Dane/400.sid
  TITLE: 400 Slag [from Du & Jag Doden]
 ARTIST: Kent

/VARIOUS/M-R/Mitch_and_Dane/Dane/747.sid
  TITLE: 747 [from Isola]
 ARTIST: Kent

/VARIOUS/M-R/Mitch_and_Dane/Dane/912.sid
(#1)
  TITLE: 911 [from the PC XM module]
 ARTIST: Jeroen Tel
COMMENT: 1st place in the Floppy 2003 music compo.
(#2)
  TITLE: 911 [from the PC XM module]
 ARTIST: Jeroen Tel
(#4)
  TITLE: Robocop 3, Tune #1 (0:00-0:36)
 ARTIST: Jeroen Tel
  TITLE: Robocop 3, Tune #1 (1:45-2:35)
 ARTIST: Jeroen Tel

/VARIOUS/M-R/Mitch_and_Dane/Dane/Another_Day.sid
COMMENT: This tune won shared 1st place in BCN Party 2003 music compo.

/VARIOUS/M-R/Mitch_and_Dane/Dane/Bitchbass.sid
COMMENT: "Dane playing around with instruments. No more, no less." (SA)

/VARIOUS/M-R/Mitch_and_Dane/Dane/Blackout.sid
COMMENT: Competed at The Party 7. It placed 1st.
         "After the 4hr power failure at TP7, Dane named the winning compotune
         BlackOut. Covers odd segments of various tunes for fun, and is,
         essentially, Dane's first effort in 4x." (SA)
  TITLE: Breathe [from Fat Of The Land] (1:49-1:53)
 ARTIST: The Prodigy
  TITLE: Ghosts'n Goblins, Tune #2 (2:40-2:51)
 ARTIST: Mark Cooksey

/VARIOUS/M-R/Mitch_and_Dane/Dane/Blowtorch.sid
COMMENT: "Inspired by the veritable assault in the mid-90's of Smash Designs
         demos, this tune by Dane was given to AEG, and was later on used in
         the Smash demo 'Scream'." (SA)

/VARIOUS/M-R/Mitch_and_Dane/Dane/Bondage.sid
COMMENT: "We had a music demo and needed an introtune. Playing with Bondage,
         the name of the collection, Dane concocted a different c64-version of
         the classic James Bond-theme. Strangely enough made in JCH-player v19,
         well-known for it's limitations." (SA)

/VARIOUS/M-R/Mitch_and_Dane/Dane/Bondage_2.sid
  TITLE: Rubicon, Tune #1 (0:18-0:35)
 ARTIST: Jeroen Tel
COMMENT: "Mixing the Bond influence with something of Jeroen Tel's seemed only
         fitting for the sequel to our first music demo. Dane did all the
         work." (SA)

/VARIOUS/M-R/Mitch_and_Dane/Dane/Break_The_Cycle.sid
COMMENT: This is a 4x-amalgam of interwoven and recycled themes from the
         following tunes on Madonna's album American Life: "I'm So Stupid",
         "Nobody Knows Me", "Nothing Fails", "Die Another Day", "Mother &
         Father", and "Love Profusion".

/VARIOUS/M-R/Mitch_and_Dane/Dane/Breatheme.sid
COMMENT: "A catchy but simplistic and short tune by Dane, that Drax thought was
         a cover since he wanted to sing along to it. :) If it can make Drax
         sing, it can't be all bad, eh?" (SA)

/VARIOUS/M-R/Mitch_and_Dane/Dane/Burn_Me.sid
COMMENT: "Used in the Triad demo 'Oktober', this doublespeed ditty is something
         Dane did to try out multispeed composing." (SA)

/VARIOUS/M-R/Mitch_and_Dane/Dane/Bus_Notemusic.sid
  TITLE: Bus
 ARTIST: Thomas Mogensen (DRAX)
COMMENT: The original tune was composed on the PC with Edlib.
         "It was decided that in Bondage, the first music demo from M&D, we
         wanted to have the most asskicking tune not in the demo itself but in
         the note, just to piss people off. I wonder if it worked? Dane loved
         Drax's version so much that he did his own." (SA)

/VARIOUS/M-R/Mitch_and_Dane/Dane/Bushido.sid
COMMENT: "An old worktune brushed up for the PHASES demo as the title tune.
          Originally meant to be included in a Triad release." (SA)

/VARIOUS/M-R/Mitch_and_Dane/Dane/Cassanovas.sid
COMMENT: "A simple and slow tune by Dane. Given away to a disk magazine." (SA)

/VARIOUS/M-R/Mitch_and_Dane/Dane/Cryogenic.sid
COMMENT: "One of Dane's finest from the Krestology part-selector." (SA)

/VARIOUS/M-R/Mitch_and_Dane/Dane/Dalai.sid
COMMENT: "Dane brushed up a -95 worktune for the Singles Collection intro."
         (SA)

/VARIOUS/M-R/Mitch_and_Dane/Dane/Dead_Another_Day.sid
  TITLE: Die Another Day
 ARTIST: Madonna/Mirwais

/VARIOUS/M-R/Mitch_and_Dane/Dane/Deadline.sid
  TITLE: Deadline [from the PC XM module]
 ARTIST: Jeroen Tel
COMMENT: "The lead was very troublesome to convert correctly.. hehe" (M&D)
         "Deadline, Mountain Breeze, Pools of Poison - Jeroen Tel covers. Dane
         did them all, and even sent a cassette to JT for his approval." (SA)

/VARIOUS/M-R/Mitch_and_Dane/Dane/Dirty_Pair.sid
COMMENT: "Originally meant to be the concept of the M&D music demos, with a
         cool dude in an afro, and some feisty Manga chicks waving futuristic
         guns. We outgrew that, and never finished this intro tune, which was
         later on released in the M&D Manifesto. One of the few tunes that
         sport heavy dual filtered basslines. Dane's sordid work." (SA)

/VARIOUS/M-R/Mitch_and_Dane/Dane/DraxMix.sid
COMMENT: "Did you manage to rip it from Give or Take III? After having seen
         Krestology, Dane was amazed at two of the Drax tunes in it,
         'Bombastic' and 'Tristesse', so he decided to paste them together as a
         special surprise for St.Thomas. :)" (SA)
  TITLE: Tristesse (0:00-1:12)
 ARTIST: Thomas Mogensen (DRAX)
  TITLE: Bombastic (1:13-1:57)
 ARTIST: Thomas Mogensen (DRAX)
  TITLE: Tristesse (1:57-3:08)
 ARTIST: Thomas Mogensen (DRAX)

/VARIOUS/M-R/Mitch_and_Dane/Dane/Dutch_Breeze_II.sid
  TITLE: Robocop 3, Tune #1
 ARTIST: Jeroen Tel
COMMENT: Jeroen's tune was also used in the Blackmail demo "Dutch Breeze" hence
         the title of Mitch & Dane's tune.
         "Dane learned a lot about melodies while recreating the wonderful
         Dutch Breeze intro tune in JCH 20.g4. Used in the c128-demo 'Risen
         from Oblivion', which not that many people could watch. Thankfully,
         the music was released separately." (SA)

/VARIOUS/M-R/Mitch_and_Dane/Dane/Escape_From_Reality.sid
COMMENT: "Dane meddled around with new ways to make instruments after
         overdosing on Drax's 'Focus' from Krestology." (SA)

/VARIOUS/M-R/Mitch_and_Dane/Dane/Fireflies.sid
COMMENT: This tune won the music competition at the Solskogen 2002 party.
         "A Dane solo tune, that won the Solskogen music competition. The tune
         was later included in the Digital Magic note as well." (SA)

/VARIOUS/M-R/Mitch_and_Dane/Dane/Flowerguys_Pool_Party.sid
COMMENT: "PC version by Virt, C64 version by Dane. Composed in a hurry for the
         Digital Magic slideshow, and the LCP music competition, where it
         placed 3rd."
  TITLE: Flowerguys Pool Party [from Rebels Chiptune Disk #1]
 ARTIST: Jake Kaufman (Virt)

/VARIOUS/M-R/Mitch_and_Dane/Dane/Frozen.sid
  TITLE: Frozen [from Ray Of Light]
 ARTIST: Madonna
COMMENT: "An attempt by Dane to cover one of the best Madonna tunes ever.
         Strings aren't really something you can do successfully on c64,
         however." (SA)

/VARIOUS/M-R/Mitch_and_Dane/Dane/Hybrid-96.sid
COMMENT: "Dane took a chord sequence from a Metal PC-tune, and played around
         with it." (SA)

/VARIOUS/M-R/Mitch_and_Dane/Dane/Imaginary_Visions.sid
COMMENT: "Dane's competition entry from Tribute'94, and his first tune to be
         released." (SA)

/VARIOUS/M-R/Mitch_and_Dane/Dane/Innuendos.sid
COMMENT: "Dane released this tune in the Triad demo 'No Control', which was
         released at Tribute'94." (SA)

/VARIOUS/M-R/Mitch_and_Dane/Dane/Intro_Means_Number_One_Or.sid
COMMENT: "Dane made an intro tune. Crossbow used it in Krestage." (SA)

/VARIOUS/M-R/Mitch_and_Dane/Dane/JK.sid
  TITLE: Good Morning, Dracula [from the EP fx]
 ARTIST: Jake Kaufman (Virt)

/VARIOUS/M-R/Mitch_and_Dane/Dane/JK_demo_version.sid
  TITLE: Good Morning, Dracula [from the EP fx]
 ARTIST: Jake Kaufman (Virt)

/VARIOUS/M-R/Mitch_and_Dane/Dane/Kemikal.sid
COMMENT: "Dane reinventing percussion on c64 in 1996. Finally released in the
         Digital Magic note." (SA)

/VARIOUS/M-R/Mitch_and_Dane/Dane/Le_Beau.sid
COMMENT: "Dane's response to Mitch's sentimental tune Miranda, this is a
          simple love song that got lost somewhere along the way." (SA)

/VARIOUS/M-R/Mitch_and_Dane/Dane/Leaving_on_a_Jetplane.sid
COMMENT: "A great song covered by Dane, used in 'Demus Interruptus'." (SA)
  TITLE: Leaving, on a Jetplane [from Rhymes And Reasons]
 ARTIST: John Denver

/VARIOUS/M-R/Mitch_and_Dane/Dane/Leviathan.sid
COMMENT: "Released exclusively for HVSC, this is a Dane worktune that never
         made it anywhere else." (SA)

/VARIOUS/M-R/Mitch_and_Dane/Dane/Live_Forever.sid
COMMENT: This is a 4x-amalgam of interwoven and recycled themes from the
         following tunes on Madonna's album American Life: "Nobody Knows Me",
         "Mother & Father", "Easy Ride", and "Love Profusion".

/VARIOUS/M-R/Mitch_and_Dane/Dane/Lois_Lane.sid
COMMENT: "The loading tune from Krestage is just Dane trying out some techno
         instruments. Couldn't believe his eyes when this showed up as an mp3
         on a random Napster search. Weird!" (SA)

/VARIOUS/M-R/Mitch_and_Dane/Dane/Loretta.sid
  TITLE: Loretta Young Silks [from Bloodsport]
 ARTIST: Sneaker Pimps
COMMENT: According to Dane himself, his tune is "based on it". This
         tune achieved joint 1st place in the online SidWine2 music
         competition in 2003.

/VARIOUS/M-R/Mitch_and_Dane/Dane/Madonna_Remix.sid
COMMENT: "In the following order, this tune covers 'Sky fits Heaven', 'To have
         and not to hold' and finally 'Swim' from Madonna's superb album 'Ray
         of Light', although in a very personal arrangement by Dane. A full
         collection of covers from that album was originally meant for release,
         but it never saw the light of day, and this tune was instead given
         away to the soundtrack of the Elysium demo 'Illmatic'." (SA)
  TITLE: Sky Fits Heaven [from Ray of Light] (0:00)
 ARTIST: Madonna
  TITLE: To Have and Not to Hold [from Ray of Light] (1:51)
 ARTIST: Madonna
  TITLE: Swim [from Ray of Light] (2:43)
 ARTIST: Madonna

/VARIOUS/M-R/Mitch_and_Dane/Dane/Magneto.sid
COMMENT: "The Digital Magic loadertune features some of the best syncopated
         stuff Dane has ever pulled off. Too bad Graham's loader was so fast
         no one would hear it. :)" (SA)

/VARIOUS/M-R/Mitch_and_Dane/Dane/Maine.sid
COMMENT: "The main tune of Bondage is a dramatic piece by Dane, who has read
         way too many Stephen King books and named his tune thereafter." (SA)

/VARIOUS/M-R/Mitch_and_Dane/Dane/Mashiara.sid
COMMENT: "A small try-out of chords and instruments, this microtune was
         featured with Wiggen's compopicture from LCP 2002, for which Dane
         coded the viewer." (SA)

/VARIOUS/M-R/Mitch_and_Dane/Dane/Melissa_D.sid
COMMENT: "One of the more bombastic tunes in the collection. Dane wasn't
         pulling any stops while composing this." (SA)

/VARIOUS/M-R/Mitch_and_Dane/Dane/Metrofish.sid
COMMENT: "Dane made the tune and forgot to scratch it. A pity." (SA)

/VARIOUS/M-R/Mitch_and_Dane/Dane/Multi.sid
COMMENT: "A musical experiment by Dane that turned out both well and a bit on
         the annoying side." (SA)

/VARIOUS/M-R/Mitch_and_Dane/Dane/Neurotica.sid
COMMENT: "A tune that was origianlly meant for 'Krestory'. Crossbow instead
         used it elsewhere, and it inspired GRG to do a 4x version. As this was
         originally an XM-composition by Dane, there is a completely different
         take on it somewhere on an old workdisk." (SA)
  TITLE: Slomo [from the XM module]
 ARTIST: Stellan Andersson

/VARIOUS/M-R/Mitch_and_Dane/Dane/Nick_De_Caro_And_Orchestra.sid
COMMENT: "Titled 'Happy Heart', this is another cover of an easy listening
         track." (SA)

/VARIOUS/M-R/Mitch_and_Dane/Dane/Night_of_the_Sentinels.sid
COMMENT: "Dane did the blasting techno tune from 'Risen from Oblivion', unaware
         that it would be used there." (SA)

/VARIOUS/M-R/Mitch_and_Dane/Dane/Nothing_Really_Matters.sid
COMMENT: "Dane at work, covering a track from Madonna's 'Ray of Light'. A full
         collection of covers from that album was originally meant for release,
         but it never saw the light of day." (SA)
  TITLE: Nothing Really Matters [from Ray Of Light]
 ARTIST: Madonna

/VARIOUS/M-R/Mitch_and_Dane/Dane/Peek-a-Boo.sid
  TITLE: Peek-a-boo <?>
 ARTIST: Radix
COMMENT: "This introtune was originally done by our good friend Radix on the
         PC. We liked it and converted it." (M&D)
         "Dane was taunted to do the c64 version, after he had worked
         successfully with the JT remakes." (SA)

/VARIOUS/M-R/Mitch_and_Dane/Dane/Politik_and_Science.sid
COMMENT: Covers two songs, "Politik" and "Science" by a band
         Coldplay, from an album "A Rush of the Blood to the Head".
         "Later released as the Domination#17 main tune, this work of Dane's
         was withdrawn from the SID Compo II in favor of an original
         composition to the dismay of many people who liked the track." (SA)

/VARIOUS/M-R/Mitch_and_Dane/Dane/Power_of_Goodbye.sid
  TITLE: The Power of Goodbye [from Ray Of Light]
 ARTIST: Madonna
COMMENT: "It's the Power of Goodbye and the combined power of Madonna, Dane,
         and an unwilling SID." (SA)

/VARIOUS/M-R/Mitch_and_Dane/Dane/Ray_of_Light.sid
  TITLE: Ray of Light [from Ray Of Light]
 ARTIST: Madonna
COMMENT: "Ok, I should have let this one be. It's just not an original meant
         for a SID-remake." (SA)

/VARIOUS/M-R/Mitch_and_Dane/Dane/Retro.sid
COMMENT: "Mixing new and old, this is Dane playing around with songs that he
         likes." (SA)
         "A medley of Intermezzo.XM by Drax, Urgent but Unwanted.XM, and the
         tune from Supremacy by Jeroen Tel. Play it on a new SIDchip." (M&D)
  TITLE: Intermezzo [from the PC XM module] (0:00-0:18)
 ARTIST: Thomas Mogensen (DRAX)
  TITLE: Urgent But Unwanted [from the PC XM module] (0:19-0:49)
 ARTIST: Jeroen Tel
  TITLE: Intermezzo [from the PC XM module] (0:50-1:06)
 ARTIST: Thomas Mogensen (DRAX)
  TITLE: Supremacy, Tune #1 (1:07-2:01)
 ARTIST: Jeroen Tel
  TITLE: Urgent But Unwanted [from the PC XM module] (2:02-2:32)
 ARTIST: Jeroen Tel

/VARIOUS/M-R/Mitch_and_Dane/Dane/Round_And_Round.sid
COMMENT: This is a 4x-amalgam of interwoven and recycled themes from the
         following tunes on Madonna's album American Life: "Hollywood",
         "Mother & Father", "Easy Ride", "X-static Process", and
         "Intervention".

/VARIOUS/M-R/Mitch_and_Dane/Dane/Seeress_Foretold_My_Future.sid
COMMENT: "Used in 'Risen from Oblivion', this is a tune Dane made inspired by
         Drax's phenomenal tune 'Bombastic'." (SA)

/VARIOUS/M-R/Mitch_and_Dane/Dane/Shiit.sid
COMMENT: "This ultimate shuffle-tune was something Dane surprised himself with.
         A basic structure with nice chord twists and feisty snaredrums." (SA)

/VARIOUS/M-R/Mitch_and_Dane/Dane/Shorty.sid
COMMENT: "Crossbow mailed Dane, asking for a tune for 'Demus Interruptus'. It
         had to be under $0800 bytes, below $0a rasterlines and longer than a
         minute. Probably the best tune Dane's made in JCH v19." (SA)

/VARIOUS/M-R/Mitch_and_Dane/Dane/Sit_In_My_Underwear.sid
   NAME: Sit In My Underwear, Drinking Pepsi
COMMENT: "The online spoof collection 'Sit in my underwear, drinking Pepsi'
         resulted in a bunch of tunes all with the same name. Unfortunately
         none of them won the competition at the Vision party. Twoflower/Triad
         actually had the nerve to say he loved this tune! :)" (SA)

/VARIOUS/M-R/Mitch_and_Dane/Dane/Slap_Mix.sid
COMMENT: "Composed live at LCP 2002, this tune of Dane's is a medley of
         Listen&Learn, Gloria and BlackOut. Used in the Digital Magic note."
         (SA)

/VARIOUS/M-R/Mitch_and_Dane/Dane/Slideshow.sid
COMMENT: "A nice and slow tune by Dane originally meant for a slideshow, this
         tune was released in the Digital Magic note." (SA)

/VARIOUS/M-R/Mitch_and_Dane/Dane/Smashing.sid
COMMENT: "Dane did a funk number that ended up in Krestology. Too bad it is cut
         in the demo at the point where the best part of the lead is about to
         start." (SA)

/VARIOUS/M-R/Mitch_and_Dane/Dane/St_Thomas.sid
COMMENT: "It probably doesn't come as a major surprise that the Saint in
         question is Thomas Mogensen aka Drax, a major influence of Dane's."
         (SA)

/VARIOUS/M-R/Mitch_and_Dane/Dane/Stars_In_Her_Eyes.sid
COMMENT: "As a worktune in progress, this was released in 'Risen from
         Oblivion'. A more finished version of it was spread in the Digital
         Magic note." (SA)

/VARIOUS/M-R/Mitch_and_Dane/Dane/Synch.sid
COMMENT: "Dane syncopating like a madman." (SA)

/VARIOUS/M-R/Mitch_and_Dane/Dane/Tapestry.sid
COMMENT: "A sad tune that was offered to Oswald/Resource for use in his
         upcoming demo. Graham was probably unaware of this, and included it in
         Risen From Oblivion, before the release of Soiled Legacy. Dane took a
         class in amateur composing at university and handed this tune in as
         his exam piece. He passed." (SA)

/VARIOUS/M-R/Mitch_and_Dane/Dane/Tasty.sid
COMMENT: "An old worktune from 1995 of Dane's entered the Antiq music
         competition. It didn't place too well." (SA)

/VARIOUS/M-R/Mitch_and_Dane/Dane/Til_Death_Do_Us_Part.sid
COMMENT: "Dane did this tune, that was originally meant for the TP8 music
         competition. He didn't visit that party, hoever, and ended up remaking
         it into a 4x tune for Elysium's demo 'Illmatic'. It is amazing that no
         one has sniffed out the cover segment of this tune, with a part lifted
         straight off the 1989 Madonna track 'Til Death do us part'. Cat's out
         of the bag now. :)" (SA)

/VARIOUS/M-R/Mitch_and_Dane/Dane/Trial_and_Error.sid
COMMENT: Winner of the online SID Compo II in 2002.
         "This tune replaced Politik & Science in the SID Compo II and placed
         1st. Very proud of some of the instruments, Dane used parts of an old
         1994 worktune for the melodies and chords." (SA)

/VARIOUS/M-R/Mitch_and_Dane/Dane/Trick_Bag.sid
COMMENT: "An old composition of Dane's, originally meant for the piano. It
         featured with a picture called 'The Awakener', in a one-file
         production that was the first ever by Dane and Iopop." (SA)

/VARIOUS/M-R/Mitch_and_Dane/Dane/Unisexual.sid
COMMENT: "A pop/funk-piece as many others inspired by some of the nice
         stuff that Drax has done." (SA)

/VARIOUS/M-R/Mitch_and_Dane/Dane/Up_to_Todays_Standards.sid
COMMENT: "Used in the note to Royal Arte, this is Dane displaying the power of
         his snaredrums." (SA)

/VARIOUS/M-R/Mitch_and_Dane/Dane/Variables.sid
COMMENT: "Just made as a test to try out a different filter envelope, and
         instruments that combined chords with bassdrums." (SA)

/VARIOUS/M-R/Mitch_and_Dane/Dane/Weapon_of_Choice.sid
COMMENT: "Getting that extra 4th channel for bassdrums, Dane used this loop for
         the Digital Magic part selector." (SA)

/VARIOUS/M-R/Mitch_and_Dane/Dane/Whistle_Song.sid
  TITLE: Whistle Song [from Hagnesta Hill]
 ARTIST: Kent
COMMENT: "Cover's the Kent tune 'Visslaren' off their album 'Hagnesta Hill'. It
         was used in the end part of Digital Magic, and Dane dares you to go
         buy the full Kent album!" (SA)

(#6)

         in the demos. It was a hidden tune.

         asked Klax for an exclusive instrument, which covers sounds from
         Future Composer. He did that for me and I've started to compose tunes
         once again. Done on 18.11.2001. Tune length 01:16." (PR)

/VARIOUS/M-R/Murdock/3_Years_Ago.sid
COMMENT: "The first part of this song was composed before Symphony 2003 party.
         After a few months I decided to finish this song and I released it on
         the TUM 2003 party. The tune got placed 4th. The title reminds me of
         what was happening exactly 3 years ago. I like this tune very much.
         Done on 17.12.2003 using Future Composer v4.0. Tune length 02:55."
         (PR)

/VARIOUS/M-R/Murdock/Intro_Zak_Remix.sid
  TITLE: Intro Zak
 ARTIST: Touldie
COMMENT: Songs 1-4 are remix of /VARIOUS/S-Z/Touldie/Intro_Zak.sid, song 5 is
         an original Touldie song. "This is the result of first touching
         Hardtrack Composer. I simply doubled, added, deleted etc. some
         patterns to have some different versions of Touldie's original zak.
         I also saved the original tune as subtune #5, just for comparing. Done
         in 1999. Tune #3 was first published in Tropyx Music 4. Tune #1 length
         03:52, tune #2 length 04:46, tune #3 length 02:32, tune #4 length
         01:16." (PR)

/VARIOUS/M-R/Murdock/It_Must_Be_Hard.sid
COMMENT: "I like this tune because the bass line turns into a melody line. The
         drum line is played on two channels. My first real composition on
         Hardtrack Composer. Published in Tropyx Music 4. Done on 14.10.1999.
         Tune length 01:47." (PR)

/VARIOUS/M-R/Murdock/Welcome_Home.sid
COMMENT: "One of my best tunes, composed for Mini Cat to celebrate him coming
         back from the army. I had to do this song two times because before
         saving there was a power failure.I decided to compose the tune once
         again and I recovered 95% of the original tune from my mind. Later
         released on Sidcompo 3, took 40th place. Done on 28.05.2003 using
         Future Composer v2.1. Tune length 02:40." (PR)

         Done on 15.12.2002 using Future Composer v4.0. Tune length 02:33."

COMMENT: "I can't remember why I used this name." (WR)

/VARIOUS/M-R/Nebula/Palmoliv.sid
COMMENT: "Used in the game 'Leisure Suit Leo 2' by Out of Order" (WR)
         for additional Comments see 'Phronk'!

/VARIOUS/M-R/Nebula/Phronk.sid
COMMENT: "Damn, I used Filter $F6 at a very low Freq., but it seems that it
         only sounds good on my SID. Try these Filtersettings in SIDPLAY:
         Parameter 1: <......*>
         Parameter 2: <...*...>
         Parameter 3: <*......> (This is not the default setting!!!)" (WR)

/VARIOUS/M-R/Nebula/Quatechtro.sid
COMMENT: "From around 1:09 it gets out of sync." (WR)

/VARIOUS/M-R/Nebula/Raggy.sid
COMMENT: "Used in the game 'Leisure Suit Leo 2' by Out of Order" (WR)

/VARIOUS/M-R/Nebula/Revolte.sid
COMMENT: "Used in an Intro for the group Hardcore, which recognizes the
         SID-Chip (new or old) and modificates the music, so that it sounds on
         both chips near equal." (WR)

/VARIOUS/M-R/Nebula/Slaughter.sid
COMMENT: "Another (my first and best) Filter-intensive tune that only sounds
         good on the new SID-Chip. Well, try these Filtersetting in SIDPLAY:
         Parameter 1: <......*>
         Parameter 2: <.*.....> (8 clicks from left)
         Parameter 3: <*......> (This is not the default setting!!!)" (WR)

/VARIOUS/M-R/Nebula/T-Rave.sid
COMMENT: "This tune I've used in a release of my FSC-Noter, which should some
         german guys should remember (greets to all)." (WR)

/VARIOUS/M-R/Nebula/Variations.sid
COMMENT: "My very last song I ever made on a Computer (till 98-10-17).
         It was composed on a big Bass-Amp, so play it also on a big one, you
         will miss (=not hear) the deep bass. On SIDPLAY its hard to let the
         Hi-Hat sound like on a real C64, try this:
         - Set fiters to default
         - Move Parameter 2 two clicks from the left side." (WR)

/VARIOUS/M-R/Nebula/Wake_up.sid
COMMENT: "Used in a Toolcollection called 'Toolbase 1' by Shadow, which I coded
         unders the Handle Seesaw Widow (with this I entered the scene.)" (WR)

### /VARIOUS/M-R/Odi #########################################################

/VARIOUS/M-R/Odi/
COMMENT: Odi's (Oliver Klee) own comments are denoted by (OK).

/VARIOUS/M-R/Odi/A_Groovy_Night.sid
COMMENT: "Done with the Cyberlogic Sound Studio... made by me and Sascha/MDG!.
         Sascha and I made it a night. Sleep, what's that? By that time, I had
         figured out what number to add to the filter byte to get roughly the
         same sound as with normal filters." (OK)

/VARIOUS/M-R/Odi/Ancient_Property.sid
COMMENT: "Done with the Cyberlogic Sound Studio... made by me and Sascha/MDG!.
         One of my longest tunes -- and one of my best! The first part is
         partly inspired by J.S.Bach and Jeroen Tel, the second part mostly by
         Drax, being rather short (out of inspiration, just up'n'down the blues
         scale). Uptonogood (don't remember the group, sorry) from Australia
         used this music in his mag 'The Link'." (OK)

/VARIOUS/M-R/Odi/Autumn_Beach.sid
COMMENT: "Done with SoedeSoft's SoundMaster." (OK)

/VARIOUS/M-R/Odi/Bachs_Domain.sid
COMMENT: "Done with the Cyberlogic Sound Studio... made by me and Sascha/MDG!.
         Inspired by J.S.Bach again, I composed this piece as another magsound
         for 'Genetic Dreams' by Trinomic Boozeline. Willy/Presence favored
         this piece a lot (he himself liking Bach, too). I chose the name with
         a sidelook to Sascha's piece 'Drax' Domain'. This piece consists of a
         few different parts which I just lined up one after another, as I was
         unable to come up with some interludes." (OK)

/VARIOUS/M-R/Odi/Back_To_The_Future_III.sid
  TITLE: Main Title [from the movie Back to the Future Part III]
 ARTIST: Alan Silvestri
COMMENT: "Done with SoedeSoft's SoundMaster.
         This is a remake of the title tune from the game. Hawk had asked me to
         do it." (OK)

/VARIOUS/M-R/Odi/Baroque_Parting.sid
COMMENT: "This tunes had been composed with the full player in mind (an loaded
         into the editor). That player uses a slight de-tuning for voice #2 and
         #3 in order to achieve a fuller sound. In addition, the instruments
         make use of pulse width modification.
         For the 'zero page version' of this piece, I had cut down the player
         to almost nothing in order to get a real short file with as little
         raster time as possible. During that step, I removed the routine for
         the pulse modification and increased the detuning of voice #2 and #3
         instead, resulting in a slightly different (and slightly less nice)
         sound." (OK)

/VARIOUS/M-R/Odi/Baroque_Parting_Zero_Page.sid
COMMENT: "Done with the Cyberlogic Sound Studio... made by me and Sascha/MDG!.
         I wrote this piece to express my feelings about a freshly broken
         relationship with my (former, sigh) girlfriend. As we just had
         analyzed fugues in music class, I wrote a fugue (in c-minor) as well.
         There is a zeropage version of this tune that saves even more
         rastertime and memory." (OK)

/VARIOUS/M-R/Odi/Bass_Fever.sid
COMMENT: "Done with Chris Hülsbeck's Soundmonitor.
         What a shame that I couldn't make a real FAT bassdrum!" (OK)

/VARIOUS/M-R/Odi/Chips_In_Music.sid
COMMENT: "Done with the Cyberlogic Sound Studio... made by me and Sascha/MDG!.
         I originally had planned to write a techno tune (without too much
         success, as you can hear). It's one of my personal favorites." (OK)

/VARIOUS/M-R/Odi/Chords_Of_Endlessness.sid
COMMENT: "Done with SoedeSoft's SoundMaster.
         A magsound for the Alcoholics. I don't know if they actually used it."
         (OK)

/VARIOUS/M-R/Odi/Cool_Is_Fool.sid
COMMENT: "Done with the Cyberlogic Sound Studio... made by me and Sascha/MDG!.
         Out of inspiration for any new music, I was listening to some of my
         old tunes and started to play around with the old 'Groovy Night'. The
         result was this funny little thing. Listen to the portamento with the
         arpeggio (the drop-down)!" (OK)

/VARIOUS/M-R/Odi/Cowboy_Song_2.sid
COMMENT: "Done with SoedeSoft's SoundMaster.
         In the big band I played the trumpet in at that time, we used to play
         'Cowboy Song' by Fred Lipsius. I couldn't exactly play it properly,
         but I like it very much nevertheless. So I took its name for this tune
         (which is the only thing these two pieces have in common)." (OK)

/VARIOUS/M-R/Odi/Dancing_A-Head.sid
COMMENT: "Done with the Cyberlogic Sound Studio... made by me and Sascha/MDG!.
         A funny thing for Trance's diskmag 'A-Head', inspired by the music to
         'Moons' by Drax." (OK)

/VARIOUS/M-R/Odi/Dream_In_Space.sid
COMMENT: "Done with Chris Hülsbeck's Soundmonitor.
         Again a tune my trumpet teacher liked a lot! This tune was publically
         performed (err... played from tape) at a performance of his trumpet
         class I was a pupil in. I was very proud of the drums I had squeezed
         out of little Soundmonitor." (OK)

/VARIOUS/M-R/Odi/Eternal_Sadness.sid
  TITLE: Eternal Sadness
 ARTIST: Traditional
COMMENT: "Done with SoedeSoft's SoundMaster.
         A schoolmate had asked me to arrange this traditional funeral march
         for him. I did my best, but in the end he didn't really like the
         result he came to hear. =:-(" (OK)

/VARIOUS/M-R/Odi/Fuer_Claudia.sid
COMMENT: "Done with Chris Hülsbeck's Soundmonitor.
         I wrote this tune and the previous one on the same afternoon in order
         to impress a girl from dancing class (without success, alas). But at
         least it was fun discussing politics with her on the phone." (OK)

/VARIOUS/M-R/Odi/Genetic_Jazz.sid
COMMENT: "Done with the Cyberlogic Sound Studio... made by me and Sascha/MDG!.
         I wrote this piece for Galen/Trinomic (Trinomic Boozeline) for his mag
         'Genetic Dreams' (my favorite mag) as an apology: I had promised to do
         a few conversions for their demo but didn't get them finished in time.
         So they had to use non-exclusive music." (OK)

/VARIOUS/M-R/Odi/Happy_Birthday.sid
  TITLE: Happy Birthday
 ARTIST: Mildred J. Hill
COMMENT: "Done with the Cyberlogic Sound Studio... made by me and Sascha/MDG!.
         Just a another crappy conversion of this traditional birthday song.
         Too many wrong chords." (OK)

/VARIOUS/M-R/Odi/Happy_Cadaver.sid
COMMENT: "Done with Chris Hülsbeck's Soundmonitor.
         A play on words with the German word for Corpus Christi Day
         ('Fronleichnam')." (OK)

/VARIOUS/M-R/Odi/Henry_Level_1.sid
COMMENT: "Done with the Cyberlogic Sound Studio... made by me and Sascha/MDG!."
         (OK)
(#1)
COMMENT: "This swingy thing was composed for the Jump'n'Run 'Henry' by Peter
         Schwarzfischer (Sky/Masters' Design Group). My first Swing tune for a
         long time (since the 'Underground-Rock'). As it seems, I will still
         compose a different piece for Level 1, as the game has changed its
         mood from funny to more Fantasy-like and gloomy. This music is rather
         old anyway." (OK)

/VARIOUS/M-R/Odi/Jingle_from_Lenor_advert.sid
  TITLE: Lenor advert theme
 ARTIST: <?>
COMMENT: "Done with Future Composer II.
         I didn't like this editor at all (and didn't understand it in full,
         either). An acquaintance from the scene (Doc Holliday or someone from
         Presence ) asked me to convert this music from the 'Lenor' TV ad to
         C64." (OK)

/VARIOUS/M-R/Odi/Laser_Beat.sid
COMMENT: "Done with Chris Hülsbeck's Soundmonitor." (OK)

/VARIOUS/M-R/Odi/Lax_Up.sid
COMMENT: "Done with the Cyberlogic Sound Studio... made by me and Sascha/MDG!.
         Inspired by some tune by Laxity (and with some of its instruments,
         ripped by hand). In English, the 'Lax' Up' is pronounced exactly the
         same as the German translation of 'lick it off' (leck's ab). =:-> "
         (OK)

/VARIOUS/M-R/Odi/Load_The_Power.sid
COMMENT: "Done with SoedeSoft's SoundMaster.
         Hawk/Presence once asked me to compose a short tune for a loader. As
         far as I know, this music has never been used with a loader, though."
         (OK)

/VARIOUS/M-R/Odi/Lords_of_Synthesis.sid
COMMENT: "Done with my first own music player.
         Having read about the great features of Soundmonitor, I got fed up
         with the limits of The Music System (TMS) and the music commands from
         BASIC V7.0. So I wrote my own soundplayer. That thing ate memory and
         rastertime like I drink tea and used a notation similar to the BASIC
         commands. But -- it worked and had cool *filters*! I planned to use it
         in a Snake-like game I was coding (Crowding Crawlers), but the game
         made heavy use of raster interrupts and color effects and thus would
         not work with the music (rastertime ranging from $03 to $80 or so...).
         I never finished the game anyway. But my trumpet teacher liked the
         tune _very_ much! =:-> " (OK)

/VARIOUS/M-R/Odi/Lunatic_Trashcan.sid
COMMENT: "Done with SoedeSoft's SoundMaster." (OK)

/VARIOUS/M-R/Odi/Mega_Put.sid
COMMENT: "Done with Oliver Blasnik's Romuzak." (OK)

/VARIOUS/M-R/Odi/Melt_Your_Brain.sid
  TITLE: Piano Sonata in C (KV 545) (0:00-0:06)
 ARTIST: Wolfgang Amadeus Mozart
COMMENT: "Done with the Cyberlogic Sound Studio... made by me and Sascha/MDG!.
         A 4-time techno tune (my best one of this kind so far) which I wrote
         together with a good friend of mine, Ingo Meyer. While we were
         composing, the speaker box fell off the shelf due to one extremely
         loud bass-kick (no kidding!). This piece contributed to the music
         competition at the Data-Live '93 in Dessau, winning the 2nd place.
         Possibly it would have made the 1st if they had had good big speakers
         instead of that tiny thing in their video beamer! =:-( " (OK)
         Also used in the game "Orb", (c) 1994 Magic Disk 64/CP-Verlag.

/VARIOUS/M-R/Odi/Mothers_Little_Arpeggio.sid
COMMENT: "Done with Oliver Blasnik's Romuzak.
         I came up with the name as my mother didn't like the sound of the
         arpeggios at all." (OK)

/VARIOUS/M-R/Odi/Musical_News.sid
  TITLE: Tagesschau [from the German TV news] (0:00-0:14)
 ARTIST: <?>
COMMENT: "Done with SoedeSoft's SoundMaster.
         Asterix/Victory had asked me to convert the jingle from the German TV
         news 'Tagesschau' for the intro to his diskmag. (In this intro, you
         could see a TV news announcer.) Sascha/DOS/MDG liked this tune very
         much and said to me, grinning: 'I think you've listened to Maniacs of
         Noise far too much!'" (OK)

/VARIOUS/M-R/Odi/Nameless_Horror.sid
COMMENT: "Done with SoedeSoft's SoundMaster.
         What a horror: I couldn't think of any sensible name for this piece of
         music!" (OK)

/VARIOUS/M-R/Odi/Oedipus.sid
COMMENT: "Done with Chris Hülsbeck's Soundmonitor." (OK)

/VARIOUS/M-R/Odi/Peaceful_Beauty.sid
COMMENT: "Done with Oliver Blasnik's Romuzak.
         I wrote this tune and the previous one for Presence, both on the same
         weekend (I obviously felt that I had to become a little more active)."
         (OK)

/VARIOUS/M-R/Odi/Pocket_Funk.sid
COMMENT: "Done with the Cyberlogic Sound Studio... made by me and Sascha/MDG!.
         I merely composed this piece to show that with a special version of my
         CSS player, it is possible to achieve low rastertime of about $10
         (like Music Assembler/Voicetracker, JCH Player V19 or A.K.'s player)."
         (OK)

/VARIOUS/M-R/Odi/Raped_SID.sid
COMMENT: "Done with Oliver Blasnik's Romuzak.
         A guy from Red Sector Inc. asked me to compose a lame-sounding cool
         tune (whatever he might exactly have thought of) for an intro of their
         second group, Ultimate (the section for crap releases)." (OK)

/VARIOUS/M-R/Odi/Rhythm_Of_Life.sid
COMMENT: "Done with Chris Hülsbeck's Soundmonitor." (OK)

/VARIOUS/M-R/Odi/Rock_Around_The_Block.sid
COMMENT: "Done with Chris Hülsbeck's Soundmonitor.
         Again a (rather obvious) play on words. At that time, I used to write
         either Rock'n'Roll style tunes or the usual 'cool' style sidtunes with
         mainly minor scales." (OK)

/VARIOUS/M-R/Odi/Rumour_Land.sid
COMMENT: "Done with the Cyberlogic Sound Studio... made by me and Sascha/MDG!.
         This piece was composed at the Data Live '93 for the party report by
         TRL Designs ('The Real Lunatic'). I had a very nasty back-ache after
         the piece was finished." (OK)

/VARIOUS/M-R/Odi/Session_Tune.sid
COMMENT: "Done with SoedeSoft's SoundMaster.
         I composed this piece at the Security group Meeting in December 1991
         in Mannheim. Security (Demons of Sound [DOS] being part of it) was my
         second group at that time. With this tune, I started a new approach to
         composing on the C64, very much Vibrants-like: start with a groovy
         bassline and write the lead voice last, using a lot of blues scale."
         (OK)

/VARIOUS/M-R/Odi/Sonlasarka_Dunti.sid
COMMENT: "Done with SoedeSoft's SoundMaster.
         This name was supposed to sound Hungarian. My trumpet teacher (who is
         Hungarian) knew better, though. But he liked that tune a lot. I
         composed it for Asterix/Victory as a music for his diskmag." (OK)

/VARIOUS/M-R/Odi/Trance_Introzak.sid
COMMENT: "Done with the Cyberlogic Sound Studio... made by me and Sascha/MDG!.
         Rather out of inspiration...just a little music for the intro by
         Trance." (OK)

/VARIOUS/M-R/Odi/Underground-Rock.sid
COMMENT: "Done with the Cyberlogic Sound Studio... made by me and Sascha/MDG!.
         The first tune to be packed with the packer of the CSS! It wrote it
         for the addymag 'Underground' by Presence." (OK)

/VARIOUS/M-R/Odi/Uranium_Dioxide.sid
COMMENT: "Done with the Cyberlogic Sound Studio... made by me and Sascha/MDG!.
         My first finished attempt to write some techno. I love these harmless
         intros that are composed in an entirely different style than the rest
         of the piece! At the time I composed this piece, we had just learned
         how to write 3- and 4-voiced choir arrangements at school. For
         X-Radical of Nirvana." (OK)

/VARIOUS/M-R/Odi/Vagabonds_Groove.sid
COMMENT: "Done with the Cyberlogic Sound Studio... made by me and Sascha/MDG!.
         Ok, ok, this tune _is_ heavily inspired by the first music from Dutch
         Breeze, composed by Jeroen Tel. I even hand-ripped the snare drum and
         the bass sound from that piece. Anyway, I wrote this tune for
         Tardox/Vagabonds (now a member of Smash Designs) for his demo, a
         contribution to a demo competition by the magazine '64'er'." (OK)

/VARIOUS/M-R/Odi/Wind_of_Change.sid
  TITLE: Wind of Change [from Crazy World]
 ARTIST: Scorpions
COMMENT: "Done with the Cyberlogic Sound Studio... made by me and Sascha/MDG!.
         Doc Holliday/Techno Ind. had asked me to do a conversion of this song
         (by The Scorpions) for a coop-demo against racism." (OK)

/VARIOUS/M-R/Odi/Winter_from_Four_Seasons.sid
  TITLE: Le Quattro Stagioni, Op.8 n.4 "L'Inverno" (Largo)
 ARTIST: Antonio Vivaldi
COMMENT: "Winter" from "The Four Seasons" by Vivaldi. "Done with the Cyberlogic
         Sound Studio... made by me and Sascha/MDG!. A conversion of 'The
         Winter' from Vivaldi's 'Four Seasons', which I ported to the C64 for
         Domino/Security, an old friend on mine." (OK)

### /VARIOUS/M-R/Paco ########################################################

/VARIOUS/M-R/Paco/
COMMENT: Paco's (Ádám Papp) own comments are denoted by (AP).
         "All SIDs were composed in Brian's GMC 1.0 (not DMC). I made more
         than 150 tunes in 7 active years, so this is a little selection,
         my personal favorites (even if a tune is short or not finished).
         SidPlay cannot play back some of them, so please use a real Commodore
         64. Thanx!" (AP)

  TITLE: It's A Sin (from the 12" maxi version)
 ARTIST: Pet Shop Boys
COMMENT: "Gentlemen, this is done in my *own* player. When listening
          to this tune today, I'm happy I didn't develop the player
          any further, as it was crap from the start. I have to admit
          that I do not remember what speed it should be, but I think
          it was non-IRQ, ie just like this rip." (IP)

### /VARIOUS/M-R/PseudoGrafx #################################################

/VARIOUS/M-R/PseudoGrafx/
COMMENT: All comments on PseudoGrafx's tunes are by the author Zdenek
         Eisenhammer (ZE).

/VARIOUS/M-R/PseudoGrafx/Aurora.sid
  TITLE: Hymn to Aurora [from the Amiga MOD module]
 ARTIST: Horace Wimp
COMMENT: "The first version I made on my Atari a few years ago and since I
         love this MOD, I also had to make the C64 version. I was trying to
         make the instruments sound the nearest possible to the original and I
         was quite successful (also because I ripped the trumpet sound from
         some DOS/ADSR tune - check /VARIOUS/A-F/Dos/Pursuit.sid).
         Sounds best on a real C64." (ZE)

/VARIOUS/M-R/PseudoGrafx/Close_To_Me.sid
  TITLE: Close To Me [from The Head on the Door]
 ARTIST: The Cure
COMMENT: "This is probably my last tune ever made on C64 - finished in March
         97. I really wonder why I did it in TFX 1.3 although v2.4 was already
         finished..." (ZE)

/VARIOUS/M-R/PseudoGrafx/Fire.sid
  TITLE: Laser Squadron [from the Atari XL/XE game]
 ARTIST: Dieter Bohlen
COMMENT: "A cover of an ATARI XL/XE music from an ugly german game, which was
         really lame although it was quite new ('92 or '93). The music was
         cool anyway :-)." (ZE)

/VARIOUS/M-R/PseudoGrafx/Fonttime.sid
COMMENT: "Made for the font collection in Unreal's tooldisk 'Tooltime'. My
         first original tune (not a cover) on C64 (November 95). Tooltime was
         full of this tune - it was used in nearly all notes on the disk
         because we didn't have any other tunes to use and we didn't want to
         use the ripped ones." (ZE)

/VARIOUS/M-R/PseudoGrafx/Mountain_Bike.sid
  TITLE: Mountain Bike Racer, Tune #1
 ARTIST: Adam Gilmore
COMMENT: This was my first C64 tune made in October 95 and also the first
         tune ever finished in our music editor TFX 1.0. It covers ATARI XL/XE
         version, since I had an 800XE before C64. Anyway the C64 version is
         nearly the same. Maybe if I had known that Adam Gilmore made it
         also on C64, I wouldn't have covered it." (ZE)

/VARIOUS/M-R/PseudoGrafx/Partyzak.sid
COMMENT: "IMHO my worst tune because I was absolutely out of inspiration when
         doing it. I had to finish it during one afternoon since it was a
         tune for our partyreport which was held on one weekend in spring 96
         - and I also had to make a picture for that report on the same day. My
         first tune made in an improved version of TFX - v1.3." (ZE)

/VARIOUS/M-R/PseudoGrafx/Wish_Me_Luck.sid
  TITLE: Wish Me Luck [from the Amiga MOD module]
 ARTIST: Martin Wall (Mantronix/Panorama)
COMMENT: Made for Ray's (Unreal's main coder and HQ) request. It was quite
         an easy work to rewrite it (he recorded the module for me on a tape
         since I didn't have PC yet) - it took me only 1 day and it's nearly
         the same as the original. Made in February 1997. Sounds the best on
         a real C64." (ZE)

 ARTIST: Kamil Wolnikowski (Jammer)
COMMENT: "This my own version of Jammer's tune... he made that Impulse
          Tracker module to fit XO game I wrote on PC - I wanted something
          oldskool :) . That was hard to port 16 channels into SID ;)
          Generally not too good tune (very bad instruments). Anyway this
          was my first real attempt to do SID tune! BTW the original is
          awesome." (comment by Raf)

### /VARIOUS/M-R/Rambones ####################################################

/VARIOUS/M-R/Rambones/
COMMENT: rambones' (Jan Harries) own comments are denoted by (JH). "The 80's
         tunes here, are made in 1986-1988, with Soundmonitor and Rockmonitor
         II.  The 90's and 2000's tunes are made with JCH's editor, and SID
         Duzz It" (JH)

/VARIOUS/M-R/Rambones/1st_Sphere.sid
COMMENT: "A shitty Rockmon piece I couldn't get any system into. But it has
         some cool things after all." (JH)

/VARIOUS/M-R/Rambones/1st_Sphere_PSID.sid
COMMENT: "A shitty Rockmon piece I couldn't get any system into. But it has
         some cool things after all." (JH)

/VARIOUS/M-R/Rambones/Amiga_Noid.sid
COMMENT: "From my last demo of the same name. I was tired of not being able to
         create some decent drums in Soundmon, I was tired of my C64 and
         generally this can be heard in the tune. Again I try to make some
         melody with my 'synth' violin to compensate for the lack of rhythm."
         (JH)

/VARIOUS/M-R/Rambones/Apolloguys.sid
COMMENT: "One of my personal favourites, despite the fact that I used it in an
         apology demo to Zetrex 2005. My good friends Wizz & Kaze demanded me
         to do this demo in order to stop the war. To compensate for my loss of
         face, I filled the screen with my name in sprites, dancing around so
         that you only would remember 2 things after having seen the demo: the
         music and the name RAMBONES. :) What a hoax, Kaze got his software
         from me, and me and TSN visited Wizz every weekend. There's some
         really nice filter in this one, so try a C64." (JH)

/VARIOUS/M-R/Rambones/Blue_Monday.sid
  TITLE: Blue Monday
 ARTIST: New Order
COMMENT: "Well, like any other teenager with a C64 and some talent, I just had
         to try. I completely forgot the characteristic drums from the
         original. Nothing more to say, the original will always be the best
         (the one by Anthony Crowther) :-)" (JH)
         Cover of the 1988 re-mix of the original 1983 release.

/VARIOUS/M-R/Rambones/Blue_Monday_PSID.sid
  TITLE: Blue Monday
 ARTIST: New Order
COMMENT: "Well, like any other teenager with a C64 and some talent, I just had
         to try. I completely forgot the characteristic drums from the
         original. Nothing more to say, the original will always be the best
         (the one by Anthony Crowther) :-)" (JH)
         Cover of the 1988 re-mix of the original 1983 release.

/VARIOUS/M-R/Rambones/Broken_Mind.sid
COMMENT: "One of my S.I.D. tunes. S.I.D. was my attempt to conquer the
         softwarehouse like Jeroen and Charles. I did this while learning how
         to use my Amiga." (JH)

/VARIOUS/M-R/Rambones/Digital_Dream.sid
COMMENT: "Not really a melody, just some of the COOLEST filtereffects you'd
         ever hear. Used for a short contact note. Do try this on a C64." (JH)

/VARIOUS/M-R/Rambones/Do_The_Mip.sid
COMMENT: "Ha, the joke of my life! Charles Deenen sought musicians who used
         soundmonitor and were into coding. That was me, so I sent him this
         tune, nicely wrapped in an intro. That didn't help any :) By that time
         Noisy Pillars was far over most people's heads anyway." (JH)

/VARIOUS/M-R/Rambones/Dont_Be_Late.sid
COMMENT: "For what ? Well, the Amiga had given me a 'pop' in the head. This is
         actually a song, but I can't find my text anymore.. damn.." (JH)

/VARIOUS/M-R/Rambones/Drums_At_Night.sid
COMMENT: "Just trying to see if I can make some 'real' drums... but no.." (JH)

/VARIOUS/M-R/Rambones/Fairytales.sid
COMMENT: "Another favourite of mine. This was my attempt to imitate some of Tim
         Follin's style. I didn't succeed at that, but I got a wild melody,
         sort of telling a story - that's why the lead is so variable. Actually
         most of my C64 music has an always developing lead, like there's
         endless things to tell." (JH)

/VARIOUS/M-R/Rambones/First_Rockmon.sid
COMMENT: "Just like it says.. my first Rockmon tune. Now I finally had some
         decent drums, leaving a channel free for more effects. The drums plays
         exactly what I could play live on a real drumset :)" (JH)

/VARIOUS/M-R/Rambones/First_Rockmon_PSID.sid
COMMENT: "Just like it says.. my first Rockmon tune. Now I finally had some
         decent drums, leaving a channel free for more effects. The drums plays
         exactly what I could play live on a real drumset :)" (JH)

/VARIOUS/M-R/Rambones/Freeze_On.sid
COMMENT: "I really wanted to kick the shit out of the drums, but instead I
         fucked it up by getting to melodious. It get's pretty wild at the end,
         overdrive saw and strange sounds. At 3:30 there's some action." (JH)

/VARIOUS/M-R/Rambones/Freeze_On_PSID.sid
COMMENT: "I really wanted to kick the shit out of the drums, but instead I
         fucked it up by getting to melodious. It get's pretty wild at the end,
         overdrive saw and strange sounds. At 3:30 there's some action." (JH)

/VARIOUS/M-R/Rambones/Guitar_Flan.sid
COMMENT: "Get this over into your C64 now! :) I thought that Tim Follin's
         guitar in Led Storm was too good, and wondered how the hell he did it.
         So, after working for hours, I found some good sounds and was lucky
         with the filter. This guitar really sounds like a distorted guitar!
         and no samples." (JH)

/VARIOUS/M-R/Rambones/I_Like_Choroid.sid
COMMENT: "That's exactly what I did, and I still do. He made some cool sounds,
         and of course I ripped them. I originally put Martin Galway's 'Game
         Over' drums on this tune, but I couldn't convert the sampleroutine,
         and now I don't care, course it was quite noisy anyway. :-)
         Just to remind you, try looking in your /Dunn_Jonathan/ dir - and load
         'Choroid's Back!'." (JH)

/VARIOUS/M-R/Rambones/Indian_Walk.sid
COMMENT: "My 2nd or 3rd tune. It's supposed to sound like it's called :) really
         CRAZY sounds, and I like it! It was missing for several years, because
         the disk was broken, but then I found Hagar's old disks, and he had it
         :) Uoh I like these crazy sounds. C64 preferred." (JH)

/VARIOUS/M-R/Rambones/Intrusic.sid
COMMENT: "Means: intro-music. :) Not even a melody, just some tap-dancing."
         (JH)

/VARIOUS/M-R/Rambones/Jarre_Dreams.sid
COMMENT: "Well, not much Jarre here, but that's the way it goes... This is a
         typical 'rambones' synth violin yawn yawn long melody. The (in)famous
         sound I refer to was originally ripped from MAD'69 's 'Mixable' demo
         from Scoop. I got stuck with this sound, probably because I played the
         violin for real, and I just couldn't shake it off. :) Again, I
         compensated in the demo, by splatting my name all over the screen."
         (JH)

/VARIOUS/M-R/Rambones/Jarre_Dreams_PSID.sid
COMMENT: "Well, not much Jarre here, but that's the way it goes... This is a
         typical 'rambones' synth violin yawn yawn long melody. The (in)famous
         sound I refer to was originally ripped from MAD'69 's 'Mixable' demo
         from Scoop. I got stuck with this sound, probably because I played the
         violin for real, and I just couldn't shake it off. :) Again, I
         compensated in the demo, by splatting my name all over the screen."
         (JH)

/VARIOUS/M-R/Rambones/Like_Galway.sid
COMMENT: "Many have tried, and tried, to imitate Martin's wonderful phasing and
         trance sounds, and we have all failed miserably. :) Anyway, this is
         one of my favourites also, It simply has a bit of atmosphere, maybe
         even a touch of Wizball (which was the general idea). This really
         needs filter! At this point, I had splatted my name all over so many
         demos, that people began to think there was a group called 'The
         rambones'... I had to write a looong scrolltext, with this music in
         the background, slaying the 'lamers'. :)" (JH)

/VARIOUS/M-R/Rambones/Maybe_Its_Final.sid
COMMENT: "I was referring to the fact that my Amiga demanded more and more of
         me. So I forgot the melody... The tune sounds sad.." (JH)

/VARIOUS/M-R/Rambones/Mixed_Emotions.sid
COMMENT: "That's exactly what my emotions were as I used this tune in my last
         demo, on the last screen. It was the Dexion-party in 1988. I had
         released 'Apolloguys' the same day, and I had bought my Amiga 500 only
         2 weeks before coming to this party. The first screen featured 'Like
         Galway', and me writing a lot of text about who and what 'rambones'
         was. The middle screen was the 'Amiga Noid' screen, with a small
         picture of an Amiga, and a scroll telling that TST would soon rule it.
         The last one, with this music, was a 10 point list of things about the
         C64 that bored the hell out of me. Things like colorbars, sprites
         moving in sinus, Hubbard alike drums/routines, all with the same sound
         and generally everything that was in at that time. For me it was sad
         to see a large variety of composers using more or less the same
         routine, leaving the music in a grey state. I admire the sound of Fred
         Gray, Martin Galway, Rob Hubbard, David Whittaker, Ben Daglish and
         Antony Crowther, and any other programmer that built it all up from
         scratch." (JH)

/VARIOUS/M-R/Rambones/Mixed_Emotions_PSID.sid
COMMENT: "That's exactly what my emotions were as I used this tune in my last
         demo, on the last screen. It was the Dexion-party in 1988. I had
         released 'Apolloguys' the same day, and I had bought my Amiga 500 only
         2 weeks before coming to this party. The first screen featured 'Like
         Galway', and me writing a lot of text about who and what 'rambones'
         was. The middle screen was the 'Amiga Noid' screen, with a small
         picture of an Amiga, and a scroll telling that TST would soon rule it.
         The last one, with this music, was a 10 point list of things about the
         C64 that bored the hell out of me. Things like colorbars, sprites
         moving in sinus, Hubbard alike drums/routines, all with the same sound
         and generally everything that was in at that time. For me it was sad
         to see a large variety of composers using more or less the same
         routine, leaving the music in a grey state. I admire the sound of Fred
         Gray, Martin Galway, Rob Hubbard, David Whittaker, Ben Daglish and
         Antony Crowther, and any other programmer that built it all up from
         scratch." (JH)

/VARIOUS/M-R/Rambones/Multiple_Dreams.sid
COMMENT: "The seed had been planted. After releasing my first music-dedicated
         demo, I had so many new dreams and desires, because now I had finally
         made some music, all by myself. That's kind of the reason for the
         title of this." (JH)

/VARIOUS/M-R/Rambones/Negative.sid
COMMENT: "I don't know what to say about this... It was just made sometime, and
         never used for anything. Anyway, it has a nice theme I think..." (JH)

/VARIOUS/M-R/Rambones/Negative_PSID.sid
COMMENT: "I don't know what to say about this... It was just made sometime, and
         never used for anything. Anyway, it has a nice theme I think..." (JH)

/VARIOUS/M-R/Rambones/Never_Man.sid
COMMENT: "Another attempt to make those pulsedrums work.. but no... :)" (JH)

/VARIOUS/M-R/Rambones/No_Mercy_Theme.sid
  TITLE: Mission of Mercy
 ARTIST: Peter Clarke
COMMENT: "A sort of a try to remake a really great tune by Peter Clarke with
         the same name." (JH)

/VARIOUS/M-R/Rambones/Nu_er_den_sgu_helt_PSID.sid
COMMENT: "I just wanted to see if I could make a special kind of music that we
         call 'suppe steg og is' here in Denmark. The kind of music you hear at
         family parties, weddings etc. I used it in a special note/greeting
         demo for my contacts, and wrote that it was a Galway tune.. :)" (JH)

/VARIOUS/M-R/Rambones/Nu_er_den_sgu_helt_gal.sid
COMMENT: "I just wanted to see if I could make a special kind of music that we
         call 'suppe steg og is' here in Denmark. The kind of music you hear at
         family parties, weddings etc. I used it in a special note/greeting
         demo for my contacts, and wrote that it was a Galway tune.. :)" (JH)

/VARIOUS/M-R/Rambones/Oceanic.sid
COMMENT: "This needs filter! (C64)... As I saw that Jonathan Dunn continued to
         make music for Ocean, I thought that maybe I had a chance also, so I
         sent this tune to the company. I never got a reply. :) well, I didn't
         really care anyway because I now was using Soundtracker every day, all
         day long. My newfound inspiration: SLL .. :) After having made my
         first few Soundtracker-modules, I sent a demo with some musics and a
         picture to Hewson. They replied: your music is quite good, but we
         cannot accept you as a graphics-artist, the picture lacks all kind of
         inspiration. Arrrghh.... Their music in their games sucked bigtime
         back then...  This is the last tune that I made in 1988." (JH)

/VARIOUS/M-R/Rambones/Ode_To_Banana_V1.sid
COMMENT: "Everybody old enough knows the 'Ode To Martin' by MC/Dutch USA-Team.
         One of my good contacts, and a very musical one to was Banana/The
         Electronic Knights. He had already made more than 30 tunes when I
         first laid my hands on Soundmon. I didn't know at all how to use this
         program, but I could hear from Chris' and Banana's music that it
         definately was the way to go. So I asked Banana for some help. He sent
         me about 10 handwritten pages, how to type in this bass and use
         the program. So, it was my FIRST tune ever!" (JH)

/VARIOUS/M-R/Rambones/Ode_To_Banana_V2.sid
COMMENT: "This is much better, I'd even say good. :) The sounds are Banana's
         'Rammax' sounds. Nothing much to say. I love this tune, hope you do
         to." (JH)

/VARIOUS/M-R/Rambones/Ode_To_Laxity.sid
COMMENT: "Well, I met Laxity the first time when he visited Wizz, to code some
         demos. He was very into using Rob's routine, and slowly doing his own
         player. In a transition period he had doing this, he tried
         Soundmonitor, and, not to my surprise, of course he was much better
         than I. So, what do you do ? Of course, another 'Ode to...' :) I kinda
         like this, as did he, but there's hardly any bass in it, because I try
         (again) to make some drums.,, One more thing: the sounds were made by
         Laxity. :)" (JH)

/VARIOUS/M-R/Rambones/Rabies.sid
COMMENT: "It is the first tune that I did after 10 years (1988-1998)" (JH)

/VARIOUS/M-R/Rambones/Read-Important.sid
COMMENT: "Used in a note to my contacts, to say they should please
          not join F.A.S.T. (Federation Against The Supply Team)" (JH)

/VARIOUS/M-R/Rambones/Read-Important_PSID.sid
COMMENT: "Used in a note to my contacts, to say they should please
          not join F.A.S.T. (Federation Against The Supply Team)" (JH)

/VARIOUS/M-R/Rambones/Resolute.sid
COMMENT: "We are in the final chapter of my C64 days. I was composing / drawing
         / programming / writing, all alone on my final demo: Zound Muzak #4.
         I had just learned FLD, 8-9 months after everybody else, but at least
         I didn't just rip it. I started on several tunes at the same time, to
         try and get them all to sound as they came from one whole, like Mike
         Oldfield does. This was the first one, but I never finished ZM4, I was
         too bored after all." (JH)

/VARIOUS/M-R/Rambones/Sad_and_Bad.sid
COMMENT: "It got its name after the final save. :) A bended bass does some
         funny work, but that's about it." (JH)

/VARIOUS/M-R/Rambones/Satellite.sid
COMMENT: "Used in the first of our 2 Satellite demos, this is a genuine piece
         of early techno style. Not much melody, instead some pumping drums."
         (JH)

/VARIOUS/M-R/Rambones/Scary_Dreams.sid
COMMENT: "Nothing scary here. I think it got the name because of the
         atmosphere. Do go to a C64 with this! The main force in this tune is
         that I use all 3 voices for melody and no stupid drums. It almost
         sounds as if I designed the tune? No I didn't, almost anything just
         came out by itself." (JH)

/VARIOUS/M-R/Rambones/Shadows_in_Pain.sid
COMMENT: "The bassline was supposed to set a frame for some sixties style, but
         listen what happens later... :) No no, I think this is just a 10 min.
         worksong." (JH)

/VARIOUS/M-R/Rambones/Sound_Shocker.sid
COMMENT: "A quite quiet and slow tune. this NEEDS filter (C64)!! The sounds and
         the quiet melody is what this is all about. I made it at a visit to
         one of my friends, trying to teach him about using Soundmon. It was
         made in about half an hour, then I had to go on to another friend.
         I was so busy, driving around on my moped, dumping demos/games, and
         then on to the next. Finally, every evening, I would end up at TSN's
         place, and our democoding-session could begin, and last until it was
         time to go to school... :)" (JH)

/VARIOUS/M-R/Rambones/Space_Alien.sid
COMMENT: "A crazy tune! Used in another WAR demo. :) First screen of 'Who Said
         War ???'. Remember ? The scroll where I slagged Laxity as hard as I
         could, even though I love him for his wonderful music." (JH)

/VARIOUS/M-R/Rambones/Sunshine.sid
COMMENT: "Hmmm.. another drum-experiment perhaps... This isn't finished. It's
         hardly a melody. :)" (JH)

/VARIOUS/M-R/Rambones/To_My_Friend_Wallie.sid
COMMENT: "I made this for one of my favourite contacts: Wallie/Z-Circle. He was
         one of the few who openly said that he liked my tunes, so I made this
         for him. It could have been better. There's some kind of 'View To a
         Kill' theme, over this whole thing... (hint)" (JH)
  TITLE: A View to a Kill [from the movie] (0:31-0:53)
 ARTIST: Duran Duran & John Barry
  TITLE: A View to a Kill [from the movie] (1:25-1:39)
 ARTIST: Duran Duran & John Barry

/VARIOUS/M-R/Rambones/Trombones.sid
COMMENT: "Well, a typical 'rambones' tune. It has some great waves and echos,
         and one more thing: after 1:10 in comes the trombone - it sounds just
         like a real one, and no samples. A wonderful coincidence made by the
         workings of Soundmonitor. Again, the 'Mixable' sound is here." (JH)

/VARIOUS/M-R/Rambones/Unbeliever.sid
COMMENT: "Just trying to make some long smooth, dark sounds. There's something
         'Rolling' here. :) Or should I say 'Still Rolling'... Hehe, not much
         of a melody." (JH)

/VARIOUS/M-R/Rambones/Vendetta.sid
COMMENT: "From the demo where I taught Kaze how to rip 'Rainbow Dragon'. It's
         one of those '1 melody in each channel' songs." (JH)

/VARIOUS/M-R/Rambones/When_A_Master.sid
COMMENT: "Needs filter (C64). Has a nice rhythm and some great deep sounds. If
         only I could have made a more variable bass... But, you learn as you
         go along. :)" (JH)

/VARIOUS/M-R/Rambones/Who_Said_War.sid
COMMENT: "Undefinable 'rambones' style. Heh... In this demo I totally slagged
         Kaze for being a lousy composer, because he was. Then one day, he made
         'The Force' and his 'New Limits' introtune. Sad that he put that tune
         on an empty screen, when everybody wanted to see the next, the
         unbelievable fullscreen sideborder-scroll with rasters and
         music+samples. Go to /VARIOUS/G-L/Kaze/ to listen his tunes." (JH)

/VARIOUS/M-R/Rambones/Who_Said_War_PSID.sid
COMMENT: "Undefinable 'rambones' style. Heh... In this demo I totally slagged
         Kaze for being a lousy composer, because he was. Then one day, he made
         'The Force' and his 'New Limits' introtune. Sad that he put that tune
         on an empty screen, when everybody wanted to see the next, the
         unbelievable fullscreen sideborder-scroll with rasters and
         music+samples. Go to /VARIOUS/G-L/Kaze/ to listen his tunes." (JH)

/VARIOUS/M-R/Rambones/Z-Force.sid
COMMENT: "I made this tune for my contact Wallie/The Z-Circle in Finland, and
         they used it in a demo. I had a habit of not saving my music that was
         used in demos, so I lost the tune already in 1988. Then one day in
         1998 when I was watching some old demos, suddenly there was my tune
         in a demo from The Z-Circle, and I instantly remembered it! (and
         ripped it) :-)" (JH)

/VARIOUS/M-R/Rambones/Zound_Muzak_1.sid
COMMENT: "My first 'music only' dedicated demo. Banana had his IBM Music, and I
         wanted my own series. This was it. I made this in a few hours, and had
         to stop myself. I couldn't stop playing! Because I had just discovered
         the 'record' function in Soundmon. It stayed with me for the rest of
         the C64 days; I played the lead in on my brown keyboard." (JH)

/VARIOUS/M-R/Rambones/Zound_Muzak_2-Part_1.sid
COMMENT: "Another version of 'Sound Shocker'. Better with filter, much better."
         (JH)

/VARIOUS/M-R/Rambones/Zound_Muzak_2-Part_2.sid
COMMENT: "It's reverse! - was its first name. Listen and hear why. :) One of my
         favourites. At the time I made this, it was the happiest time of all.
         Playing Delta every day, for one purpose and one purpose only: the
         music! Sure we had ripped it, but it just wasn't the same, it never
         will be. Come back Rob!..." (JH)

/VARIOUS/M-R/Rambones/Zound_Muzak_3.sid
COMMENT: "Maybe my finest piece. 3 tunes in one module. 2 of them with
         Rockmonitor drums. The tunes somehow fit well together, because they
         use the same sounds. Notice I learned some more bass here. :) And
         banging those drums! The drums in the last tune were kind of snatched
         from a Matt Gray tune... hehe" (JH)

/VARIOUS/M-R/Rambones/Zound_Muzak_3_PSID.sid
COMMENT: "Maybe my finest piece. 3 tunes in one module. 2 of them with
         Rockmonitor drums. The tunes somehow fit well together, because they
         use the same sounds. Notice I learned some more bass here. :) And
         banging those drums! The drums in the last tune were kind of snatched
         from a Matt Gray tune... hehe" (JH)

/VARIOUS/M-R/Rambones/Zound_Muzak_3_intro.sid
  TITLE: Phalanx
 ARTIST: Karsten Obarski
COMMENT: "I covered one of the first MOD's that Karsten Obarski made" (JH)

/VARIOUS/M-R/Rambones/Zound_Muzak_3_intro_PSID.sid
  TITLE: Phalanx
 ARTIST: Karsten Obarski
COMMENT: "I covered one of the first MOD's that Karsten Obarski made" (JH)

/VARIOUS/M-R/Rambones/Zound_Muzak_IV.sid
COMMENT: "This is just the intro tune to a demo that was never finished. I
         stole Kaze's New Limits-bass and tried my way. Strange result I
         think..." (JH)

/VARIOUS/S-Z/Sanden_Peter/Drunken_DJ.sid
COMMENT: "This tune was made at some Defiers' meeting to irritate my
         friends in the crew. I deleted it after the meeting, as it
         was pure crap. 15 years later Jerry/Triad got hold of this
         disk and played around a little, and managed to undelete the
         file I had forgotten over the years that passed. I decided to
         release it just for fun! If it hurts your ears, don't blame
         me, blame Jerry for undeleting it in the first place! :)" (PS)

  TITLE: What Shall We Do with the Drunken Sailor (0:15)

### /VARIOUS/S-Z/Shroom ######################################################

/VARIOUS/S-Z/Shroom/
COMMENT: PSW stands for Pseudo-Sound Works. Shroom's own comments (taken from
         the sleeve notes of PSW's CD album "My 64") are denoted by
         (Shroom).

/VARIOUS/S-Z/Shroom/Coptun.sid
COMMENT: "This song was written for some sort of co-op demo effort, but wasn't
         used as the other people bailed out. We may have released it for some
         other purpose, but we really don't know where." (Shroom)

/VARIOUS/S-Z/Shroom/Funky.sid
COMMENT: "This song ended up being used in PSW's 4k demo effort, entitled
         'Forky'." (Shroom)

/VARIOUS/S-Z/Shroom/Hey_Sister.sid
COMMENT: "Music/programming: Darren. A bit of bass-line programming: Robin.
         This song was actually a C64 version of a song that Darren wrote,
         that North & the Sea (a Christian rock band consisting of Darren
         Foulds, Douglas Anderson and Robin Harbron) performed live and also
         included on 'New Material Only'. [...] This C64 version of 'Hey
         Sister' was featured in PSW's debut demo 'Wevealed', which was
         released in mid-1996." (Shroom)

/VARIOUS/S-Z/Shroom/Spin.sid
COMMENT: "Music/programming: Darren; A bit of bass-line programming: Robin.
         This song has the same story as 'Hey Sister'. It was featured in
         PSW's second demo, also named 'Spin', which was released in early
         1997." (Shroom)

/VARIOUS/S-Z/Shroom/Test_Pattern.sid
COMMENT: "This song was featured on PSW's third demo, of the same name, which
         was released just a month after 'Spin'. Some people loved this tune,
         some hated it. It's still pretty much Robin's favorite." (Shroom)

/VARIOUS/S-Z/Shroom/Video.sid
  TITLE: Video Killed The Radio Star [from The Age of Plastic]
 ARTIST: Written by Horn/Downes, first performed by Wooley.
COMMENT: Made famous by the remake by The Buggles.

  TITLE: Orpheus in the Underworld Overture
 ARTIST: Jacques Offenbach

  TITLE: Tränen lügen nicht
 ARTIST: Michael Holm
COMMENT: Based on the cover version that is called Tears Don't Lie and has
         been performed by Mark 'Oh.

/VARIOUS/S-Z/Sidder/Half_Year_Without_Your_Mus.sid
COMMENT: "As we were not in the mood for composing anything serious during
         our meeting in December 2003, Sidder had the idea to come up with a
         parody of Murdock's style. It took last place in the Forever 2004
         music compo and I have to say it was quite disappointing - either we
         failed to recreate the style correctly or it's not as attractive as
         we thought :)" (comment by Smalltown Boy)

/VARIOUS/S-Z/Sidder/Isnt_It_Simple.sid
COMMENT: "I was sort of inspired by Joachim Wijnhoven's music
         for the game 'Forester' at the time of writing this tune. It placed
         4th out of 19 in Forever 2003 music compo." (comment by Sidder)

/VARIOUS/S-Z/Sidder/Mr_Pivo.sid
COMMENT: Based on /Whittaker_David/Mr_Wino.sid, hence the title.
         ("wino"="wine", "pivo"="beer" in Polish.)

/VARIOUS/S-Z/Sidder/Super_Frog.sid
  TITLE: Musc (Main title) [from the Amiga game Superfrog]
 ARTIST: Allister Brimble

  TITLE: Super Mario Bros. Tune 1
 ARTIST: Koji Kondo
(#3)
  TITLE: Super Mario Bros. Tune 2
 ARTIST: Koji Kondo

         he made this tune on an 8580 SID chip.
